loans.name: Ngan's Group

texts.en:
Ngan is 44 years old and lives with her daughter and her husband who is a driver for hire. For the past four years, Ngan has been running a business of embroidering beads on fabric and other materials to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a 4-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is in the first from left. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

 Ngan is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of beads, fabric and other materials to expand her business. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality and greater variety of beads, fabric, and other materials to expand her embroidery business

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 53 years old and has one child. Emely is married and her child is still in school.

Emely is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emely has been in this business for 25 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with eight children. She has a sari-sari (variety) store in their barangay (neighborhood) and has had this business for two years. She requested a loan to restock her store with basic goods like sugar, salt and coffee to meet the demand of her customers. 

Imelda has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she wants to renovate her store for  expansion of her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic goods like sugar, salt and coffee

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: From Tudela, Misamis Occidental, is a woman who is eager in managing her sari-sari (variety) store in her barrio. She has many avid customers. Because of the high demand of her customers, she asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC for her need for the amount of 13,000 PHP. She has been a member since 2008. For the help aided by the cooperative, she is very thankful.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of commodities for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue, 55, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income through buying and selling aquarium fish. Hue started this business 14 years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of fish to sell at her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy aquarium fish for selling from her store.

loans.name: Luis Alexander

texts.es:
Luis tiene una hermosa familia de 3 hijos, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá, este padre de familia tiene  35 años de edad.
Luis es una persona que es muy  dedicado a su trabajo, pues para la generación de sus ingresos él  trabaja vendiendo ganados como toros, caballos, él se dedica a este negocio desde hace 15 años, pero con los ingresos de este negocio no le alcanza para mantener a su familia es por ello que también trabaja como Piloto automovilístico para mejorar sus ingresos y así tener en mejores condiciones a su familia, pero con los precios altos que ahora tienen los ganados a Luis ya no le alcanza el capital para comprar más ganados es por ello que considera que tiene la necesidad de un prestamo para comprar más ganados y surtir mejor su negocio con diferentes razas de ganados . Pues para pagar el préstamo, Luis tendrá el apoyo de su esposa.
 Luis y su esposa se estarían apoyando en pagar este préstamo, esto lo hacen porque quieren incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis has a beautiful family, with three children.  They live in a community in Sololá.  This family man is 35 years old.

Luis is very devoted to his work, and in order to generate his income he sells cattle such as bulls, and horses.  He has been in this business for 15 years, but the income from the business is not quite enough for him to support his family; so he also works as a car driver in order to improve his income and provide better living conditions for his family. 

However, due to current cattle prices, Luís is unable to raise all the capital needed for purchasing more.  That is why he needs a loan to purchase more cattle, and better stock his business with different breeds. He will have his wife’s support in paying off the loan. Luís and his wife will help each other to pay off this loan because they want to expand their business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell.

loans.name: Gency

texts.en:
Gency is 39 years old and married with two children. With two children still in school, Gency works very hard to provide for them.

Gency runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, spices, etc.

Gency has been in this business for seven years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, spices, etc

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a 36 year old mother with four children. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her village to earn a living. 

Luisa has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, a fry pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast to help her run the business. 

She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profit. Luisa joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, a fry pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en:
Sabrina is 41 years old and married. The family resides at Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter and a farmer. They have three children, two of whom are in college now. 

Starting with capitalization of 3,500 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general) store and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings, and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in April of 2012 and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for 50,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, specifically basic commodities. 

She wants to own a mini-mart some day, and will be fully satisfied if she can renovate and expand her house.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, specifically basic commodities

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 47 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She has eight children. In order to help the family, she has a pig raising business, and operates a sari-sari store. Alicia became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing.

She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 14,900 to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store and bags of feed for her pig. 

She plans to send all her children to college so that they can help her in the future. She also wants to repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store and bags of feed for her pig

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Timoteo, vive con su compañera de vida, él es una persona que desde siempre ha luchado por cumplir con sus compromisos civiles, morales y financieros, su fuente de ingresos es la agricultura principalmente el comercio de ganado, su negocio inicio hace 32 años con las enseñanzas de su padre y solo contaba con cinco vacas, actualmente el número de reses es mucho mayor, trabaja solo, cuando su trabajo es mucho contrata obreros para que le apoyen,  su horario es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Utilizará el capital para comprar una vaquilla y pagar los potreros  para la estancia del ganado y realizar algunos cultivos, espera fortalecer su negocio para obtener mejores utilidades y cubrir los gastos de su hogar así como los de la deuda adquirida.
Su visión es administrar muy bien el crédito, tener un negocio más rentable y disminuir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Timoteo lives with his life partner.  He's someone what always strives to fulfill his civic, moral, and financial commitments.

His source of income is agriculture, mainly selling livestock.  He started his business with just five cows 32 years ago with his father's instruction; currently he has a much greater number.  He works alone and hires laborers to help him when he has a lot of work.  He works from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon.

Timoteo will use the capital to buy a heifer, pay for the pasture land for the cattle, and plant some crops.  He hopes to strengthen his business so he can earn more profit and cover his household expenses as well as the debt he's acquiring.

His goal is to manage the loan very well, have a more profitable business, and decrease his family necessities.

loans.use: to buy a heifer, pay for the pasture land for his cattle, and plant some crops

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang, 35, is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income with a business of making garments. Hue started this business four years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying sewing machines and fabric to increase her production of garment for selling. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly, and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and fabric to make garments for selling.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a repeat client of UGAFODE who is applying for a loan of ugx.1,500,000. He runs a business of cattle fattening in a trading center, and has been doing this for more than 15 years. 

The purpose of the loan is to build a water tank and buy more cows so that he can resell them, get profits, raise money to maintain his family, and do other developments. 

William is an honest and hardworking man, but is always limited by capital. His dream is running a large scale cattle fattening business. 

With contiguous financial boost from UGAFODE, William is hopeful that the situation will improve gradually.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and cows

loans.name: Vaitupu

texts.en:
Vaitupu is a 17-year-old mother with one child. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Vaitupu has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and a frying pan to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. 

Vaitupu joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and a frying pan

loans.name: Los Unicos Group

texts.es:
Daniela es una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 4 años, y su negocio es la atención de una tienda de barrio.
Ella es buen madre, emprendedora, trabajadora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el barrio “cupesi” un área caracterizada por el gigantesco crecimiento de su población; mineros relocalizados del occidente y etnias como ‘Los Ayoreos’ nativas del lugar, se establecieron en el lugar. La siguiente generación, en su mayoría se ocupa del comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Daniela es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada a la izquierda, usa blusa color rosa y falda de jean).  Su vida la comparte con su hijo que se dedica a jugar todo el día porque aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de chompas de alpaca, venta de mandiles, venta de chamarras para niños, venta de polleras, venta de jugos batidos, tapizado de autos y taller de soldadura, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus objetivos. Su actividad principal es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad como; azúcar, pan, fideo, arroz, refrescos, aceite, etc., su labor la realiza durante toda la semana y durante todo el día. “nació mi hijo y tuve que buscar trabajo, con un pequeño capital inicie mi negocio al ver que por el lugar existía la necesidad de una tienda de barrio, esto me permite cuidar a mi hijo y a la vez trabajar…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un mini-mercado en su propio domicilio. Ella desea abastecer su tienda de barrio comprando alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos en 2 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Daniela solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor para abastecer su tienda y poder cuidar a su bebé.
texts.en:
Daniela is a 27-year-old woman who is single, has a four-year-old son, and her business is tending to a neighborhood store.  She is a good mother; enterprising, hardworking, steadfast, and responsible.  She carries out her business in the "Cupesi" neighborhood, an area known for its huge growth in population; miners who relocated from the west and ethnic groups like the Ayores who are native to the area have all settled down here.  The following generation mostly deals with commerce and manufacturing in all areas.  Cupesi has a warm, tropical, and humid climate, with a temperature that varies from 21-35 degrees centigrade during the day.

Daniela has a dark complexion, long dark hair tied back in a ponytail, and is short.  Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks around her family, but she speaks Spanish in the community and at work.  (She is seated on the left and is wearing a pink shirt and jean skirt.)  She shares her life with her son who plays all day long because he is still not old enough for school.  They live in a rental house that is made of brick and has a corrugated metal roof.  It has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.  

Her desire to improve brought her to lead a communal bank of people whose businesses include selling alpaca sweaters, selling aprons, selling children's jackets, selling skirts, selling smoothies, upholstering vehicles, and a welding workshop.  This allows her to ask for a loan and accomplish her goals.  Daniela's main job is a neighborhood store for staple foods like sugar, bread, noodles, rice, soda, oil, etc.  She does her work during the week and all day long.  "My son was born and I had to find a job.  With a little money, I began my business after seeing that the area needed a neighborhood store.  This allows me to care for my son and work at the same time," she says.

Her dream is to have a mini-market in her own home.  She wishes to stock up her neighborhood store by purchasing wholesale staple foods.  This is her first cycle of loans in the two years that she has carried out this work.  It is for these reasons that Daniela asks for a loan in order to buy wholesale staple foods to stock up her store and be able to care for her baby.

loans.use: to buy wholesale staple foods in order to stock up her store and be able to care for her baby.

loans.name: Sharbon

texts.en:
Sharbon is living in a remote district. She is a hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is married. Her husband is a cook. Her son helps her to do a business. She sells a variety of grocery products. She sells her merchandise in a room in her house. She acquires her products in shopping centers in the city. She makes periodic trips to accomplish her goal. She began working this way over 15 years ago, because she needed to earn money. Currently, her husband helps her to purchase her merchandise.  

In order to have a good result in gaining more profit from the business, she wishes to increase her business by selling citrus fruits in addition to grocery items. Sharbon is asking for financial support to widen her activity. She is hoping to be supported by the Kiva project.

loans.use: to buy additional citrus fruits for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl works hard to support her family. Sheryl is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like peanuts, cooking oil, onions, etc.

Sheryl has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Sheryl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like peanuts, cooking oil, onions, etc

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 52 years old and has 13 children. Lanie is married, and has three children who are currently in school.

Lanie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

Lanie has been in business for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Soldevilla

texts.en:
Soldevilla is 57 years old and has four children. Soldevilla is married, and one child is still in school.

Soldevilla is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Soldevilla requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Soldevilla has been in this business for seven years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emmely

texts.en:
Emmely is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Emmely has been in this business for 16 years. Emmely earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Sokchoeun's Group

texts.en:
A Koh Sotin resident, Sokchoeun is a 35-year-old married woman. She has two children and they are in elementary school. Her husband and she have been planting corn, tobacco, and weaving kroma, Cambodia’s traditional scarf, for 17 years. Her husband also goes fishing to earn extra income and to feed the family. They can save up to 5 USD a day.

This is the second time that Sokchoeun has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is a credible borrower. Leading her group of two, she is applying for a 1,600,000 KHR loan. Her portion of the loan is used to improve her tobacco business through the purchase of fertilizer and gasoline. 

The earlier loan allowed her children to receive education and for them to have a proper sanitary home. She is hoping that the improvement of her tobacco business will also lead to the advance of their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and gasoline

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau, 43, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a brick layer. She earns an income running a food stall selling meals in front of her house. 

She started this business seven years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of food and rice for making different dishes to serve her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice and raw food to make meals for selling.

loans.name: Rorn's Group

texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old mother Rorn is living with her three daughters and husband in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. Only one of the three daughters received a secondary education. 

To earn a living, her family has been involved in silk weaving, a fishery, and rice farming for 25 years. 

As a leader, Rorn is seeking a 2,000,000 KHR loan for her group. Counting this time, she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) twice already. Her first loan helped the family to get a better place to live and upgraded the living conditions as a whole. 

Her portion of this loan is for solar power. She is planning to buy a solar panel to assist her with battery expenses. With the solar panel, she expects to have electricity connected to her kitchen, which will significantly facilitate their daily activities.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en: Loyce is a single mother of one child. She works with the local government at the district level, where she has worked for five years. Loyce also fattens cattle, which she started to supplement her income. She has been getting loans from Kiva's partner, Ugafode, which have enabled her to grow her business of cattle fattening. Loyce applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more cows for fattening. Loyce thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance, which has enabled her to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Senghour

texts.en:
46-year-old Senghou is living in Koh Sotin of Kampong Cham province, and she is single. Her primary source of income is rice farming, and she has been doing it for 28 years. She manages to save around 2 USD a day. 

As a new member with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), Senghou is requesting a loan to buy a solar panel. She believes that solar energy will help improve the living condition of her family by reducing the spending on batteries.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for hoeing and the purchase of organic fertiliser.

loans.name: Ahadi Kahwizi Group

texts.fr: Biriduba accompagnait sa mère aux champs avant de s'engager personnellement dans la culture du riz en 2004. Cela lui permet de nourrir ses enfants et de réaliser les autres projets (construction, élévage,...). La non organisation du marché quant à l'écoulement de produits fait à ce que les riziculteurs ne se retrouvent pas facilement lors de la vente; malgré cela il est optimiste et projette de renforcer ses activités rizicoles, d'augmenter la production et ainsi satisfaire les besoins sociaux de sa famille.
texts.en: Biriduba used to accompany his mother to work in the fields before starting up in rice farming himself in 2004. This enables him to feed his children and create other projects (construction, livestock farming...) The lack of organisation of the market for the sale of their products means that the rice growers do not make much profit when they sell their merchandise. In spite of this, he is optimistic and plans to reinforce his rice growing activities, to increase the production and in this way satisfy the social needs of his family.

loans.use: to pay for hoeing, planting out, fertiliser and harvesting.

loans.name: Kirisimasi

texts.en:
Kirisimasi is 26-years-old and operates a small business of selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Kirisimasi has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, banana, vegetable oil, a fry pan and a wooden spoon to assist her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide her family's daily needs.  Kirisimasi joined Kiva partner SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, banana, vegetable oil, a fry pan and wooden spoon.

loans.name: Siniva

texts.en: Siniva is a 38-year-old mother with six children who has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community in order to earn a living. She has been doing this for over two years. Siniva has requested a loan in order to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her run the business. Siniva hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of Kiva partner SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow,a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Chickey

texts.en: Chickey is 22 years old. She has been running a small convenience store in her village for more than two years to earn a living. Chickey has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage, and plastic bags for her business. Chickey became a member of Kiva's partner, South Pacific Business Development, in 2014.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store.

loans.name: Gift Kitunda Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her early 30s, is a divorcee with four children who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for three years now. She works from 5 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Joyce's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase on the food stock and sold powdered soap as well. She is doing great and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the food store. She dreams of building her own house.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group "GIFT KITUNDA" which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the food store.

loans.name: Progresa Group

texts.es:
Progresa es un grupo conformado por cuatro personas muy alegres y trabajadoras que están dispuestas a superarse. Todos hacen lo posible por hacer crecer su negocio y por ello solicitan préstamos a VisionFund y Kiva. Gloria María invertirá en centros de mesa; María Guadalupe, en su tienda de abarrotes y Don Juan, en comales y parrillas.

Doña Gloria G. es una señora muy amable y muy platicadora, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada con el señor José Juan y tienen cuatro hijos, todos ellos ya son independientes. 

Gloria es originaria de otro estado de México, pero desde que llegó a la comunidad hace 10 años inició su negocio de venta de ropa “A mí siempre me ha gustado tener mi propio dinero para comprarme mis pertenecias y también para ayudar a solventar los gastos de educación de mis hijos”. 

Con el nuevo préstamo comprará más ropa interior que vende normalmente en su tienda. Algunos días de la semana también sale de su casa para mostrar sus catálogos. A Doña Gloria le encanta su actividad porque tiene su propio ingreso y tiene clientes que siempre le compran sin excepción. Su sueño es comenzar a vender ropa para bebé pues piensa que sería un buen negocio. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio, Doña Gloria viste un saco color café*
texts.en:
Progresa is a group made up of four very happy, hardworking people who stand ready to improve themselves. They all do their best to expand their businesses and that is why they request loans from VisionFund and Kiva. Gloria María will invest in table centerpieces; María Guadalupe, in her grocery store; and Don Juan, in hotplates and grills.

Gloria G. is a very kind, very chatty lady. She's 45 years old and married to José Juan. They have four children, all of whom are by now independent.

Gloria is originally from another state in Mexico, but she started up her business of clothing sales when she arrived in the community 10 years ago: "I've always liked to have my own money to buy my things, and also to help meet my children's educational expenses".

With the new loan, she will buy more underwear that she normally sells in her store. On some days of the week, she also goes out of her home to show her catalogs. She loves her work because she gets her own income and she has clients who are always buying from her, without exception.

She dreams of starting to sell baby clothing, she thinks it would be a good business.

The photo was taken in the municipal garden, Gloria is wearing a brown jacket.

loans.use: to buy underwear.

location.town: Guadalupe Buenavista, San Felipe del Progreso.

loans.name: Shakaroi

texts.en: Shakaroi is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1971. She is married. She has three children. Shakaroi and her husband have a business. They have a family business in the sphere of agriculture. She is planting agricultural products, corns and seeds for sale. Beside agricultural activity, she keeps livestock and sells them in a domestic market. She is a responsible, generous, brave and honest person. She wants to educate her children. She is planning to buy a ticket for her son for a flight to Russia. She is hoping she would be proud of her son. Shakaroi is asking for financial support from Kiva in amount of 2,000 TJS to buy a ticket for her son.

loans.use: to buy a ticket for her son.

loans.name: Jajang

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the new Ruma agents, Jajang. 

Jajang lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.  He lives there with his wife and his son.  Jajang’s wife is a full time housewife and mother. Jajang owns a stall where he provides laundry and mobile payment services.  He knows Ruma from a sales executive who came to his stall and explained about Ruma’s core and purpose. He is interested to join Ruma because he wants to learn how to improve his business as well as give contribution to his community. 

As the business starts to run,  Jajang needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Jajang improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Jajang is the one who is sitting in his own small stall. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Maybel

texts.en:
Maybel is 29 years old and married. Maybel has two children who are still in school.

Maybel is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Maybel requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maybel has been in this business for four years, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Wawan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s new agents, Wawan. Wawan lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his only child.  Wawan owns a small stall where he sells mobile phone accessories and provides mobile payment services. He knows Ruma from the sales executive who came to his stall and explained about Ruma. He was interested to join Ruma because he wants to improve his own business as well as contribute more to his community. His community sees him as a trusted mobile service provider and he has a friendly and cheerful personality as well.

Right now, Wawan is becoming the agent of Ruma’s product called Mapan. Mapan is an e-commerce for lower communities. By serving Mapan to his customers, Wawan will be able to receive orders from customers who want to buy products that have been listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer places an order, Wawan will simply send an SMS in a format to the SMS center and then the customer will pay him. After this, Ruma’s agent will come to his stall to collect the money and, within 3-5 days, the product will be delivered right to the customer's door.

As the business starts to run, Wawan is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Wawan improve his business and, accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Wawan is the one who is standing in his own stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 51 years old and married with nine children. One child is still in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 50 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, Angela works very hard to provide for them.

Angela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Angela has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Thanks to the unwavering support from the Kiva lenders through UGAFODE, a hard working, charming Innocent owes his success to the financial boost that has always been advanced to him, his business has grown and so have his income and profits. Innocents started building recently so that he can diversify his income sources. He will use the loan to complete the rental units so that he can increase his income. Innocent is very hard working and committed.

loans.use: to buy spare car and bicycle parts for his shop.

loans.name: Medar

texts.fr: Agé de 46 ans, Medar est un homme divorcé et vit à Lomé dans le quartier de Nyékonakpoé. Il arrive à couvrir les charges de son ménage grâce à la couture et la vente des pagnes en tissu. Medar s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé pour alimenter son atelier et réaliser une bonne rentabilité. Medar sollicite ce microcrédit pour développer ses prestations et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Medar is 46. He is divorced and lives in Lome in the Nyekonakpoe district. He manages to provide for his household thanks to his tailoring and the sale of traditional pagne clothing. Medar buys his supplies three times a month at the big market in Lome to keep his workshop stocked up and to ensure financial viability. Medar requests this micro credit to develop his services and to guarantee his children's education.

loans.use: to buy six units of jacket fabric.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with four children and two of them go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of poultry farming and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 1,100,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more chicks and bags of chicken feed. 

She works from home seven days a week and sells retail to all categories of people. She generates additional income from rental rooms. Her major business challenge includes the transportation of bags of chicken feed from the markets to her home. She is aspiring of building more rooms for chickens. She resides with the family and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: El Shadaï De Silmissin Group

texts.fr: Fatimata, responsable du groupe est marié et mère d'un enfant âgé de 2 ans. Fatimata et les autres membres sont des femmes battantes qui exercent dans plusieurs domaines d'activités. Fatimata fait du jus communément appelé zoom kom au Burkina pour vendre. Ce jus est fait à base du petit mil.Elle a donc besoin de ce prêt pour acheter tous les ingrédients(mil, sucre, tamarin,...) nécessaires pour faire son jus. les bénéfices lui permettront de faire des épargnes, de s'occuper de sa famille et de continuer son activité.
texts.en: Fatimata is the leader of the group. She is married with a child of two. Fatimata and the other members are dynamic women who work in different fields of business. Fatimata makes juice that is commonly known as zoom kom. She sells it in Burkina. This juice is made from pearl millet. She needs this loan to buy the ingredients (millet, sugar, tamarind...) that are necessary for making the juice. The profits will enable her to save up, to take care of her family and to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy pearl millet and sugar to make juice to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lucila works hard to support her family. She has a business selling seafood in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish vending. Lucila is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Lucila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafoods to sell.

loans.name: Mouminy's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 14 Décembre 2010, lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son neuvième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit commerce

Madame Mouminy (debout à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe.Elle est âgée de  48ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 garçons et 2 filles. Elle est détentrice d’un restaurant et vend le petit déjeuné, le déjeuné et le diner.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de riz à 13500f l’un ,20 litre d’huile  à 15000f et02 sacs de farine à 20000 f le sac pour revendre ses plats à 500f.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et de consolider son épargne.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was created on the 14th of December 2010, on the inauguration day of the institution. This group is on their ninth loan cycle and is made up of women who all live in the same village. They get on well together and have a good team spirit. Their principal activity is small business.

Mrs. Mouminy (standing up on the far right) is the star borrower of the group. She is 48 years old and married with five children, three boys and two girls. She owns a restaurant and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.

With this loan, she plans to buy three sacks of rice at 13500 f the sack, 20 litres of oil at 15000 f and two sacks of flour at 20000 f the sack to sell her meals at 500 f.

Her profits will enable her to pay for her children's school fees and to reinforce her savings.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of rice at 13500 f the sack, 20 litres of oil at 15000 f and two sacks of flour at 20000 f the sack to sell her meals at 500 f.

loans.name: Chamreun

texts.en:
Chamreun, 41, is a married woman who lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland, which is located near her house. On this farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, she can generate an earning of USD 3 per day.

The current farmland that she owns is small, and it provides less benefit to her. She wants to enlarge her farmland area but she cannot afford it. Therefore, now she would like to get KIVA loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. She hopes this additional farmland will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 50 chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Lita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials. Lita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing nets and gasoline for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, so she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three  loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets and gasoline

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 63 years old and married with one child. Delia works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Delia has been in this business for twelve years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia, de 44 años de edad, se creció con sus abuelos quienes fueron los responsables de apoyar e inculcar buenos principios en ella, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tamales todo los días de la semana, ella es muy dedicada a su familia y al servicio a los demás y su pareja se dedica a realizar trabajos de estructuras metálicas.

Eusebia, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tamales, esta actividad la aprendió de su abuela, quien dedicó toda su vida a la venta de tortillas en el pueblo, una de sus hijas le ayuda a vender por las mañanas, porque en la tarde tiene que ir a estudia.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar medicamentos y para pagar la consulta médica, ya que últimamente se ha sentido con dolor en la espalda y eso le preocupa y otra parte del dinero será utilizado en compra de una saco de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas, de esta manera ella podrá seguir trabajando y gozando de una buena salud y trabajando para su familia.

Su sueño es establecer su negocio más formal, ya que planea construir instalaciones más adecuadas para trabajar todos los días, también planea dedicarse a la venta de desayunos, almuerzos.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 44 years old, grew up with her grandparents who were responsible for assisting her and inculcating her with good principals. She sells tortillas and tamales every day of the week. Eusebia is very dedicated to her family and to the service of others. Her husband works with metal structures.

Eusebia learned to sell tortillas and tamales from her grandmother who spent all her life selling tortillas in the village. One of Eusebia's daughters helps her with sales during the morning, then she studies in the afternoon.

The money will be utilized to purchase medications and pay for a medical consultation, because, lately, she has suffered from back pain and this preoccupies her. Another part of the money will go towards buying a sack of corn for making tortillas. In this manner, she will be able to continue working and enjoying better health while working for her family.

Eusebia's dream is to establish a more formal business. She is planning to construct installations that will be more adequate to work in every day. Also, she plans to begin selling breakfasts and lunches.

loans.use: to buy medications and to pay for a medical consultation for her back pain.

loans.name: Fitroyah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s new agents, Fitroyah. Fitroyah lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her only child. Fitroyah is a full-time housewife and mother. She learned about Ruma from the sales executive who came to her husband’s stall and explained Ruma. As a woman, she was interested to join Ruma because she wants to help her husband with improving their lives. 

Right now, Fitroyah is becoming the agent of Ruma’s product called Mapan. Mapan is an e-commerce product for lesser-served communities. By serving Mapan to her customers, Fitroyah will be able to receive orders from customers who want to buy products that have been listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer order, Fitroyah will simply send an SMS in a certain format to the SMS center, and then the customer will pay her. After that, Ruma’s agent will come to her stall to collect the money and within 3-5 days, the product will be delivered right to the customer's door.

As the business starts to run, Fitroyah hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community. Your loan will be very useful to Fitroyah in improving her business and helping her community, which needs access to such services. In the photo, Fitroyah is sitting in her husband’s own stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un hombre casado de 31 años de edad, vive junto a su hermosa familia en una comunidad de Chichicastenango. Juan Carlos es un hombre que ha logrado prosperidad con su familia, esto ha sido gracias a los préstamos que se le ha facilitado en esta institución. Juan Carlos manifiesta, que el primer prestamo que tuvo lo invirtió en su negocio de lo cual obtuvo buenas ganancias, y con esta ganancia compro  una estufa para su esposa con la que actualmente tiene un negocio de tortillería y él se siente satisfecho porque ahora cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. 
Con este avance pudo mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, a él le gusta solicitar prestamo en esta institución en primer lugar porque ya conoce la metodología de trabajo y en segundo lugar porque el prestamo se lo dan con rapidez. 
Ahora Juan Carlos solicita un segundo prestamo; que le servirá para capital de trabajo para surtir más su negocio, con este prestamo estaría comprando: estuches para teléfonos celulares, audífonos, cargadores para celulares y otros. Juan Carlos  tiene esperanzas de conseguir su prestamo cuanto antes, pues necesita surtir más su negocio y aumentar su clientela.
Juan Carlos está seguro de que esta nueva inversión le volverá a dejar ganancias y con estas ganancias podrá abrir una nueve tienda
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a married man, age 31, who lives with his beautiful family in a community in Chichicastenango. 

Juan Carlos is a man who has achieved prosperity with his family; and this has been possible because of the loans made available to him in this institution.  Juan Carlos says that he invested his first loan in his business, from which he obtained good earnings.  With them, he purchased a stove for his wife, with which she now has a tortilla business; and he feels satisfied because he now has another source of income.

Now Juan Carlos is requesting a second loan which will serve as capital for him to stock his business more.  With this loan he will purchase cell phone cases, headphones, cell phone chargers, and other items.  Juan Carlos hopes to obtain his loan as soon as possible, as he needs to stock his business more and increase his clientele. 

Juan Carlos is sure that this new investment will return good earnings for him; and with these earnings he will open a new store.

loans.use: to purchase more cell phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase paintbrushes, rollers, and kerosene oil for her husband's white wash services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bullock and some sheep for fattening  and resale.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from cheese-making.  Merlita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gulkaiyr

texts.ru: Гулькайыр, 60 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование-высшее, она на пенсии. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей большой и дружной семьи Гулькайыр занимается животноводством и полеводством, в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 30 овец, 3 лошади. На участке мерою 4,0 Га собственной земли, она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Для содержания скота есть все условия, летом скот отгоняется на пастбище, зимой содержится в теплых сараях. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулькайыр обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров с телятами для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и дальнейшее воспитание и обучение ее детей.
texts.en: Gulkaiyr is 60 years old, married and a mother to three children. She has a higher education and is retired. As an additional source of income for her large and close-knit family, Gulkaiyr practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She has 2 cows, 30 sheep and 3 horses on her farm. She also has a 4.0 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans for sale. She has all of the necessary conditions for housing cattle. In the summer, she puts her cows out to pasture; In the winter, she houses them in warm barns. For the further development of her business, Gulkaiyr turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 110,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows with calves to increase the size of her herd. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business, as well as her children's upbringing and education.

loans.use: to buy two cows with calves to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en:
Orepa is a 28 year old mother with one child. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, buns, and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Orepa has requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, a frying pan, and vegetable oil to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profit. Orepa became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, a frying pan, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en: Pelenatete is a 42-year-old mother with two children. She runs a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Pelenatete has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage, and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Pelenatete became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage, and plastic bags

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Chhan, 51, lives in a small community of Svay Rieng Province, Cambodia. He is a farther of one child. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business.  He primarily grows rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, he is has been in this type of business for twenty five years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 4.00 a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Chicas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Chicas Emprendedoras” está conformado por siete mujeres entre las cuales existe un lazo de amistad que las ha unido por varios años, viven en la misma comunidad tranquila y todas se esfuerzan día a día por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

Doña Cecilia es la más alegre del grupo, siempre está haciendo reír a sus compañeras, ella tiene 42 años de edad y está casada con el señor Raúl quien trabaja como chofer, tienen tres hijos y ya sólo uno depende de ellos, el chico está estudiando la secundaria. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 2 años, Doña Cecilia se ha dedicado a la elaboración de tortillas, anteriormente se dedicaba a críar cerdos y pollos, desafortunadamente ella enfermó y para cubrir todos los gastos de su tratamiento se vio obligada a vender sus todos su animales.

Ahora esta solicitando un préstamo a VisionFund para comprar maíz, cal, bolsas, prensas, papel etc. para continuar  su negocio de tortillas. Muy sonriente Doña Cecilia comentó “Me siento muy contenta porque además de que me va muy bien, este negocio me gusta. Desde niña yo ya sabia hacer tortillas”. La mamá de Doña Cecilia también tuvo un negocio de tortillas y eso mismo motivó a Cecilia a iniciar la actividad. 

Cecilia trabaja todos los días de 8:00 am a 5:00 pm y descansa los miércoles pero una de sus hijas atiende el negocio. Además, cuenta con la ayuda de una chica durante los domingos que es cuando tiene más trabajo o en pedidos especiales para eventos. 

Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con VisionFund y KIVA porque los préstamos le han ayudado a mantener su negocio y a pesar de la competencia que tiene también cuenta con buenos clientes y sigue teniendo buenas ganancias. Doña Cecilia quiere seguir apoyando a su hijo ya que le ha comentado que quiere ser militar y para ello necesita continuar trabando muy fuerte. Otra de sus metas es abrir una tortillería en otra comunidad.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Mónica quien invertirá en su cultivo de maíz; Elizabeth, en sus vacas; Liliana, en ropa de cama; Teodora, en zapatos; Rufina, en antojitos y Maria Teresa, en su molino.

*La fotografia fue tomada en el municipio en las escaleras debajo del quiosco, Doña Cecilia es quien viste el suéter blanco*
texts.en:
The group "Chicas Emprendedoras" ["Enterprising Girls"] is comprised of seven women between which there is a bond of friendship that has united them for several years. They live in the same quiet community and all strive everyday to improve the quality of life for their families.

Cecilia is the most cheerful of the group, always making her companions laugh. She is 42 years old and married to a man named Raúl who works as a chauffeur. She has three children, only one of which is dependent on them - a boy studying in secondary school.

For approximately 2 years, Cecilia has been making tortillas. Prior to that she raised pigs and chickens. Unfortunately, she got sick and to cover all costs of treatment, she had to sell all her animals.

Now she is asking for a loan from VisionFund to buy corn, lime, bags, presses, paper, etc. to continue her business of tortillas.

With a big smile, Cecilia says "I am very happy because in addition to going well, I like this business. As a child, I already knew how to make tortillas." Cecilia's mother also had a tortilla business and this motivated Cecilia to start this activity.

Cecilia works every day from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm and rests on Wednesdays, but one of her daughters attends to the business. She also has a girl to help her on Sundays since they have more work or special orders for events.

She is very happy and appreciative of VisionFund and KIVA because the loans have helped her to maintain her business despite competition. The business has good customers and good profits. Cecilia wants to continue supporting her son. He wants to be in the military and therefore needs to continue working hard. Another of her goals is to open a tortilla shop in another community.

The other members of the group are: Mónica who will invest in her corn crop; Elizabeth, in her cows; Liliana, in linens; Teodora, in shoes; Rufina, in snacks; and Maria Teresa in her mill.

*The photograph was taken in town on the stairs below the pavillion. Cecilia is wearing a white sweater.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, bags, presses, paper, etc.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a 31-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Margie has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Margie requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Margie has been in this business for six years. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy goat

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena, vende tortillas y mariscos, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, toda la familia colabora para mantener en pie su negocio, lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace ya 18 años y nace por la necesidad de tener más ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.
Invertirá n maíz, cal, leña, gas propano y adquirirá equipo de pesca nuevo para mantener su fuente de ingresos, espera tener nuevos clientes para que sus ventas e ingresos sean mayores.
Su aspiración es continuar invirtiendo en el negocio para ampliarlo y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Magdalena sells tortillas and seafood. She lives with her husband and her two children. All the family works together in order to maintain their business. Born of the necessity to have more income in order to cover family expenses, she launched her business 18 years ago.

She will use this loan to invest in corn, lime, firewood, and propane gas and to acquire new fishing equipment in order to maintain her source of income. She hopes to have new clients so that her sales and income will increase.

Her aspiration is to continue investing in the store so that it grows and she can move forward with her family.

loans.use: to invest in corn, lime, firewood, propane gas, and to buy new fishing equipment in order to maintain her source of income.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino, de 33 años de edad, está casado y tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad.- Celestino, es caracterizado en su comunidad como una persona muy responsable y alto grado de servicio a los demás, esto lo ha llevado a salir adelante y ganar el respeto de las personas de su comunidad. 

Celestino, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde hace 20 años, son actividades productivas en las cuales ha desarrollado mucho conocimiento y experiencia gracias a la enseñanza de su padre y su abuelo.- En la actualidad se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, tomates, chiles, pepinos y frijoles. Esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace 3 años, la cual le ha generado los suficientes ingresos, para satisfacer compromisos crediticios y necesidades básicas de su hogar.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar insumos agrícolas, para los trabajos hortícolas, también una parte del dinero será utilizada en la compra de sistemas de riego por goteo, ya que tiene la iniciativa de cultivar, en una parte del terreno, de esta forma podrá diversificar sus cultivos y tener un mejor ingreso económico, para cumplir sus compromisos crediticios.

Celestino, sueña con tener un sistema de riego por todo su terreno, para facilitar la plantación de cultivos todo el año.
texts.en:
Celestino is 33 years old, married and has one 5 year old child. Celestino is known in his community as a very responsible person and for his high level of service to others. He has worked in agriculture and raising cattle for 20 years. He has developed his productive businesses with much knowledge and experience, thanks to the teaching of his father and grandfather.

Today he works growing vegetables, tomatoes, chiles, cucumbers and beans. He has done this for 3 years and it has generated enough income to satisfy his financial obligations and the basic needs of his household. The money will be used to buy agricultural inputs for his vegetable crops. And a part of the money will be used to to buy a drip irrigation system as he has the desire to start this on part of his land and in this way he can diversify his crops and have higher economic income to meet his financial obligations. Celestino dreams of having an irrigation system for all his land, to facilitate growing crops all through the year.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for his vegetable crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair parts of her house and to build a bathroom and a sink.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшан, 24 года, замужем, детей нет. У Гулшан высшее образование, с 2013 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 7 коров, 19 овец, 2 лошади, а также 2,57 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает картофель и пшеницу. На сегодняшний день деятельность Гулшан приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку семян картофеля. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена купить дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Gulshan is 24 years old, married, and does not have any children. Gulshan has a higher education. As an additional source of income, she has been practicing agriculture since 2013. She has 7 cows, 19 sheep and 2 horses on her farm. She also has a 2.57 hectare plot of irrigated land on which she grows potatoes and wheat. Gulshan currently has an average monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her farm, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 45,000 som (KGS) to use to buy potato seeds. She plans to use the income from the loan for the development of her farm. She is also determined to buy a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Khoeurn, 52 years old, is a lovely mother of eight children; one is married and seven are single. She lives in the small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small piece of farmland which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells this agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, she can generate earnings of USD 5.00 per day.

She is living in an old house, and she wants to build a comfortable one for her family. Due to a shortage of budget, she is now applying for a Kiva loan through HKL to buy construction supplies such as brick, cement, iron, stone, timber and sand to build a new house. Through this loan, she hopes she can experience living in a comfortable house. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support of poor people.

loans.use: to build a new house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair salon supplies including extensions and weaves.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 47 years old, married, and has one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Norma has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Norma has been in this business for six years. In the future, Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new tools for her husband's rickshaw repair workshop.

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.en:
Maria Delia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a native mat-weaving business in the Philippines.

Maria Delia requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business. She has been in this business for two years now.

Maria Delia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Luafale

texts.en:
Luafale ia a 41-year-old woman, with six children. She owns and operates a small business of selling cabbages, cucumbers, and eggplant in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Luafale has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and chemicals to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. Luafale joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
Farogat is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1961. She is living in remote district, and she is married and has five children.  She is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for her children. She participated in training where she got a lot of options to start a new business. She wants to begin her own business dealing in animal husbandry. 

Her husband is not working. It is hard for Farogat alone to keep the family. She wants to open her business and buy honored cattle. She has requested a loan in the amount of 3,000 TJS to start her business of keeping animals and selling them in the domestic market. She hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan. It will be used to improve her family's income.

loans.use: to buy honored cattle.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 36 years old and married, but has no children. He has engaged in the buying and reselling of clothes within the public market for almost thirteen years. He wants to further improve this business and increase his income in order to sustain his family's daily necessities and to save some for future emergencies. 

Having insufficient capital, he wants to access an additional PHP 50,000 to buy more stock of polo shirts, t-shirts, pants, blouses, shorts and underwear to resell. Having this financial assistance, Michael believes that he will be able to improve the business as well as their status of living someday.

loans.use: to buy more stock of polo shirts, t-shirts, pants, blouses, shorts and underwear to resell

location.town: Brgy. San Antonio North, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Faiziniso

texts.en:
Faiziniso is an entrepreneur. She is married and has three children. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than twenty years. Little by little with the passing of the time, she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to her animals' good conditions, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals to her many customers in the local market. Many of her customers are local butchers who are glad for her work. 

Faiziniso is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way, she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. Moreover, she will be able to offer her children access to better quality education and financial stability that will allow them to progress. 

She is asking for a loan of 9,000 somoni (TJS) to buy young cattle for developing her business further. Each month she will make her payments on time. Faiziniso has much to be thankful for, including the opportunity she has been given to belong to this communal bank, with which she feels very content.

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Christine Mary

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Christine Mary works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns income from food vending and raising pigs. Christine Mary is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, and canned goods for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Christine Mary has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, and canned goods

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro, se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias como lo son la crianza de ganado y cultivo de granos básicos, vive con su esposa y juntos luchan por que sus cinco hijos tengan una vida más digna, su negocio propio lo tiene desde hace 30 años, trabaja solo, en ocasiones es apoyado por sus hijos, el oficio lo aprendió de su padre, los inconvenientes de su negocio son las enfermedades que sufre el ganado provocando su muerte lo cual representa pérdidas.
Con el préstamo podrá comprar ganado y una maquina picadora de zacate para producir alimento para el ganado, así fortalecerá la ganadería y tendrá un mejor equipo de trabajo, espera obtener resultados positivos de la inversión,  los riesgos son asaltos y pérdida del equipo de trabajo.
Sus sueños son tener mejores ganancias para cancelar sus deudas, invertir más en el negocio y dar a su familia un entorno con menos carencias.
texts.en:
Alejando makes a living in agricultural raising cattle and growing basic grains. He lives with his wife and together they fight for their children to have a more dignified life. He has had his own business for 30 years. He works alone, occasionally with the help of his children. He learned his trade from his father. The inconveniences of his business are the sicknesses that cause cattle to die which represent losses. 

With this loan the will be able to buy cattle and a machine to cut hay to produce cattle feed, thereby strengthening his livestock and allowing him to have better equipment. He hopes to obtain positive results from his investment. The risks are assaults and loss of work equipment.

His dreams are to have better earnings in order to pay off his debts, and to invest more in the business and give his family an environment with less deficiencies.

loans.use: to buy cattle and a hay cutting machine to produce cattle feed.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell for her general store business.

Merlyn has been in this business for five years. Merlyn earns more income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Noring

texts.en:
Noring is 34 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by planting trees and ornamental plants in the Philippines. Noring is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional new seeds, plastic bags, fertilizers, etc.

Noring has been planting trees and ornamental plants for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional new seeds, plastic bags, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Sirush

texts.en:
Sirush, who lives in Kapan city of Syunik region, greatly needs and wishes to cooperate with Kiva lenders in order to develop her agricultural activities in her greenhouse. She has higher medical education, but she never worked in that field. Instead, with her husband many years ago she built a greenhouse, where she started cultivation of cucumbers, tomatoes, beans, onion, radishes and a great assortment of greens. She says that during the years she has learned all the details and skills about the care and work of greenhouse vegetables. 

Sirush manages to sell vegetables of high quality and taste at the city’s wholesale market. She organizes all her work with her husband. They have two sons, the elder who lives temporarily abroad, and their youngest son who passes his military service at the army. Sirush impatiently waits for Kiva support. With this loan amount she will buy plastic sheeting and pipes for her greenhouse, and also, fertilizer, soil and seedlings for the coming spring sowing activities.

loans.use: to buy plastic sheeting and pipes for her greenhouse, and also, fertilizer, soil and seedlings for the coming spring sowing activities.

loans.name: Aloema

texts.en:
Aloema is a 33-year-old mother, with two children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. 

Aloema has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage, and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Aloema became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en: Oliva is 37 years old with four children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Oliva has requested a loan to buy banana tubes, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy backing flour, meat, rice, cooking oil, beans and charcoal for cooking the food she sells

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 34 years old and married. She has six children, four of whom are currently in school. 

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Maricel has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Maricel has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a married woman with six children. She is 49 years old and has three children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines. 

Julie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her video machine and to pay for electric bills. She has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Julie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her video machine and to pay for electric bills.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 69 years old and is widowed with 7 children.

Betty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more inventory to sell such as canned goods, eggs, coffee, noodles, etc.

Betty has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 15 years, though she also earns income from farming rice and raising pigs.

Betty aspires to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell such as canned goods, eggs, coffee, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 48 years old and married with five children. With one child currently in school, Pedrita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, etc.
