Pedrita has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Pedrita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruit for her husband to sell from his fruit shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase in her husband's baby toys sales business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 43 years old and married, with four children.

Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Aida has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from vegetables-vending.

Aida aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jonave

texts.en:
Jonave is 28 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Jonave has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fish vending. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Giribanga Group

texts.fr:
Anitha fait partie du groupe Giribanga et habite à Gitega. Elle a 20 ans et est marie a J. Marie un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 11 mois.

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (haricot, riz, …) depuis 2 ans.

Elle est a son deuxième crédit a Turame .Avec le crédit Kiva  qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital est acheter  beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique en grande quantité (riz, haricot,…) à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans années avenir, elle voudrait devenir une commerçante grossiste des articles de boutique.
texts.en:
Anitha is part of the group Giribanga and lives in Gitega. She is 20 years old and married to J. Marie, a merchant. Together they have one child, 11 months old.

Anitha has been a shopkeeper (rice, beans, …) for two years. 

She is on her 2nd Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many goods for her store (rice, beans,…) to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to become a wholesale merchant of shop goods.

loans.use: to purchase many store goods in quantity (rice, beans, …) to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
Cleofe es una mujer de 50 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 15 años y una hija de 26 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, responsable, constante y trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la zona ‘Buenos Aires’ un área caracterizada por el comercio y la manufactura en todas las áreas; Talleres de sastrería, restaurantes de pollo frito, librerías y todo tipo de comercios se encuentran lado a lado. De clima seco y frio durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía en el día entre 4-14 grados centígrados.
Cleofe es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza, cuenta con estudios primarios completos. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como agricultor y viaja seguidamente al campo y con sus hijos; la hija mayor trabaja y estudia y el hijo menor la ayuda en su negocio y estudia en la escuela, viven en casa de su cuñada y cuentan con los servicio básicos de luz, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida, como; hamburguesa tradicional (hecha de carne molida), salchipapas (papa frita y salchicha), hotdog, sándwich de huevo, sándwich de carne, en un puesto de venta alquilado. “comencé a trabajar desde muy niña por la pobreza de mi familia, nunca tuve problemas mis hijos trabajan y estudian, mi pareja viaja constantemente…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta propio donde ya no tenga que pagar alquiler y pueda vender comida a toda hora. Ella desea comprar insumos de cocina por mayor, como; aceite, harina, papas, gas licuado y otros. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 14 años que lleva realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Cleofe solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina como; aceite, papas, gas licuado por mayor, y con los beneficios ayudar a pagar los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cleofe is 50 years old. She lives with her husband, and she has a 15-year-old son and a 26-year-old daughter.  Her business is fast-food sales.

She is a good mother, and she enterprising, responsible, persevering, and hard-working.  She works in the “Buenos Aires” zone, an area that is characterized by commerce and all kinds of manufacturing, where tailor shops, fried-chicken restaurants, bookstores, and all kinds of businesses are found side by side. It has a climate that is dry and cold year round, with a day-time temperature between 4 and 14 degrees Centigrade.

Cleofe is tan-skinned and short of stature, with a robust physique and long black hair that she wears tied back in a pony-tail.  Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks when she is with family; speaking Spanish with the general public and for her business.  She has completed her primary school studies.  She shares her life with her husband, who works as a farmer and continually travels to the fields with their children.  Their oldest daughter works and studies; and their youngest son helps her in her business and studies in school. They live in her mother-in-law’s house, and they have basic services such as electricity, drinking water, and sewer.

Her business is selling fast food such as traditional hamburgers (made with ground beef), salchipapas (French fries and sausage), hot dogs, egg sandwiches, and meat sandwiches, in a rented stall.  She says, “I started working at a very young age, as my family was poor, and I never had any problems. My children work and study, my husband travels constantly”. 

Her dream is to have her own sales stall where she would no longer have to pay rent, and could sell her food around the clock.  She wants to purchase wholesale cooking supplies such as oil, flour, potatoes, liquid gas, and other items. This is her third loan cycle with the institution in the fourteen years that she has been engaged in this occupation.

These are the reasons that Cleofe is requesting a loan: to purchase wholesale cooking supplies such as oil, potatoes, and liquid gas, using the profits to help pay for her children’s studies.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cooking supplies such as oil, potatoes, and liquid gas, using the profits to help pay for her children's studies.

loans.name: Punitia

texts.en: Punitia is 41 years old with 3 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Punitia has requested a loan to buy banana tube, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015 and hopes to use her business profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Luis Richard

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 27 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de economía en la universidad.
Él es inteligente, optimista, soñador, responsable, constante  y muy trabajador. Sus estudios los desarrolla en la zona central, un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima frio y seco, con una temperatura ambiente entre 4-16 grados centígrados que varía durante el día. 
Luis es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, usa lentes de aumento, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el Aymará por herencia familiar. Su vida la desarrolla solo, vive en una casa en anticrético (especie de alquiler) construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Trabaja desde hace 4 años en el sector financiero, en un banco como oficial de microcréditos. Sus deseos de superación lo han llevado a lograr estudios superiores en la universidad, se encuentra en 1 año de la carrera de economía y le faltan 4 años para terminar. Su sueño es terminar su carrera para mejorar su competitividad laboral y calidad de vida. El desea realizar la compra de na impresora y el pago de matriculación de la universidad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que trabaja en el sector financiero.
Es por esos motivos que Luis solicita un préstamo para comprar una impresora y pagar los gastos de matriculación de la universidad para continuar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Luis is 27 years old, single and has no children. He is studying economics at university.

Luis is intelligent, optimistic and a dreamer. He is responsible, persevering and very hard-working. Luis works in a central area where there is a lot of trade as well as universities, public and private sector offices working side by side. Here, the climate is cold and dry, with a daily temperature that oscillates between 4º and 16º Celsius all year round.

Luis has dark skin, and short, dark hair. He is short and has a slim body. He uses glasses and has Spanish as his native language, as well as Aymara, which he learned from his elders at home. Luis lives alone in a rented house built with bricks and with a roof made of metal sheeting. He has running water, electricity and gas, and the house is connected to the sewer system.

For four years, Luis has worked in financial services, working with microloans at a bank. Wanting to do better in life, he has entered university studies and is in first year, studying economy. He has four years left on his course. Luis’s dream is to increase his competitiveness on the labour market, and increase his quality of life. Luis wants to buy a printer and pay university tuition fees. This is Luis’ first loan in the four years that he has worked in the financial services sector.

Luis is applying for a loan in order to buy a printer and pay university tuition fees in order to continue with his degree.

loans.use: to buy a printer and pay university tuition fees in order to continue with his degree.

loans.name: Wayna Taucaray Iii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WAYNA TAUCARAY III”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Esmeralda ella es soltera y tiene 33 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

Los socios que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo ya que los socios viene de diferentes lugares porque sus trabajos quedan lejos y llegaron tarde a la reunion.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tejidos, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “WAYNA TAUCARAY III” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco. 

One member's name is Esmeralda. She is single and 33 years old. She works in her business, which is a convenience store. She sells staple products such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She has had this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the store business. She is asking for the loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice. 

The members who are pasted onto the group photo had their photos taken after the meeting because they asked to be excused due to work reasons. The businesses of the other member are selling woven goods, selling clothes, a convenience store and a business selling food.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She sells sugarcane at the market on a retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for the last 11 years. Joyce takes care of additional family members. She gets additional income from selling tomatoes and onions on retail basis. She works six days a week. 

Joyce has requested a loan of UGX 1,100,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy a truckload of sugarcane. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to buy a delivery van for her transportation needs. Joyce lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of sugarcane.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She is a poultry farmer. She has been in this business for six years and generates extra income from selling secondhand clothes in a rented shop. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy poultry feed and a bale of used clothes. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She aspires to build rental houses. She resides with her husband in their own house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed,vaccines and a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Jose Wilder

texts.es:
Jose tiene 35 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y su menor hijo, vive en casa propia de material rústico en el Distrito de Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de reparación de vehículos, su taller está ubicado en su domicilio, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 12 años contando con experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, cuenta con experiencia en ambos rubros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de herramientas para implementar su negocio así como para brindar mantenimiento a sus actuales equipos de trabajo, con esto Jose espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a generar mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 35 years old. He has a stable household with his common law wife and small child. He lives in his own house of rustic material in the district of Santo Tomas, located in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The people in this community work in agriculture and livestock as the main economic activities.

He works providing auto repair services, his shop is located in his home. He has worked in this business for the past 12 years, he has experience in this business and he has very good personal and professional references in the area. He also works raising and selling cattle, he has experience in both areas. This loan will be used to buy tools to implement his business so that he can provide maintenance to his existing work equipment. With this, Jose hopes to offer a better service to his clients which will generate greater income and will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy tools to implement his business so that he can provide maintenance to his existing work equipment.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 37 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Rowena has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is a 29 year old married woman with one kid in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Dulce has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Dulce requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Dulce has been in this business for two years. In the future, Dulce would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 60 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Victoria is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Victoria has been farming rice for 17 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elmer Alexander

texts.es:
Elmer, se dedica a vender medicinas naturales y químicas, para poder cubrir los gastos de alimentación, vestuario, salud, etc., de su familia, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, de 35, 15 y 10 años de edad respectivamente, don Elmer sale a vender su producto en los mercados de las ciudades aledañas, no cuenta con un horario establecido.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar tés, capsulas para el estómago, vitaminas, jarabes, pomadas, etc., tanto naturales como químicas, fortalecer su negocio para satisfacer a nuevos clientes y mantener con vida su fuente de ingresos, espera que la inversión sea de mucho beneficio para mejorar su situación económica.
Su gran sueño es hacer la apertura de una farmacia, con la que podrá generar mejores ingresos que utilizara para sacar a su familia adelante y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Elmer makes a living selling natural and chemical medicines in order to cover family bills, such as for food, clothing, health, and other items. Elmer lives with his wife (35 years old) and two children, ages 15 and 10, respectively. Elmer goes out to sell his products in neighbouring towns. He has no fixed work rota.

Elmer will use this loan to buy teas, stomach medicine, vitamins, syrups, ointments and other similar items, both those produced naturally and with chemicals, in order to strengthen his business, satisfy new customers, and to maintain this source of income. Elmer hopes that this investment will be of great help in improving his financial situation.

Elmer’s big dream is to open a pharmacy where he can earn a higher income to help his family to move forward and to pay off his debts.

loans.use: to buy teas, stomach medicine, vitamins, syrups, ointments and other similar items, both those produced naturally and with chemicals, in order to strengthen his business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, está teniendo más demandas en su tortillería y necesita mayor cantidad de materia prima para cubrirlas, ella se decidió a solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz, cal, bolsas y leña, para elaborar la venta de tortillas y seguir generando ingresos.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a tener capital para comprar materiales para elaborar a venta de tortillas, con ello su margen de ganancias ha sido mucho mayor, cuenta con nuevos clientes, mantiene una buena calificación en el uso de créditos y en su hogar toda la familia tiene mejor alimentación y un techo más seguro.
texts.en:
María has higher demand at her tortilla stall, and therefore needs more supplies. She has decided to apply for another loan in order to buy corn, bags and firewood to continue making tortillas and generating an income.

María’s previous loan helped her to buy supplies for making and selling tortillas. As a result, her profit margin has been higher and she now has more customers. María manages her loan well and her family now has better food and a safer home.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, bags and firewood for making tortillas and to continue generating an income.

loans.name: Jalaludin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of new Ruma agents, Jalaludin. He lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour from Jakarta, the capital city. Jajang works as a civil servant.  He knows Ruma from the Internet.  He tried to contact the marketing staff to explain about Ruma’s core and purpose. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to start up a business, as well as give contribution to his community. 

As the business starts to run, Jalaludin needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Jalaludin improve his business, and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Jalaludin is the one who is sitting in the photo. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more potatoes, onions, and fruits for her husband's business

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 23 years old. He lives with his father and sister in Kutaisi district. 

Giorgi is an artisan of floor laminates. He wants to purchase working materials and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 200 USD. With the received credit, Giorgi will purchase his own working materials and will not have to rent them. He will reduce costs and thus will be able to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase working materials in order to generate more income

loans.name: Seangho's Group

texts.en:
Seangho is a 39-year-old widow, with two daughters. The three of them are living in a rural village of Koh Sotin district, Kampong Cham. Only one of her daughters has received secondary education and the other one is a factory worker. To maintain her family budget, she has been weaving silk for 21 years. She is also a paid worker to earn extra income. She manages to keep 5 USD for future uses. 

Seangho is a new member of Kiva’s partner (VisionFund), but she is a leader of the group. They are pursuing a loan of 7,000,000 KHR, of which her portion is 1,400,000 KHR. She intends to use it for buying silk and to hire people to construct a weaving machine. She hopes that it can help her family’s finances and allow her children to receive higher education.

loans.use: to buy silk and to hire people to construct a weaving machine.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, butter, oil and other items for her bread shop.

loans.name: Sengmey

texts.en:
Sengmey, 19, is a lovely mother of one little child. She lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland, which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, she can generate an earning of USD 2 per day. Her husband, Dara, 25, also does the same and earns, on average, a net profit of USD 2 per day.

Because the earning that she can receive from her farming is low, she has recently come up with a new business idea. She wants to buy a personal taxi for her husband and serve people in her community for supplementary income. Due to the shortage of money, she is now applying for a Kiva loan to a buy a used taxi. This loan will allow her family to have one more source of income. She and her husband are thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to a buy a used taxi.

loans.name: Tomua

texts.en:
Tomua is a 53-year-old mother with six children. She runs a small business in her community to earn a living. 

Tomua has requested a loan to buy a canoe, an ice bag, a container, and fishing net, to assist her with the business. She has been doing this over two years, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs. 

Tomua became a member of  SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a canoe, an ice bag, a container, and fishing net

loans.name: Faitotoa

texts.en: Faitotoa is 51 years old with five children. She operates a small business of selling ice cake in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year . Faitotoa has requested a loan to buy ice, sugar, a Coolio, plastic bags, and containers to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. Faitotoa joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy ice, sugar, a Coolio, plastic bags, and containers

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE COPACABANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Doria ella es soltero y tiene 49 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos y tambien zapatos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.


Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo ya que sus trabajos no le dieron el premiso en las horas de la reunion.

 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de madera, negocio de fotocopiadora, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de carros.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the communal bank Virgen de Copacabana [named for the patron saint of Bolivia]. This bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province and the department of Cusco.

The featured borrower Doria is single. She is 49 years old and has 2 children. She works selling clothes and shoes. She sells pants, blouses, and polo shirts, as well as shoes. She has been in the business for many years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store. She is requesting a loan to purchase shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

The members that are added on to the group photo took their picture after the meeting because they couldn't assist to the meeting because they were working.

The other members sell wood, own a photocopying business, run a grocery store, and sell cars to make their living.

Doria is thankful to the people who are part of her dream in this way, and she commits to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses

loans.name: Mitzy Asuncion

texts.es:
Picoaza hoy es conocida por su originalidad, su comercio y sus fiestas religiosas. Las manifestaciones culturales en Picoaza forman parte de los 382 atractivos turísticos de esta zona en Portoviejo, convirtiéndose en un atractivo emblemático del país.
La Señora Mitzy tiene de 41 añosm, es casada y su esposo es Albañil, de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 21, 15 y 8 años de edad, ellos estudian Universidad, Colegio y escuela, viven  en su casa que es propia.
Doña Mitzy para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija le ayudan en su trabajo, cuando ella puede y está desocupada.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad.
Está en el Grupo De Crédito mucho tiempo y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Today, the urban parish of Picoaza is known for its originality, its commerce, and its religious festivals. The cultural expressions in Picoaza are part of the 382 tourist attractions of this area in Portoviejo, thus becoming an emblematic attraction in the country.

Mitzy is 41 years old, is married, and lives in her own home with her husband and their three children. Her husband is a construction worker, and their children—aged 21, 15, and 8—attend university, high school, and elementary school, respectively. 

To get ahead, Mitzy and her family set up a grocery store at their home, where she sells all type of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, grains, pulses, vegetables, and fruits. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., and sometimes even later. Her daughter helps her out whenever she can and is not busy. 

She will use this loan to restock her grocery store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold cuts, and other essential products.
 
She has been a member of the communal bank for many years, and she likes it because she has made friends in the group. Her goals are to stay in business and make her grocery store grow more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, and other essential products.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy groceries and supplies, which were needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 22,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional grocery items, toiletries, and beverages, which she needs to expand her product inventory. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Lilibeth wants to have business expansion; so that she will be able to help support the educational needs of her children. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items like toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana, 39, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Anacleto, her business partner, and the couple has two children who are in high school and the elementary level. She works hard to earn income and meet their daily personal and household needs and to pay for their children to attend school. 

Feliciana operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food.  She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 600 a day. 

To help her continue operation of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, canned goods, noodles, and soda. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Feliciana hopes to maintain and grow her business to have a bigger grocery store someday. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a very hard-working entrepreneur from Intramuros, Manila City, Philippines. She is 51 years old and has children. She and her husband Roberto support their children through all her hard work. She operates a junk shop to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, and papers. They sell these items to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries and factories. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Corazon is taking out a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund  to buy recyclable materials from collectors. 

In the future, Corazon dreams of expanding her junk shop business and increase profits. She also hopes that she will be able to send all her children to school and have them finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients like spices, canned goods, eggs, meat, vegetables, etc., for her restaurant business.

Precy has been in this business for 10 years. Precy earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Precy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like spices, canned goods, eggs, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en:
From the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Sokly is a widow with two young children. After losing her husband, Shekly has struggled to manage the family’s finances. For 16 years, which is half of her life, Shekly has been a farmer and for additional income, she has taken up harvesting work for the villagers. She can earn approximately $6 (USD) daily and is able to save half of it. 
Being a new VisionFund member, Shekly is the leader of her group of seven that is requesting a 6,500,000 KHR loan. She intends to use her portion to buy potash and rice seed. She wishes to buy a motorbike after receiving profit from her rice farm.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from dried fish vending.  Rowena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Loyford

texts.en:
Hello, world, meet Loyford! Loyford is a 35-year-old father of two who practices mixed farming for a living. He comes from Chuka (Central Kenya) where he has been doing this work for 6 years. 

His primary income sources are from selling milk, eggs, and maize, as well as income from personal business. Loyford’s hobby is feeding chicks! He ensures the health of his farm by watering plants and tending to his animals. 

Loyford is seeking a loan to construct poultry housing and to purchase more poultry. Many rural farmers in Kenya keep poultry because they provide them with companionship, as well as food and fibre in the form of eggs, meat, and feathers. With your loan, Loyford will not only enjoy raising chickens for fresh eggs and meat, but also tap into the large commercial chicken industry. The housing will provide comfort, protection, and efficient production for the poultry.

Loyford will also benefit from the convenience the house will afford him. The money he will make as a result will help him pay for his children’s education. His family at large will enjoy an improved standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of new Ruma agents, Ahmad. Ahmad lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour from Jakarta, the capital city. Ahmad owns a stall where he sells mobile phone accessories and provides mobile payment services. He knows Ruma from a sales executive who came to his own stall and explained about Ruma’s core and purpose. He is interested to join Ruma, because he wants to learn how to improve his business, as well as give contribution to his community. 

As the business starts to run, Ahmad needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Ahmad improve his business, and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Ahmad is the one who is sitting in his own small stall. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his communtiy

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a fishing net for her business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 16 years now.

Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net for her business

loans.name: Enma Yohana

texts.es:
Emma es una señorita de 19 años de edad vive junto a sus hermanos y sus padres, en una comunidad de San Andrés  Semetabaj.
Enma es una señorita que busca cada día  superación para su familia y el mejor deseo de ella es que sus hermanos sigan estudiando hasta llegar hacer profesionales como ella. Cuando Enma  estaba estudiando la necesidad que se le presento  era  la compra de una computadora,  pero no tenía dinero para comprar, pues en ADICLA le dieron un préstamo y logro comprarla, pues eso le ayudo bastante para avanzar con sus estudios, ella esta muy agradecida por ese apoyo. 
Con esta herramienta con que cuenta Enma ahora, será un gran apoyo para sus hermanos ya que se evitan de alquilar computadora para realizar sus tareas, Pues Enma para ayudar a sus hermanos ella solicita nuevamente un prestamo que le servirá para apoyar a sus hermanos en  pagarle  la colegiatura y compra de útiles escolares. Ya que su padre  con el poco ingreso que  genera no puede cubrir todas estas necesidades. 
Pues la meta de Emma para este año es buscar trabajo acorde a su profesión, para poder pagar este préstamo,  y también ayudar a sus hermanos para que avancen en la escuela.
texts.en:
Enma is 19 years old and she lives with her parents in a community in San Andres Semetabaj. 

Enma seeks to improve every day for her family and she wishes that her brothers can continue studying and become professionals. Enma used her previous loan on buying a computer, and it was really helpful for her studies. Furthermore, the computer will be incredibly helpful for her brothers studies, because they won't need to rent a computer to do their homework. 

The current loan that she is requesting is to support her brothers in paying tuition and education expenses. Because his father can't afford it. 

Emma's goal this year is to find a job according to her profession, and be able to repay this loan, and also help her brothers to make progress in school.

loans.use: to pay tuition and education expenses.

loans.name: Leaso

texts.en: Leaso is a 40 year old mother with 4 children. She owns and operates a small business of bingo in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 5 years. Leaso has requested a loan to buy a bingo machine, box of paper bingo, box of ink bottles to helps her run the business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2005.

loans.use: to buy a bingo machine, box of paper bingo, box of ink bottles

loans.name: Genalen

texts.en:
Genalen is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Her store earnings helped her send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 60,000 PHP loan to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods to sell at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Genalen plans to open a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her general store business.

loans.name: Las Kantutas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS KANTUTAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Janeth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pan, servicio de transporte, venta de chuño y papa, tienda de barrio, producción de papa, producción de hortalizas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Janeth es integrante, ella indica que es la cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de pan y tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, por herencia de sus padres, mismos que trabajaban con este negocio y ella apoyaba desde niña.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Kantutas" will begin its second season in Pro Mujer, as part of the Regional Office of Patacamaya. It is made up of eight members and it is run by a board of directors where Janeth is the president. The members of the communal bank run various businesses, such as: bread sales, transportation services, freeze-dried potato & potato sales, local grocery store, growing potatoes, and growing vegetables.

The loan will benefit small businesses where Janeth is a member. She indicates that it has been four years since she joined Pro Mujer, and she joined because of an invitation through a massive promotion of the institution that was made in her area. Currently, she has a bread-making business and a local grocery store. It should be made known that she learned how to operate this business many years ago, inherited from her parents, who worked in this business. She helped them since she was a child.

The loan that she will take out is for the increase of capital (to buy flour in bulk) that she will get from wholesalers from the city of La Paz and after she makes the bread, she will sell it in her store. This form of work allows her to generate an income to support her family financially, since she is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 47 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Annabelle works very hard to provide for them.

Annabelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Annabelle has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as diapers, toothpaste, canned goods, snack foods, candies, cereals, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 42 years old, married and has four children, three currently in school.

Estrella is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Estrella has been in pig fattening for six years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 70 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell bamboo and nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo and nipa roofing to sell.

Domingo has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo and nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 45 years old and married. Wilma's four children are all in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Wilma has been buying and selling livestock for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Alizabeth

texts.en:
Alizabeth works hard to support her family. Alizabeth is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Alizabeth requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

Alizabeth has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Alizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a clothing retail business. Grace is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Venera

texts.en: Venera is 47 years old and lives in the village of Achanan in the Syunik region. Venera for several years worked at the Kapan hospital as a nurse. But now, she has become a farmer which she does with great pleasure. On her farm, she has cows, calves, bulls, chickens and several beehives  Her orchard  is among the most beautiful in the village since she does everything properly. The apple, pear, peach, plum and cherry trees are skillfully cared for. On her plot of land she also grows vegetables such as potatoes and greens. Her husband helps care for the cattle. She sells a nice assortment of fruits, dairy products, meat, eggs and honey. Venera is asking for a loan to hire a tractor for her field work, and to buy diesel fuel, fertilizer and wheat seedlings for spring planting. This Kiva loan will be great help for her to realize all of her plans.

loans.use: to hire a tractor for her field work, to buy diesel fuel, fertilizer and wheat seedlings for spring sowing

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is 50 years old and married with seven children. With one child still in school, Ignacia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional merchandise to sell in her general store.

Ignacia has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bath soap, vinegar, sanitary pads, sugar, juice, milk, etc. Her goal is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jhosselin Viviana

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo rodeado de gente es amable y trabajadora en el mismo la gente es alegre y le gusta disfrutar de todas sus festividades organizando concierto y bailes populares, este Cantón cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos como la cascada del amor.
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio la señora Jhosselin una mujer luchadora de 19 años ella es madre soltera tiene un pequeño hijo de 2 años 8 meses por el que día con día se esfuerza para salir adelante y así poder ofrecerle un buen futuro y ayudarlo en su preparación diaria, la señora Jhosselin se dedica a la producción de cerdos aprendió de esta actividad por iniciativa propia al negocio le dedica un promedio de 5 horas diarias también trabaja como empleada en un restaurante del sector, solicita este crédito para invertir en el inicio de otro negocio en una pequeña granja de pollos, con esta nueva inversión mejorarán sus ingresos económicos y mejoraran su nivel de vida, la señora Jhosselin agradece a fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, is a warm and humid place. Surrounded of friendly and hard working people. They also like to celebrate their festivities organizing concerts and traditional dances. This Canton also has several tourist attractions such as the waterfalls of love. 

Jhosselin lives in San Miguel de lo Bancos, she is 19 years old, she is a single mother and has a 2 years old son. Every day she seeks to improve to be able to provide a better future for her son. 

Jhosselin is dedicated to the production of pigs. She learned this by herself, and she works 5 hours a day on average. She also works in a restaurant. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in a new business, she wants to buy chickens to be able to diversify her business. 

Jhosselin thanks Alternative foundation and Kiva for the support and the opportunity.

loans.use: to diversity her business by buying chickens

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 34 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Ivy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Ivy has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from tricycle transportation.

Ivy aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 50 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Janet has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and married. She has three children, all of whom are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Gina has been fattening pigs for two years now and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Touch is a wife and a mother of four who lives in a village in Kampong Cham province. All of her children live with her and only one of them has received a secondary education. To support the big family, Touch runs a rice farm. She has been farming for 28 years and also has been a legal immigrant factory worker in Thailand. Touch has been with VisionFund, Kiva's partner, for four loans already. Now leading her team of three, Touch is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 KHR for her group. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her rice farm. She is hoping that it will help provide her children with a higher education and enable her to open another business.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sokna's Group

texts.en:
Having Koh Sotin district in Kampong Cham province as her home, Sokna is 37 years old and married, with five children. All of the five children are either attending primary or secondary school. Sokna's only source of income comes from selling furniture. The business generates roughly USD 9 each day. 

This is the first time that Sokna is working with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. Her group consists of three women, with Sokna as the lead. They are requesting a loan of KHR 4,000,000. 

Sokna plans to use her portion to buy more furniture to sell, in the hope of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more furniture to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim, a mother and wife, is living in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She has four children, and one daughter is living with her. 

At the age of 54, Sim has been a rice farmer for 36 years, which is her main source of income. She is also a paid worker to get extra earnings.   

Sim has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for eight cycles now. She and her teammate are applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR, of which her portion is one third. Her purpose is to buy high quality rice seed for her rice plantation. She is hoping that it can add additional figures to the family's current income.

loans.use: to buy high quality rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the maintenance cost of her husband's donkey cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes for her husband's shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies to prepare fried foods and homemade baked goods.

loans.name: Jhancarla

texts.es:
Jhancarla es una joven mujer de 23 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo varón de 2 años de edad, y su casa no tiene agua potable.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, responsable, emprendedora,  y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área rural que se mantiene como granero de la ciudad, por la producción de cereales, verduras y frutas, maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, frutilla, plátanos, papayas, naranjas, manzanas, duraznos y hasta plantas de tumbo. Las construcciones del lugar son mayormente antiguas y no cuentan con servicios básicos, de clima cálido semi tropical.
Jhancarla es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la realiza con su pareja que trabaja como chofer y su hijo que aún no está en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia sin terminar de construir, hecha de ladrillo y cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Su casa está compuesta por 2 cuartos, no tiene vidrios en las ventanas ni puertas, la cocina, baño y lavandería no tiene agua. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable, en su cocina, baño y lavandería para proporcionar un futuro mejor a su familia. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que lleva construyendo su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Jhancarla solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable, en su cocina, baño y lavandería para proporcionar una vivienda segura y cómoda a su familia.
texts.en:
Jhancarla is a 23 year old woman who lives with her partner and has a 2 year old son. Her house doesn't have drinkable water. She is a good mother, independent, responsible, entrepreneurial, and hardworking. Her business is located in Sacaba, a rural area which is kept like a farm for her town, to produce cereal, vegetables and fruit, rice, wheat, barley, leafy greens, strawberries, bananas, papayas, oranges, apples, peaches, and even tumbo plants. Most of the place's buildings are old and don't have basic services, in the area's hot, semi-tropical climate. 

Jhancarla has dark skin, large black hair, dark eyes and is short. Her maternal language is Quechua, which she speaks as well as a general knowledge of Spanish. 

She lives her life with her partner, who works as a chauffeur, and her son, who isn't old enough yet to be in school. They live in an unfinished house, made of bricks, and they use well water and electricity. Her house is made of two rooms, the windows and doors don't have glass, and the kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room have no water. 

Her dream is to finish building the house, and to install drinkable water in the kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room, to provide a better future for her family. This is her first loan cycle with this institution in the four years that she has been building her house. It's for these reasons that Jhancarla is asking for this loan to install drinkable water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room to provide a safe and comfortable home for her family.

loans.use: to set up drinkable water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room, in order to provide a safe and comfortable home for her family.

loans.name: Fuarosa

texts.en:
Fuarosa is a woman, 23 years old, with three children. She owns and operates a small business, selling cabbages, cucumbers, and eggplants in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Fuarosa has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbages, cucumbers, eggplants), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. 

Fuarosa joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2014.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbages, cucumbers, eggplants), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Zaynurakhon

texts.en:
Zainurakhon, a 26-year-old married mother of two, has a secondary education and  has been involved in agriculture since 2012. She currently owns one steer and two head of sheep. Her husband and children are happy to help her run the farming business. 

Zainurakhon has everything she needs to keep livestock at home, and she already gathers forage. She has turned to Kiva to request a loan of 5000 somoni to purchase more steers for fattening and resale. She plans to further increase her livestock headcount with her earnings.

loans.use: To buy steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is a 55-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. 

Leonisa has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more school uniforms, blouses, footwear, and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Leonisa has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future and to repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more school uniforms, blouses, footwear, and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María, de 41 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, por problemas económicos de sus padres no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañada y junto con su compañero de vida procrearon 2 hijos.

María, se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años, decidió hacerlo por la misma necesidad de poder darle a sus hijos todo lo que necesiten; para trasladarse a su negocio María, camina 4 cuadras y su horario es de 6:00 a.m a 5:00 p.m todos los días.

El crédito que está solicitando en la institución es para comprar maíz, leña, bolsas, papel y una hielera, con esto ella espera obtener un poco más de ingresos, para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Los sueños de María, son ampliar su negocio de tortillas, ampliar su vivienda y cambiarle toda la lámina ya que la que tiene está muy dañada.- Además, desea que sus hijos estudien para que en un futuro sean profesionales y puedan tener mejores oportunidad de trabajo.
texts.en:
María, aged 41, is a hard-working woman. She is a farmer. Because of her parents' financial problems, she didn't have the opportunity to study. She is in a relationship and, together with her life partner, had 2 children.

María has been making a living selling tortillas for two years. She decided to follow this occupation to be able to give her children everything they need. María walks four blocks to get to her tortilla stand, and she works from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. every day.

The loan she is requesting from the institution is to buy corn, firewood, bags, paper, and a cooler. With this purchase, she hopes to generate more income to give her family a better quality of life.

María's dream is to expand her tortilla business, extend her home, and change its metal sheeting because the one it has is too damaged. In addition, she wants her children to study so that they become professionals in the future and have better employment opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, bags, paper, and a cooler.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 49 years old and widowed, and she has five children, four of whom are currently in school.

Janet is in the agricultural business, engaged in pig fattening in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Janet has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and she has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 35 years old and a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Liberty has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Liberty has been in this business for four years. In the future, Liberty would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Julia Medina

texts.es:
Julia, de 57 años de edad, no pudo ir a la escuela, cuando era una niña aprendió a firmar con un programa de alfabetización, estuvo casada, pero su esposo falleció hace 15 años.- Julia, después que su esposo murió, ella se acompaño con otro hombre y ahora tiene un niño de 11 años, su compañero de vida trabaja destazando cerdos y sale a vender en la misma comunidad.

Julia, tiene 10 años de experiencia en la elaboración y venta de pan artesanal, anteriormente, ella se dedicaba a la reproducción de cerdos para vender, lo aprendió cuando se encontró con múltiples dificultades económicas con la llegada del su hijo, fue de esa manera que aprendió a trabajar, ella hace el pan y sale a venderlo en todas las casas del cantón donde vive.

Ella, ocupa el crédito para comprar 3 cerdos para engordarlos y despues destazarlo para vender, tambien comprará harina para hacer pan; esto le ayudará en gran manera, porque comprará por mayor.

El sueño de Julia, es ver a su hijo crecer y que pueda prepararse academicadamente.
texts.en:
Julia, 57, couldn't go to school. When she was a girl, she learned to sign her name with an alphabet program. She was married, but her husband passed away 15 years ago. After he died, Julia started seeing another man, and now she has an 11 year old son. Her life partner works as a pig butcher and sells in their own community. 

Julia has 10 years of experience making and selling artisanal pan. Previously, she made a living raising pigs to sell, which she learned when she found herself in some economic troubles with the birth of her son, so she learned to work. She makes bread and goes to sell it in all the houses in the community where she lives. 

She will use this loan to buy three pigs to raise and later prepare to sell, also to buy flour to make pan; this will help her a lot, because she will buy wholesale. 

Julia's dream is to see her son grow up and to prepare him academically.

loans.use: to buy three pigs to raise and later prepare to sell, also to buy flour to make pan

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and textiles

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en:
Residing in the district of Prey Chhor in the Kampong Cham province, Norn is 54 years old and married. She has eight children, and one of them is still in her care. For 36 years, she and her husband have been farming rice for a living. Sometimes to earn a little more, she is also a paid worker who helps other villagers harvest their crops.

Having been a member of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four cycles, Nan is a leader of a group. Her group contains seven members, and they are applying for a 12,500,000 KHR loan. Her plan for her portion is to buy high quality rice seed for her farmland. She believes that it will produce a higher yield, and then she can use the profit to buy a water pump to further enrich her farm.

loans.use: to buy high quality rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sren's Group

texts.en:
Sren is a villager living in a small town in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. Aged 52, she is married but has no children. For 34 years, she and her husband have been farming rice to make a living. It earns her about 8 USD each day.

As a new member with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and the leader of her group of two, Sren is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR. She plans to use her loan portion to buy potash and rice seed for her rice plantation. She hopes that her harvest will be more productive.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. She has a business of bazaar of clothes. Age 37 years; she is married. It is clear that Betty works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, improve the living conditions.
Betty is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Leang Him's Group

texts.en: A Tbaung Khmum resident, Leang Him and her husband have two children in school. They have been farming rice for fourteen years. Leang Him is the leader of her group and she has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for two cycles. She is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 KHR to support her rice field. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy fertilizer and rice seed. Her goal is to keep providing her kids with needed education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Cumadura Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está conformado por tres mujeres (Shorlina, Hipolita y Pastora María) de la  etnia miskita, viven en Bilwi. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan  por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de comida y pulpería. Escogieron el nombre de cumadura, ya que en miskito significa Arcoiris. Son mujeres que han tomado la decisión de trabajar juntas para salir adelante y ser ejemplos para otras mujeres, que llegarán a superarse. 

Pastora María: Es una mujer cordial, Integrante del Grupo Solidario Cumadura, casada, tiene 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 11 años que estudia su 5to grado de primaria. Desde hace 8 años, brinda el servicio de comideria y refresquería en la parada de buses de Bilwi en un tramo que alquila, pagando una mensualidad de C$100 (Cien Córdobas). Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración de comida y refrescos naturales. Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su local y ampliar para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes y ampliar su menú.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three women: Shorlina, Hipolita, and Pastora María.  Their ethnicity is Miskita, and they live in Bilwi.  They are enterprising women who fight to make their small food and grocery store businesses grow. They chose the name “Cumadura” because it means “rainbow” in Miskito.  They are women who have made the decision to work together to get ahead, and to be examples for other women who will overcome life’s obstacles.

Pastora María is a friendly woman, and a member of the Cumadura Solidarity Group.  She is 29 years old and married with one child, age 11, who is studying in the 5th grade in primary school.  For 8 years, she has been providing a food and soft drink service in a space that she rents for 100 Córdobas  [about $3.75]  a month, at the bus stop in Bilwi.  

She is requesting financing in order to purchase supplies and ingredients for making food and natural soft drinks.  Her dream is to improve the infrastructure of her shop and expand it in order to offer more comfort to her customers, and expand her menu.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients for making food and natural soft drinks.

loans.name: Saron Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (Dalia, Reyna y Teresita), de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, se organizaron hace aproximadamente un año, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para sus pequeños negocios de: Venta de ropa usada y carbón, mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

Reyna: Es integrante del grupo solidario Saron, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, originaria de Waspam Rio Coco, llegó a vivir a Bilwi en el período que evacuaron a toda la población del Río Coco en los años 80. Tiene 38 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 8 años se dedica a la comercialización de carbón en uno de los mercados del municipio. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: 15 sacos de carbón en la comunidades donde lo producen como Betania y Tronquera, venderlos a precios accesibles a su clientela de la ciudad de Bilwi. Ella sueña con tener un negocio próspero y construir su propia vivienda, actualmente habita en la vivienda de su cuñada.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three determined women (Dalia, Reyna and Teresita) from the Miskita ethnic group in the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They organized the group approximately one year ago, with the goal of obtaining financing for their small businesses -- selling used clothing and charcoal -- improving their incomes, and improving their standard of living. They want to cover their households' basic needs, ensure that their children will get an education, and expand their businesses. 

Reyna is a member of the Saron communal bank. She is a cheerful and hard-working woman, originally from Waspam Rio Coco. She came to live in Bilwi when the entire population of Río Coco was evacuated in the 1980s. She is 38 years old and married, with three adolescent children who are in secondary school. With the aim of helping with the household expenses, she has worked for the past 8 years selling charcoal in one of the markets. She is requesting a loan to buy 15 sacks of charcoal in the communities where it is produced, such as Betania and Tronquera, in order to sell it at affordable prices to her customers in the city of Bilwi. Her dreams are to have a prosperous business and build her own house; currently, she lives in her sister-in-law's home.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of charcoal in the communities where it is produced.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy prawns, lobster, fish, snails, and crabs and diversify her product line so she can establish a small new clothing store in her home

loans.name: Yolanda Evelin

texts.es: Yolanda de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside y ya tiene muchos clientes, gracias a las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se el presentan en su hogar, Yolanda está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, bonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno donde desea realizar sus siembras que es el que muestra en la fotografía y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 47 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and son. Since 15 years ago, she makes a living farming corn and sorghum; she sells her crops around the area where she resides and has many clients. Thanks to the earnings she obtains, she is able to pay for some of the expenses that her household requires.

Yolanda is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure and pest control products to improve the land where she farms (shown in the picture) and in this way, increase her revenues and enhance her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control products to improve her land.

loans.name: Tupendane C Group

texts.en:
Olaf is in his early 40s. He is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. 

For the past 3 years, Olaf has been running a general store where he works daily from 7am until 10pm. This is his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. His past loans were used to improve his general store, all of which he successfully repaid. He was able to use the profits to help pay for his children's school fees, food, and other household expenses. 

Olaf will use his loan portion to purchase items to restock his general store. His dream is to one day be able to purchase cows and goats. 

Olaf will share this loan with his loan group, Tupendane C, which consists of 3 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to restock his general store.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Tayipa Kame Group

texts.es: Doña Marisol es una de las integrantes del Banco Tayipa Kame, un grupo de 11 mujeres indígenas de la zona de Talamanca en Limón. Su nombre está escrito en su dialecto indígena y significa “Mujeres Trabajando”. Marisol tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 2 niños. Ella hace varios años se dedica a confeccionar ropa y también cose a la medida, después de haber tomado varios cursos en el Instituto Nacional de Aprendizaje.
