Tiene como actividad paralela para generar ingresos a su hogar la cría de pollos, debido a que su esposo tiene trabajo temporal y los salarios en esa zona son muy bajos. Ella aporta a los gastos del hogar y también al estudio de sus hijos. Este es su tercer crédito y se siente muy motivada con la Fundación, debido a que le ha ayudado con sus proyectos y ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Está nueva inversión será para comprar materia prima como telas, hilos, encajes y más. Uno de los sueños de Marisol es acondicionar un cuarto de su casa para convertirlo en un pequeño taller de costura. Junto con ella hay cuatro socias más que van a invertir en la cría de pollos y el comercio ambulante de perfumes y productos omnilife.
texts.en:
The Tayipa Kame Communal Bank consists of 11 members, all indigenous women from the Talamanca region in Limón Province. The name "Tayipa Kame" is from the local indigenous dialect and translates into Spanish as "Mujeres Trabajando," or "Women Working" in English.   

Doña Marisol is one of the Tayipa Kame members, and is 35 years old, married, and the mother of two children. A few years ago, she studied dressmaking, taking several courses at the National Training Institute (Instituto Nacional de Aprendizaje in Spanish). She then started making clothes and doing tailoring jobs to order. 

Marisol's husband does seasonal work, and wages across the reason are very low. She therefore has a second business that provides another source of income, raising chickens at her home. Marisol's two businesses generate much of the income her family needs to meet its household expenses and pay for her children's education. 

This is Marisol's  third loan, and she's very excited about working with the Foundation. The organization has supported her businesses before, and allowed her to improve her family's living conditions. This new investment will be for the purchase of essential supplies such as cloth, thread, and a small number of chickens. 
 
One of Doña Marisol's ambitions is to renovate a room in her house and turn it into a small dressmaking and tailoring shop. She also has four partners, who will use the loan to invest in their businesses raising chickens and selling perfumes and Omnilife products to customers on the street and in their homes.

loans.use: to buy essential supplies such as cloth, thread, and a small number of chickens

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children and both of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She operates a retail shop in a space that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 from MCDT–SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, and flour. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, beans, flour, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Nedime

texts.en:
Nedime covered her medical expenses with your previous loan, and she is very thankful to you because since she started taking medicines, the aches in her knees and joints have diminished and she has been able to move around a bit.

Now she needs another loan, to make some repairs to the old roofing of her house because it has started leaking inside already, due to heavy snowing and pouring rains.

loans.use: to repair the roofing of her old and damaged house

loans.name: Diana Yolanda

texts.es: Diana es madre soltera, tiene 29 años y su hija tiene 6 años de edad y ya asiste a la escuela, Diana vive con su madre, hermanos y su hija,  Diana saca adelante a su hija trabajando en la crianza de animales menores y en la agricultura, ella necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca lechera y por medio de la venta de la leche logra tener algo mas de ingresos y que a su hija no le haga falta por lo menos lo indispensable para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Diana, aged 29, is a single mother. Her daughter is 6 years old and already goes to school. Diana lives with her mother, her siblings, and her daughter.

Diana provides for her daughter by raising small animals and farming. 

She needs a loan to buy a cow. She will sell the milk to be able to generate more income so that she will give her daughter everything she needs to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao lives in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province with her husband and three young children that are attending primary and secondary school.

Her husband is a construction worker, while she is a garment factory worker. Together both of them earn 7.50 USD a day. 

Sreymao has successfully repaid the previous loans that she had with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is applying for a third loan that consists of 2,500,000 KHR. While the former loans enabled her to improve her house, she plans to use the current loan to repair her house and to buy a motorbike to commute. She hopes that they can go to work on time with the motorbike and have better living space.

loans.use: to repair her house and to buy a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Iuna

texts.en:
Iuna is a 58-year-old mother with five children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her village to earn a living. 

Iuna has requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast

loans.name: Mandiaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mandiaye vient pour la seconde fois solliciter un crédit pour mettre en point son projet. Il travaille avec un de ses collègues avec qui il partage aussi les bénéfices. Avec le crédit, Mandiaye aimerait terminer la construction du poulailler qu’il a démarré. Il va continuer à collaborer avec son collègue.
Marié et père de famille, Mandiaye est retraité récemment et n’a pas encore fini de monter son entreprise qu’il a démarré il y a 4 ans de cela : un grand poulailler dont les recettes pourront assurer les charges du foyer.
Mandiaye pense aussi à diversifier son activité en cherchant un verger et y plantant des arbres fruitiers. Quand son capital sera fructifié, il pensera après à ouvrir une école.
texts.en:
Mr. Mandiaye is married with children. Recently retired, he is still working on a new business venture that he started four years ago: a large chicken coop generating enough money to support his household. He works with a colleague with whom he also shares the revenue. 

Mandiaye is seeking a second loan to pursue this project. He will use the funds to finish building the chicken coop with his colleague. 

Mandiaye is also thinking of diversifying his activity by finding an orchard to plant fruit trees. Once his business ventures are profitable, he will consider opening a school.

loans.use: to finish building a chicken coop for his poultry raising business.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonila, 49, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and has three children, of which only one is presently in school. She has dedicated herself in raising her children and providing for their needs. She has a small business, which is her source of income to fund their everyday expenses.

Leonisa is in the furniture making business. She makes chairs, tables, and benches out of wood. Filipinos love to use wooden furniture since it is cooler, durable and more comfortable in a tropical country like Philippines. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use to buy wood, varnish and other materials needed in her furniture making business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial aid that will be given her, for it will surely help in their daily sustenance and the schooling of her child.

Leonisa hopes to be able to expand her business and put up a furniture store someday. She dreams of giving her family a better life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for wood, varnish and other materials to make furniture for sale.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house. The family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

Harriet makes chips and sells them at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years and works seven days a week. Factors that have posed major challenges for Harriet include power shortages and the seasonal nature of Irish potato availability. She would also like to buy better serving utensils for her customers. Her goal is to attract more customers.

She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX (Uganda shillings) from MCDT SACCO to buy Irish potatoes, cabbages, cooking oil, charcoal, and tomato sauce.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cabbages, and cooking oil

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna, por el apoyo que siente que la institución le brinda y por la necesidad de contar con un mejor inventario se ha decidido por un nuevo financiamiento que será de ayuda para comprar guardacabos, hilos de colores y de distinto grosor para la elaboración de hamacas y surtir los pedidos de la temporada.
Con el préstamo anterior Reyna ha tenido su negocio de elaboración y venta de hamacas surtido para satisfacer a sus clientes, su situación económica está mejorando, su familia se mantiene unida y con mejor alimentación.
texts.en:
Reyna, because of the support she feels the institution provides her and the need to improve her inventory, has decided on a new loan which will help to buy thimbles, color threads of different thicknesses to make hammocks to fill orders for the season.

With the previous loan, Reyna has kept her business of making and selling hammocks, well stocked, to satisfy her customers. Her economic situation is improving, her family remains together and better nourished.

loans.use: buy thimbles, color threads of different thicknesses to make hammocks to fill orders for the season

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns income from poultry. Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 13,500 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nails, wood, and paint for her furniture making business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like nails, wood, and paint

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy potash

loans.name: Vahram

texts.en:
Vahram lives in the town of Masis with his wife and two children. For five years, Vahram has been providing a taxi service. Using his own car, Vahram runs the taxi service in Yerevan and Masis towns. 

As Vahram's wife is not working and takes care of their children and household, he is the only breadwinner in the family. Vahram has applied for this loan to ask lenders to support him with renovation of the car and the purchase of new tires. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the car and purchase new tires

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es:
Doña María de 57 años, es un ejemplo de lucha y perseverancia, ya que todos los esfuerzos que hace son para que su hijo salga adelante. Como a su edad es difícil encontrar un empleo estable, se animó a poner una pulpería en su casa, para ayudarse con los gastos  del hogar y los gastos escolares. También, ofrece otro tipo de mercadería, como es la venta de cosméticos, que le genera un ingreso extra.
  El sueño de María es convertir la pulpería  en una distribuidora, pero ella tiene presente que eso lleva tiempo. Por ello, solicita el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chucherías, papel higiénico, etc. Además, comprará cosméticos, pues cada día aumenta su clientela y eso le da jugosas ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña María is 57 years old, and is an example of drive and perserverence, since all of her efforts are made so that her son can get ahead. As at her age it is difficult to find a stable job, she came up with the idea of opening a variety store in her house to help with household and school costs. She also sells cosmetics, which brings her a little extra income. 

Maria's dream is to convert her store into a distribution centre, but she understands that this would take time. Right now, she is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, candies, toilet paper etc, as well as to buy cosmetics. Everyday her customer base is growing, which is helping her earn more.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, toilet paper, etc. Also, she will buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Nehad

texts.en:
Nehad is a 40-year-old married woman from Yatta, a village near the city of Hebron. She lives with her old husband and five children: two sons and three daughters. Her sons are workers, earning low incomes.

Nehad works in sewing, making traditional pieces. It is a very good business but the income is low. Nehad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy textiles and yarn for her sewing workshop. These purchases will improve her work and increase her productivity.

Nehad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy textiles and yarn for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is a 20-year-old mother with one child. She runs and operates a small business selling pancakes, buns, and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Veronika has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, a frying pan, and vegetable oil to help her run the business. Veronika hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, a frying pan, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Moanasina

texts.en:
Moanasina is 20 years old. She operates a small business selling ice cakes in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Moanasina joined SPBD in 2015 and has requested a loan to buy an ice bag, a sack of sugar, coolio, plastic bags, and containers for her business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs.

loans.use: to buy an ice bag, a sack of sugar, coolio, plastic bags, and containers

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr lives in the town of Meghri where he runs a taxi service. He lives with his family. 

Norayr is contractual army officer. In addition to that work, he drives his own car as a taxi. To be able to improve the working condition of the car, he has now applied for this loan. Norayr asks lenders to support him to pay for renovation of the car, and to purchase gas and new tires. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car, gas and new tires

loans.name: Cecilia Guadalupe

texts.es: Cecilia de 31 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura su principal actividad agrícola es el cultivo de maíz y maicillo se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años y gracias a su trabajo es como logra salir adelante con su familia, Cecilia vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella está solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de semillas, fungicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y poder darle una mejora al terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder tener un mejor cultivo y así mismo tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Cecilia, of 31 years of age, makes a living from agriculture; her main agricultural activity is the farming of corn and sorghum. She has been working at this for 10 years and thanks to her work, this is how she gets her family ahead.

Cecilia lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase seeds, fungicides, fertilizers, manure, pest control products and to be able to improve the land shown in the picture, to have a better crop and thus an increased income.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fungicides, fertilizers, manure, pest control products and to be able to improve her land

loans.name: Shyqyri

texts.en:
Shyqyri is in the wholesale produce business, and he will use this loan for this purpose, just like the previous one.

In addition to the activity above, which he has been running for almost the past ten years, he's got also seven dynym of agricultural land planted with an olive grove, grapevines and also seasonal crops such as beans, onions and potatoes. To cover the family's dairy needs, he has two goats of a good breed, and he makes some cash from the selling of olives and grapes. One of his children, his daughter, works in a nearby city at a fish factory that is operated by Italian investors.

loans.use: to buy fresh agricultural produce to sell to the local market

loans.name: Emerlita

texts.en:
Her name is Emerlita, 57, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Jimmy, an OFW, she has three children, of which two are working and the youngest is in high school. Emerlita works hard to meet their daily household needs and the schooling of her children. 

Emerlita is in a food business. She has operated an eatery stall for a number of years. In the Philippines, a food stall is a common sight, especially in populated areas. Working class usually buy their meals at food stalls, sold at reasonable prices, for convenience and to save money than to cook at home. The working class just eat their home-cooked meals at the end of the day with their family. Emerlita is a good cook, that is why her food stall is popular in her area, with neighbors and the local working community as her regular customers. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 net income a day.

To help her maintain her business, Emerlita is requesting for a PHP 40,000 loan to buy ingredients, like pork, fish, chicken, and seasonings that are needed for her cooking. She is encouraged by the good turnout of her food stall. She is thanking God in advance for the financial aid that will be given her, for it will surely help fund her daily needs and her child's education.

Elvira dreams to build and expand her business to secure her child's college education. She prays for a healthy and happy family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microrfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients, such as fresh meat, vegetables, oil, and condiments needed for her food stall.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.pt:
A senhora  Angelica e pensionista tem 56 anos de idade casada mãe de 7 filhos dos quais 5 já maiores e 2  a estudarem sustenta também 2 netos dos quais um que vive com ela e outro enviando arrenda também dependências na sua casa .
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar cimento, ferro, areia blocos para a sua obra junto a sua casa.
Seus sonhos e esperançaspara o futuro ter uma viatura mini bus para usar como transporte semi  colectivo de passageiros reforçando a renda familiar.
Diz que tem como desafios ter uma machamba onde poderá fazer o cultivo de diversos produtos para o consumo familiar e vender a comunidade.
texts.en:
Angelica, age 56, is a retiree who is married and the mother of seven children, five of whom are adults and two of whom are school-aged. She also supports two grandchildren, one of whom lives with her, and the other who she helps with rent and has his own dependents in his house.

With this loan, she will buy cement, rebar, gravel, and concrete blocks for her home improvement work. Her dream for the future is to have a minibus to use transporting passengers for hire, to help supplement her household income. She says that she would also like to have a plot of land to grow various crops for her own family's use and to sell in town.

loans.use: to buy cement, rebar, gravel, and concrete blocks

loans.name: Lisete

texts.pt:
A senhora Lisete e comerciante viúva, mae de 1 filho que tem o nível médio concluído.
Com o valor do credito pretende comprar roupa usada de crianças, calcas, e alguidares para reforçar o seu negocio.
diz que tem como sonhos ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, e construir uma barraca em sua casa para aumentar a renda famiiar.
Os principais desafios são financeiros, tem recorrido ao xitique diário para poder angariar        
 algum valor e pretende tomar mais vezes para ver os seus objectivos alcançados.
texts.en: Lisete is a widowed saleswoman with one son, who is half-way through school. With this loan she plans to buy used children's clothing and shoes, as well as plastic containers, to stock up her business. She says that her dreams are to grow her business and better meet the demands of her customers, and to build an add-on to her house that she can rent out to increase her household income. Her major challenges are financial. She has regular access to a xitique (a traditional communal savings system) to raise some funds, but plans to take out more loans in the future in order to advance her goals.

loans.use: to buy used children's clothing and shoes, as well as containers.

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es: Mil Flores es un grupo solidario integrado por tres socios exitosos con negocios diferentes pero con un solo objetivo como es aumentar el capital de trabajo y así mejorar sus ingresos para brindarles los recursos necesarios a sus familias, quien lo coordina es la señora Ángela que tiene la edad de 36 años, casada y es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulsó hace doce años con capital propio de ella, luego con los financiamientos otorgados de ADIM le han permitido incrementar y diversificar los productos ofrecidos, por tal razón solicita el crédito actual para invertir en granos básicos como es arroz, azúcar, aceite, plátano verde, plátano maduro, pan, sal, jugos, etc., una de sus metas es seguir creciendo en su negocio. El resto de los integrantes son, la señora María que tiene la edad de 29 años y ofrece el servicio de fritanga en su domicilio y colegios cercanos a su domicilio, y el señor Carlos de 43 años de edad que se dedica a la comercialización de calzado de manera ambulante en el departamento de Rivas desde hace trece años.
texts.en:
Mil Flores is a close-knit group formed by three successful partners at different businesses but with a single objective: increasing working capital in order to improve their earnings to provide their families with the resources necessary. 

Ángela coordinates the group; she is 36 years old, married and the owner of a small grocery store in her home. She started this business two years ago with her own capital. With financing from ADIM, she has been able to increase and diversify the products offered. For this reason she is asking for the current loan to invest in basic grains like rice, sugar, oil, green plantains, ripe plantains, bread, salt, juices, etc. One of her goals is to keep growing her business. 

The other members are María, who is 29 years old and sells fried food in her home and at high schools near her home, and Carlos, who is 43 years old and has made a living by selling shoes in an itinerant fashion in the department of Rivas for the last three years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, which will allow her to diversity the products offered

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is 24 years old, and he lives with his brothers. Ivan works in a gym as an instructor. He needs a loan to help paying the rent at the new place they will live because he and his brothers need to move to another house. Ivan and his brothers are also paying for the construction of their own house, but they can't go there right now. Ivan is single and responsible. He hopes you can help him and his family to find a decent place to live.

loans.use: to help with the payment of the rent  at the new place he will  live

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting, beams, tile, security bars, and doors; and pay for labor.

loans.name: El Cerrito Group

texts.es:
El lugar donde viven los integrantes del grupo es una comunidad mazahua cuyos habitantes son muy amables, aun conservan su legua materna y algunas tradiciones como su vestimenta típica y algunas celebraciones.

El señor Alfredo tiene 39 años de edad es muy responsable pero sobretodo muy trabajador, está casado con la señora Gregoria desde hace 19 años y juntos formaron una familia con ochos hijos de los cuales cuatro aún dependen de ellos.

Don Alfredo se dedica a la cría y engorda de borregos desde hace ya 22 años, los compra desde pequeños y los conserva algunos meses. Él inició su actividad porque los ingresos obtenidos con su trabajo como albañil no eran suficientes para solventar todos los gastos de sus hijos.

Mientras Don Alfredo trabaja en la ciudad de México su esposa Gregoria ayuda en la crianza de los borregos. “No recuerdo exactamente el número de borregos con los que iniciamos pero eran menos de cuatro” comentó Don Alfredo quien lleva ya varios años solicitando préstamo a VisionFund México y aunque realmente no ha podido tener un rebaño muy grande, está agradecido porque con sus ganancias puede sacar adelante a su familia. Ahora necesita más capital para comprar cuatro borreguitos y que Gregoria, tan entregada como siempre, continúe apoyándolo para obtener ingresos y ayudar a sus cuatro hijos que aún están estudiando.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Reyna y Teresa quienes solicitan su crédito para invertir en sus borreguitos y Emilia quien invertirá en sus borregos y costuras.
texts.en:
The place where the members of this group live is a Mazahua community whose inhabitants are friendly and still conserve their mother language and traditional dress and some festivals.

Alfredo is 39 years old and is very responsible and moreover hard-working. He has been married to Gregoria for 19 years and together they formed a family with 8 children. Four of them are still dependent.

Alfredo has worked raising and fattening sheep for 22 years. He buys them when they are small and keeps them a number of months. He started this business because the income he got from his work as a bricklayer wasn't sufficient to cover the expenses of his children. When Alfredo works in Mexico City his wife helps him caring for the sheep, "I don't remember exactly how many sheep we started with but it was less than 4", Alfredo commented.

He has been requesting loans from VIsionFund México for a number of years. And although he couldn't really have a bigger flock of sheep he is grateful as his profits get his family ahead. Now he needs more capital to buy 4 sheep, as Gregoria devoted as usual, to obtain income and help his 4 children who are still studying which is Alfredo's dream. The other members of the group are Reyna and Teresa who want the loan to invest in their sheep and Emilia who will invest in sheep and sewing.

loans.use: to buy four sheep and feed.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Priscela Yesenia

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Priscela, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos  hijos de 10 y 6 años los mismos que estudian en escuela.
Doña Priscela tiene una tienda en su casa donde vende productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, gaseosas, entre otros productos, su tienda es pequeña pero le deja lo necesario para salir adelante junto  a sus hijos, trabaja todos los días y todo el día.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como ella surte cada vez más su tienda, ella siempre invierte sus ganancias en las necesidades que hay en su hogar y la educación de sus pequeños. Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar entre otros víveres. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
On San Eduardo Street on the route to Santa Ana in the city of Portoviejo, known since colonial times as the "City of the Royal Tamarind Trees", the members of the "16 de Julio" loan group meet every two weeks. 

Priscela lives here; she is 36 years old and the single mother of two children ages 10 and 6 who are in school. Priscela has a store in her house where she sells products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent and soft drinks, among other products. Her store is small but it gives her what she needs to get ahead with her children. She works every day, all day long.

She is repeating the loan, as this is how she keeps stocking her store. She always invests her earnings in what she needs at home and in her children's education. This loan is to buy rice and sugar, among other foods. She has been in the loan group for three years and she likes it because of the help that the loans give her. Her goals is to grow her business

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar, among other foods

loans.name: Fanny Lastenia

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Fanny, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, uno mayor y dos de  16 y 14 años de edad, los dos menores estudian en colegio y son los que  aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Fanny tiene una tienda de  víveres en su casa, vender todo tipo de víveres, ropa, zapatos, artículos de bazar y papelería. Trabaja todos los días, tiene 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como ella sale adelante, gracias a sus ganancias pudo solventar muchos gastos que tuvo en el mes de diciembre. Este crédito es para comprar víveres, útiles escolares, ropa y todo de lo que ella vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  2 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the July 16th Credit Group meet every fifteen days on San Eduardo Street, on the way to Santa Ana, in the city of Portoviejo, which has been known since colonial times as “The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.” 

This is where Fanny lives. She is 46 years old, married, and has 3 children with her husband. One of her children is an adult, and the other two are 16 and 14 years old. The two younger ones are in high school and they still live in her house. Her husband is a chauffer. 

Fanny has a convenience store in her house. She sells all kinds of provisions, such as clothes, shoes, and stationary. She works every day. She has been in this line of work for 6 years.

She is getting another loan, since that is how she gets ahead. Thanks to her earnings, she was able to resolve many expenses that she had in December. This loan is to buy provisions, school supplies, clothes, and everything that she sells. She has been in the Credit Group for 2 years and she likes it because the loans are fast. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy provisions, school supplies, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a 37-year-old married woman, with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Liza has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Liza has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, shorts, etc., as well as stuffed animals, chocolates and some flowers, to have her business well stocked

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 57 year old, married woman from Tbilisi. She lives with her husband, who is disabled and receives a pension from the local government. The family lives in poverty, having no source of income except social assistance and her husband's pension. This mentioned income is hardly enough for them to cover even basic needs. Because of the above-mentioned situation, Nino lacks the access to capital markets to obtain credit to start her own business. Her loan request was rejected several times, as creditors did not find enough income sufficient to approve the loan. The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enabled her to get a loan of 500 GEL to start a trading business. 

Nino plans to purchase agricultural products in a nearby village and sell them at increased prices in town. She will sell cheese, yogurt, fruits and other products at the underground area, which is always crowded, and Nino will always have costumers among passersby.
 
The new business initiative will be great support to this poor couple as they will get the chance to satisfy basic needs and overcome financial difficulties.

loans.use: To make her own income by trading in food products

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower is married, and lives with his partner and 3 small children. He has been working in a construction company for a few years now.
He started to develop vision problems and is now to a point that is affecting him on his job, he was disabled for quite some time before, he currently helps his parents financially and because of that matter he couldn't get the surgery procedure done in the past. He is using this loan to pay for his eye surgery. 
In the picture you can see him having an eye exam.

loans.use: to pay for his eye surgery

loans.name: Eynor Antonio

texts.es: EYNOR ANTONIO: Es un hombre indígena que pertenece a la etnia miskita, es originario de Puerto Cabezas,  Es un hombre jovial, trabajador, tiene 29 años de edad, casado con 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Su esposa es ama de casa. Al no contar con un empleo formal decidió emprender su pequeño negocio, desde hace 7 años vende de manera ambulante, gel para el cabello, cepillo de lavar ropa, pastes de alambres, entre otros productos. Solicita este crédito con el propósito de comprar su mercadería en Managua y venderla a un precio accesible para sus clientes en la ciudad de Bilwi. Gracias a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA, le han permitido con mucho esfuerzo construir poco a poco su vivienda de concreto. Su sueño es llegar a ser un exitoso comerciante con un negocio próspero y tener su propio local equipado con vitrinas para exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Eynor Antonio is an indigenous man of the Miskita ethnic group. He is a native of Puerto Cabezas, and he is a cheerful and hard-working man. He is 29 years old and married. He has 3 teenage children who are in elementary school and middle school. His wife performs household chores.

Since he could not rely on formal employment, he decided to establish his own small business. For the past 7 years, he has been selling hair gel, brushes for washing clothes, and rolls of wire, among other products, as a street vendor. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise in Managua that he can sell at accessible prices to his customers in the city of Bilwi.

Thanks to the loans that Pana Pana gave him previously, he has been able to build his concrete house little by little and with great effort. His dream is to be a successful merchant with a prosperous business and to have his own store with showcases to display his products.

loans.use: to buy hair gel, brushes for washing clothes, and rolls of wire, among other products.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan entrenched his business. He was able to purchase additional supplies of rice and other products needed to increase his inventory. The loan also helped him provide for his daily needs.

He is very positive that he could further improve his business if you will lend him an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to purchase additional grocery items and sacks of rice, which is his primary product, needed in his variety store. His customers will likely buy more items if he has a greater variety of products displayed in his store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in his business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, he could sustain the needs of his family.

Aside from growing his business, Jorge wants his family to be always healthy, and it is his dream to give them a better life in the coming years. He also hopes to open another outlet soon and to establish his own mall. He meets every week with his fellowship group* to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items and sacks of rice needed in his variety store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen,  tiene 56  años de edad,  es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y reside en compañía de una hija y nieta en una comunidad del municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Barbara.
Carmen es maestra jubilada, ha laborado como directora del Kínder de su comunidad. Con el propósito de generar mayores ingresos decidió desde hace dos años establecer otro negocio de una pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar y tener siempre la venta de útiles escolares y de oficina.
Decidió solicitar otro préstamo por la cantidad de 30,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de productos alimenticios para surtir y agrandar la pulpería, comprara granos básicos, productos de limpieza, manteca, azúcar, churros, refrescos, frijoles, maíz etc.
Con el apoyo financiero ella espera aumentar sus ventas y con las utilidades comprar mas mobiliario y un frízer y pesas para el negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen is 56 years old, a single mother with three children, and lives with her daughter and granddaughter in a community in Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara Department.
Carmen is a retired teacher, and has worked as the kindergarten director of her community. For the purpose of generating better income, two years ago she decided to establish a grocery business to sell basic family products and to always sell school and office supplies.
She decided to ask another loan in the amount of 30,000 Lempiras which she hopes to invest in food products to stock and grow her grocery store by buying basic grains, cleaning products, butter, sugar, churros, drinks, beans, etc.
With the financial help she hopes to improve her sales, and with the increase, to buy more furniture, a freezer, and scales for the business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cleaning supplies, butter, sugar, churros, drinks, beans, corn, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: Samnieng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a remote village of Mondulkiri province, 46-year-old Samnieng is living with three of her four children. After her husband passed away, the financial burden is increasing on Samnieng. She has been a craftsman to earn a living. 

Twice, Samnieng has been with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner, and now, leading her group, she is seeking a KHR 1,600,000 loan to buy materials for her craft business. She believes it will help enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her craft business.

loans.name: Irma Del Transito

texts.es: Irma de 40 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora quien desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Irma vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijas, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fungicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejora al terreno que muestra en la fotografía para seguir con su trabajo y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Irma is 40 years old. She is a very hard-working woman who has been growing corn and beans for several years. 

She sells her produce in the neighboring towns, and with what she earns from her sales, she manages to cover some of her household expenses. Irma lives in her own house with her husband and their two daughters. 

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of seed, fungicide, fertilizer, compost, and pest control; and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph, in order to continue with her work and thus be able to have a better quality of life, along with her family.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fungicide, fertilizer, compost, and pest control; and to improve the land.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva, a 30-year-old married woman from the city of Nablus, is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Eva and her husband have a restaurant in the city where they make traditional meals such as hummus and falafel. They have been in business for the past six years.

In order to improve the restaurant, Eva has requested a USD loan from FATEN to buy raw food. By taking this loan, she will be able to increase both her productivity and her income.

loans.use: to buy raw food for the restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en su casa con los gastos que se les presentan, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: This young lady's face has been pixelated because she is 21 years old and lives in an area of elevated risk. She makes a living selling clothes in the streets of different neighborhoods and she has many customers. With what she earns she is able to help out with expenses around the house. She lives at home with her mother. She is asking for a new loan to purchase more men's and women's clothing so that she can continue selling them and increase her earning potential.

loans.use: purchase more men's and women's clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a backpack tank to fumigate his crops and to pay the costs of harvesting the sorghum that is now grown.

loans.name: Mujeres De Maiz Group

texts.en:
The five women of this group live in Santiago Sacatepéquez, about 10 miles from the city of La Antigua, Guatemala.  They range in age from 20 to 69 years with children ranging in age from one year to 50 years of age.  Several of them are illiterate. Most of them are bilingual with Spanish and Kaqchikel, their native Mayan language, and most of them wear the traditional Mayan clothing. Among the businesses represented by the group are sales of vegetables and herbs, sales of second hand clothing, sales of tortillas, silk-screen printing on balloons, and one woman has a small store.  This group of women is very entrepreneurial, very devoted to their businesses and eager to work with Namaste because they will have classes in financial literacy and a personal business adviser who will help them write a business plan and each month give them advice on ways to improve their business.
Doña Ismelda is 41 years old, married with six children ranging in age from 14 to 25 years old.  The oldest two are already living independently. She only went to school through second grade and it is difficult for her to read and write. Her husband works in a factory and together they struggle to provide a better future for their children. Her dream is to finish paying for a piece of land she and her husband have bought and to build a house on it for themselves and all of their children
Doña Ismelda’s business is making and selling tortillas and other snacks. She gets up at 2 AM to start cooking the corn for the tortillas. She wants to invest her loan in more products for her tortilleria. She currently has a monthly net profit of 5343 Guatemalan Quetzales and during this nine-month loan cycle with Namaste she is projecting growth of 20% in her net profit.

loans.use: to buy more products for her tortilleria

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a small village located in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province, 36-year-old Phally is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She is a rice farmer and a paid worker who helps villagers in their fields during harvesting season. 

As the leader of her group, Phally is seeking a 1,000,000 KHR loan for her rice farm in order to buy better quality rice seed that will result in greater yields. With her profits, she wants to buy a water pump for her farm.

loans.use: to buy better quality rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Tafao

texts.en:
Tafao, a 66-year-old mother of two, owns and operates a small business selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Tafao has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a fry pan, plastic bags and vegetable oil for her business. She will use her profits to expand her enterprise and provide for family needs. Tafao became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a fry pan, plastic bags and vegetable oil

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz desde hace 5 años, cundo su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros y saco que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los pueblos aledaños, con las ventas que realiza logra solevantar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para sus cultivos y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face has been pixelated due to his age and the fact that he lives in a very dangerous area, has worked growing corn for five years.  When is harvest is ready, he stores it in the barn and sacks that are seen in the picture, so that he can later it in the neighboring towns.  With his sales, he is able to cover some of his household expenses.

The young man lives in a house that he owns, with his two children..  He is seeking a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc, for his crops so that he can increase his earnings.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo de 53 años de edad se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura cultiva hortalizas, tomates, plátano, chile, entre otros, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en casa propia, Pablo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Pablo is 53 years old and for the past 20 years, he has worked in agriculture.  He grows vegetables, tomatoes, plantains, peppers and more.  He sells his produce in different markets located near his home.  He lives with his wife and their three children in a house that they own.  

Pablo is seeking a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc, and to improve the land that is seen in the photograph, so that he can continue to work and increase his earnings.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Union Carapongo Group

texts.es: El grupo “UNION CARAPONGO” está conformada por  05 mujeres dedicadas al comercio minorista. Maria tiene 30 años de edad es soletera con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de gelatinas chupetes  de frutas  desde sus 12 años hasta hoy en día viene realizando dicha actividad. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos al por mayor gelatina vasos bolsos frutas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Maria es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en:
The group, "Union Carapongo", is made up of five women who are small business owners.  Maria is 30 years old, single, and has two children.  She works selling fruit gelatin, which she has done since the age of 12.

The loan will be used to purchase wholesale supplies such as gelatin, cups, bags, and fruit.  The group is grateful for the Kiva lenders. Maria is the first one on the right.

loans.use: purchase more supplies.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José, posee un taller de enderezado y pintura de vehículos, vive con su familia conformada por su madre, hermanos, un cuñado y una hija de 12 años de edad, en total son 8 miembros de su familia, uno de sus tíos le enseño el oficio hace 15 años y su propio negocio funciona desde hace 4 años, su horario es de 7:30 a.m. a 5:30, en este momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Invertirá en pinturas y materiales de construcción para hacer una galera en la que pueda trabajar con mejor comodidad, espera tener parte de los materiales para realizar su trabajo y mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
Sus sueños son equipar su negocio, brindar un buen servicio, resarcir su deuda y dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
José owns a paint and autobody shop. He lives with his family, made up of his mother, siblings, a brother-in-law, and a 12-year-old daughter; his family has 8 members in all. One of his uncles taught him the trade 15 years ago and his own business has been operating for 4 years. His schedule is from 7:30 a.m. to 5:30 and at this time there are no difficulties in his business.  

He will invest in paint and construction materials to make a shed where he can work more comfortably. He hopes to have part of the materials to do the work and keep his customers satisfied. 

His dreams are to equip his business, offer good service, pay off his debt, and give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest in paint and construction materials to make a shed where he can work more comfortably.

loans.name: Rosa Juliana

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijas mujeres de 20, 16 y 10 anos, y su negocio es la confección de bufandas y gorros para niños.
Élla es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Buenos Aires’ un área caracterizada por el comercio y la manufactura en todas las áreas. Talleres de sastrería, restaurantes de pollo frito, librería y todo tipo de comercios se encuentran lado a lado. De clima seco y frio, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-14 grados centígrados.
Rosa es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro crespo largo hasta la altura de los hombros, usa lentes de aumento, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio de chamarras y con sus hijas; la mayor estudia en la universidad y las menores estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia que está construida de ladrillo y techo de calamina, cuenta con electricidad, gas domiciliario, alcantarillado y agua potable. Su negocio es la confección de gorros y bufandas decorativas para niños; dónde su creatividad y experiencia se ajustan a la medida de sus pequeños clientes. Entre paños, linos, agujas y moldes han transcurrido los últimos 2 años, él confecciona gorros y bufandas por temporada y también modifica todo tipo de prendas según el gusto de sus clientes. En la mesa de corte se caracteriza por su creatividad; con agilidad, precisión, rapidez, esmero y dedicación, el resultado: gorros y bufandas con diseños coloridos y alegres. “realizo la confección con motivos según la temporada, en navidad me ocupé de confeccionar gorros estilo duende de color rojo, ahora que comienza el año escolar confecciono gorros con motivos escolares e infantiles, los niños aman los diseños…” comenta. Su sueño es vender por mayor a supermercados de la ciudad. Ella desea realizar una inversión mediante la compra de tela por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Rosa solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor para confeccionar gorros infantiles para la temporada escolar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 46-year-old woman, married, has three daughters, women ages 20, 16, and 10, and her business is making scarves and hats for children.

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, dependable, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is located in the "Buenos Aires" zone, an area characterized by business and manufacturing in all areas. Tailoring shops, fried chicken restaurants, bookstores and all types of businesses are found side by side. It has a dry and cold climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between 4 and 14 degrees centigrade.

Rosa has tanned skin, is short, has long, curly black hair that reaches her shoulders, wears glasses, her native language is Aymará which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she conducts. She shares her life with her husband, who works selling jackets, and with her daughters. The oldest studies at university and the younger ones are students at school. They live in their own home made of brick with a corrugated iron roof, it has electricity, household gas, sewer and drinking water. Her business is making decorative hats and scarves for children, where creativity and experience adjust to fit her young customers. 

Among cloth, linen, needles and templates, she has passed the last 2 years. She makes hats and scarves by the season and also modifies all sorts of clothing according to her customers' tastes. At her cutting table, she is characterized by her creativity; with agility, precision, speed, care and dedication, the results are hats and scarves with colorful and happy designs. "I make them with themes according to the season. At Christmas I make elf hats in red, now that the school year is beginning, I make hats with school and children's themes, the children love the designs..." she says. Her dream is to sell in bulk to supermarkets in the city. She wants to make an investment through the purchase of fabric in bulk. It is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years that she has been doing this work independently.

For these reasons, Rosa asks for a loan to purchase fabric in bulk to make children's hats for the school season.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in bulk to make children's hats for the school season.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira, 57 years old, lives alone in Maneuli district. She sells clothes to generate a monthly income. 
 
The Start Up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, qualifies Zamira for a loan of 2000 USD to purchase a stock of additional clothes. She is a very hardworking woman and motivated to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
A Rosa e comerciante, solteira, mae de 1 filha que já e maior de idade, independente ,vive na casa própria.
Com o ultimo empréstimo, ela consegui aumentar mais 1 quarto na sua casa e  pretende com este empréstimo comprar  areia, pedra, chapas de zinco, arame, pregos para dar continuidade da sua obra.
A cliente tem como sonhos concluir a sua casa, construir uma barraca na sua casa  e futuramente construir o muro de vedacao da sua casa.
Os principais disafios são financeiros a cliente tem recorrido ao xitique e pretende tomar mais vezes credito para suprir as suas necessidades.
texts.en:
Rosa is a trader, single and the mother of 1 daughter who is already of age, independent and lives in her own house.

With her last loan, Rosa was able to expand her house by adding 1 room and with this loan she plans to buy sand, stone, zinc plates, wire and screws to continue the building work on her house.

She dreams of finishing off her home, building a shop stall in her house and also building a wall around it in future.

Her main challenges are financial ones and she has previously resorted to savings groups. She plans to ask for further loans to stay ontop of her needs.

loans.use: buy sand, stone, zinc plates, wire and screws to continue the building work on her house.

loans.name: Lydo

texts.en: Lydo is 24 years old, single, lives with her parents in the Chroychangva district of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. For the last three years, she has worked at the BB World Company, and is applying  for a loan to buy a motorbike she can use to commute to work. Today she uses a bicycle to get to and from her job, and she hopes that a motorbike will make her commute easier.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

location.town: Chroy Changva district Phnom Penh city

loans.name: Novie

texts.en: As the married mother of two children, Novie works hard to support her family. She earns a living by selling used clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by selling vegetables. Novie has requested a loan for PHP 11000 from NWTF to buy a bundle of used clothes to sell to her customers. She has sustained her business activities with the help of nine prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abdullobeg

texts.en:
Abdullobeg, age 36, sells food items at the local market to earn an income. He has been engaged in this business for many years and earns a modest living. He works 10 hours every day at the market. He is a kind person and enjoys his work.

Abdullobeg lives in a remote district with his wife and their two children. He loves this part of the country very much, as it is a quiet, meditative rural area with beautiful scenery.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy more food items to offer for sale. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell at the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new seat cover and pay for the permit to operate her motorcycle.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a happy woman who always seeks for the better future of her children. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children. One of her children is still going to school while the other one is already working. Shirley’s husband is a farmer while she manages her school canteen business. 

Shirley is selling snack foods in public school. She has been doing it for almost ten years. Shirley hopes for continuous operation of the business to be  able to respond immediately to her kid's needs in school. 

Now, Shirley wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy snack foods to sell. She will use her loan wisely in order to grow the business and earn more for the education of her kid.

loans.use: to buy snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Haykaz

texts.en:
Haykaz is from the town of Stepanavan, where he lives with his grandmother. He rents a small store in the town center, where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for the past two years.  
 
In order to be able to purchase a new stock of fruits and vegetables for his store, Haykaz has requested a loan. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fruits and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Nelsa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nelsa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Nelsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ahmet

texts.en: Previously Ahmet bought some baby goats to start off an animal husbandry business, and now wants to expand it by adding more baby animals to his herd. At the moment, he owns two cows and ten sheep and has been selling their dairy products, including raw milk, butter cheese and cottage cheese. On the land that he owns, he has also been planting beans, onions and corn, and wants to supplement his income by selling these items as well as peaches from his orchard in the farmer's market at a nearby city.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en:
Pav, age 30, plants and harvests sweet potatoes to earn her living. She lives in a small town in the province of Stoeung Treng with her husband and their two sons. The family's main source of income comes from Pav's sweet potato plantation. She can earn 5 USD daily.
 
This is the second loan that Pav has requested from Kiva partner VisionFund. As the leader of her group of two members, she is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR. She will use her portion of the loan to hire workers to work on her sweet potato farm. 

Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to hire workers to work on her sweet potato farm

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Thala Barivat District

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a small village of Steung Treng province, Nang is a 20-year-old married woman with one daughter. She and her husband have been doing rice farming and planting sweet potatoes to earn an income. They earn 5 USD a day and are able to save half of it.

Nang has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund one cycle before this, and is a creditable member. Currently, she and her co-member are seeking a loan of 2,800,000 KHR. Her portion of the loan will be used to hire workers to work on her sweet potato plantation.

When her sweet potato business is going well, she hopes to build a better house.

loans.use: to hire workers to work on her sweet potato plantation.

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Thala Barivat District

loans.name: Johana Marcelina

texts.es: Las ganas de superación y el deseo de tener una mejor vida es lo que ha impulsado a Johana a establecer su propio negocio. Está casada y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y sus hijos. Se dedica a la venta de frijoles, porque su esposo cosecha los frijoles y también vende gaseosas, jugos, frescos y helados. Tiene muchas ganas de agrandar su negocio es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para comprar frutas, azúcar, gaseosas entre otros. Dentro de sus planes futuros está superarse y salir de la pobreza esto lo lograra gracias al financiamiento logrando así invertir en su negocio.
texts.en: The desire to improve her personal situation and to have a better life are what have motivated Johana to start her own business.  She is married and has her husband's and children's unconditional support.  She earns her living selling beas, because her husband harvests beans.  She also sells carbonated beverages, juice, sodas and ice cream.  Johana really wants to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan.  She will purchase fruits, sugar, carbonated beverages and other items.  Her future plans include improving her personal situation and getting out of poverty, which she will be able to do thanks to this loan which will enable her to invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, sugar, carbonated beverages and other items.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
From Cheung Prey district, Kampong Cham province, Leng is a 60 years-old widow with four children and one of them is living with her. 

Leng has been a farmer for 40 years and it is her primary income. Her son also helps with the family budget by being a construction worker. 

Leng was successfully a member with VisionFund once before. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She intends to use the loan to buy a piece of land for rice farming and to hire workers for it. She hopes to keep increasing her land for farming in the future.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land and to hire workers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.en:
The five women in this group are starting their third loan cycle with Namaste. They live in the town of San Miguel Dueñas, about eight miles from the city of La Antigua, Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. The area in which they live is known for the many vegetables and beautiful flowers that are grown there.  During the first two cycles the women have worked hard at keeping track of their sales and expenses in their notebooks. They have been punctual in making their loan payments and have been conscientious in implementing the advice of their Business Advisor. They are now eagerly looking forward to another nine-month cycle with Namaste in which they will learn more about managing their finances and receive more advice from their Business Advisor.
Doña Felipa is a hard working entrepreneur.  She is 52 years old and married with grown children.  She lives in a simple house, that she built over the course of many years, with money from her several businesses. Her main business is a nursery that she operates out of her home.  She sells a variety of plants that she grows from seed and she sells beans that she plants and harvests on her property. She also keeps chickens that she buys young and later sells. Her goal for the next nine months with Namaste is to increase the assortment of plants she can sell and to cultivate more beans and grains and she also wants to increase the sale of chickens.  At the end of the second cycle her monthly net profit was 4115 Guatemalan Quetzales.  She is projecting a monthly net profit of Q5129 from a 56% increase in sales.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and plants for her nusery

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun (shown in picture) is 43 years old and lives at Posen Chey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been married since 1979 and has four sons. They are attending school.

Thoeun has been a farmer and has raised cattle for fifteen years in her experience, while her husband is the same. He has worked for twenty years in his experiences. She would like to apply for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her sons take to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her sons to take to school.

loans.name: Sokkhoeun

texts.en:
Sokkhoeun, age 50, earns her income as an embroiderer. She has been engaged in this activity for five years. She has been married since 1982, and her husband has been a construction worker for 20 years. They have a son and two daughters. Their son is an air conditioner technician, and their daughters are married. Sokkhoeun and her husband live in the district of Khsach Kandal in Kandal province. 
  
Sokkhoeun would like to apply for a loan in order to pay a builder to construct a floor in her house.

loans.use: to pay a builder to construct a floor in her house

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a 26-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband and four kids (three sons and one daughter). Her husband works as an employee in the public sector. 

Their living conditions are very bad because Wafa and her husband can't provide the family with all that they need. Wafa works in selling candy in a stall to help her husband in part of the family expenses. 

Wafa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more products for her candy stall to resell. By taking this loan, Wafa will be able to increase her sales and also her income.  Wafa appears in the photo while she was working.

loans.use: to buy more products for her candy stall to resell

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Ousmane est client dans un de nos guichets à l’IMCEC depuis 2011. Il évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis 1998 où il était embauché dans une boutique à la capitale. C’est deux ans après, qu’il a ouvert son propre local et vend des denrées alimentaires. Il travaille de 6h à 1h du matin. Ousmane n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC et pour renforcer sa boutique, il aimerait emprunter une somme de 200 000F. Il pourra acheter des denrées alimentaires : riz, huile, tomate, sucre, savon… 
Ousmane est marié et père de trois enfants dont son ainé qui est âgé de 8 ans et qui est à l’école coranique et le plus jeune, de 3 mois seulement.
Ousmane a démarré très tôt le commerce et s’il avait les moyens, il améliorerait davantage, voire ouvrir une autre boutique.
texts.en:
Ousmane is a client at one of our IMCEC offices since 2011. He has been progressing in the business sector since 1998, when he was hired in a store in the capital. After two years, he opened his own place and sells food products. He works from 6AM to 1AM. Ousmane has never taken a loan at IMCEC. To improve his store, he would like to borrow the sum of 200,000F. He will be able to buy food products: rice, oil, tomatoes, sugar, soap...

Ousmane is married and a father to three children - the oldest is 8 years old and attends the Koranic school; the youngest is only 3 months old. Ousmane started up very early in business and if he had the means, he would improve further, even open another store.

loans.use: to buy food products: rice, oil, sugar to put in his store and resell.

loans.name: Beautiful Group

texts.en:
Rubilorna is the featured borrower of Beautiful group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon with a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Rubilorna is a 54-year-old widowed mother of three children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions.  Thus she is acquiring a loan to support her family's increasing needs in the Philippines.

Rubilorna is the second lady on the right. With respect to the other group members, Mercedes is the first lady on the right, Rowena is the second lady on the left, and Aida is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to support her family's increasing needs in the Philippines

loans.name: Hondogo Kibamba Group

texts.en:
Restuta, who is in her early 40's, is married with three children who are still at school.  She has been running a business of growing and selling vegetables for three years now.  She works from 7 AM to 4 PM daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Restuta's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy an irrigation machine, manure, pesticide and vegetable seed. She has managed to pay back her loan successfully and is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy another irrigation machine and to buy seeds, manure, and  pesticide  for growing vegetables.  She dreams of taking her kids to good schools.

Restuta will share this loan with her loan group "Hondogo Kibamba" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy another irrigation machine, seeds, manure, and  pesticide  for growing tvegetables.

loans.name: Mtaji Wa Masikini Group

texts.en:
Asma is in her early thirties, single, and has three children who all attend school. She has been a food vendor for the past ten years and sells items such as rice, ugali (typical Tanzanian dish), meat, beans, and drinks. Asma works from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. daily to earn an income for her family.

This is Asma's first loan from Tujijenge, and she plans to use it to help improve her food stand business. Asma's dream is to earn enough profit to renovate her home.

Asma will be sharing this loan with her loan group, Mtaji Wa Masikini, which consists of four individuals who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to improve her food stand business.

loans.name: Neresa

texts.en:
Neresa, age 40, operates a a tricycle passenger business to earn her living. She has been in this business for eight years. Neresa and her husband have five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  
 
She has requested a PhP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy tires and other spare parts for her tricycle.

In the future, Neresa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tires and other spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn sells frozen food items to earn her living. She has been in this business for four years now, and she earns an additional income from operating a general store. She is married and lives in Escalante.

Lovelyn requested a PhP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more frozen food items to offer for sale.
 
In the future, Lovelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy frozen food items to offer for sale

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 45 years old and married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fish to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is sure that for the second time her partnership with Kiva will be as profitable and useful for her pedagogical activities as the first one. Marine lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. She lives with her retired mother, her husband (he works at the local orphanage as a security officer) and their single son (he is on his last years of school). As we already know Marine is a pedagogue with higher education and 25 years of work experience in this field. She is a teacher of Armenian language and literature at the school and she still manages her private courses at her house.  She is happy to mention that the purchase of a computer (with her first Kiva loan) greatly helps her to get prepared for her school lessons more thoroughly and quickly. 

This time Marine asks a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams, in order to buy a printer for her computer.  In this way she will print all her needed articles and new information connected with the teaching program, and the other part of the loan she will also use for repairing the room in her house, where she organizes her private courses with a small group of pupils.

loans.use: to buy a printer for her computer and also to repair the room in her house, where she organizes her private courses with pupils

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 48-year-old widowed woman. She lives in Tbilisi with her two children. Lali works as a nurse and gets a small monthly income. Also, her two children get an orphan pension from the government institutions.

As the income is not enough for the family, Lali decided to start a business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to borrow 2,400 USD. With the received credit, Lali will open a bakery and will bake Georgian bread.

Lali is a very motivated and hardworking woman. She will do her best to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her children. Lali awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a bakery.

loans.name: Born

texts.en:
Born, age 31, is a rice farmer living in the district of Cheung Prey in the province of of Kampong Cham. She lives with her husband and their two children, both of whom are attending school. She and her husband have been farming rice for 13 years, and she is also a garment factory worker. The daily income for the family is 11 USD. 

This is Born's first loan from Kiva partner VisionFund. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 KHR in order to buy a tractor to plow her rice field. This investment will improve her rice farming efforts.

loans.use: to buy a tractor

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Living in a small village of Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Yan is a 38 years-old divorcee with four children. Two of her children are factory workers.
