Their primary income comes from rice farming, while being factory workers and raising pigs are their secondary. Yan is a new member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is applying for an individual loan of 4,000,000 KHR for her pig business. She plans to buy pig feed and piglets. She wishes to use the profit from selling pigs to finance her rice plantation.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and piglets

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sort

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village of Sangke district of Battambang province, Sort is a 61-year-old married woman with eight children. She has been planting vegetables for 42 years, while her husband is a vice-chief of the village. Their daily income is 8 USD.

Previously, Sort was also a member with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike. Her purpose is to be on time for work and to facilitate her vegetable plantation.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sokkeam's Group

texts.en:
Sokkeam, age 31, is a rice farmer living in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and has two young children. She has been a farmer for 13 years, and her husband is a construction worker. Together, they can earn 11 USD a day.

This will be Sokkeam's first loan from Kiva partner VisionFund, and she is the leader of her group. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR to invest in her rice farm. She will use her portion of the loan to buy a piece of land and hire workers to help her with the rice farming. 

Her goal is to continue to increase the output from her farm.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land and hire workers to help her with the rice farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, age 42, is a rice farmer. She has been engaged in this activity for 24 years. In addition, she makes and sells craft items to earn an additional income. She and her husband live in the village of Prey Chhor and have four children, two of whom still live at home. 
 
This will be Mom's first loan from Kiva partner VisionFund. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a piece of land to use for farming. 

She is hopeful that her rice plantation will be more fruitful with the investment of the additional land.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zeboniso

texts.en:
Zeboniso is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1987. She is living a rural area. She is divorced and has two children. She was a seamstress.
Then she found a new job in a micro-deposit organization. In her free time she works as a seamstress. She has a lot of satisfied clients around. 

She is planning to repair her house-top. Her house-top is broken and, as time goes by, rain is flowing through the roof. Zeboniso needs to repair her roof and she is asking for financial support to make repairs.

loans.use: To repair her house-top

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grain millet, corn, peanuts, and beans for resale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Marites has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from frozen foods.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marpilipa

texts.en:
Marpilipa is 49 years old and married.  She has five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marpilipa has a passenger tricycle business in the Philippines. Marpilipa requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Marpilipa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marpilipa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her passenger tricycle.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is from Stepanavan where she lives with her parents. To help her parents financially, Susan started a retail business last year. She trades with cloth and dressmaking supplies from her house. Due to the hard work and nice attitude toward her clients, Susan's retail business is successful and profitable.
 
She asks for this loan to purchase a new stock of clothing to sell to customers. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for reselling to customers

loans.name: Sayonara Jeanethe

texts.es:
Tomar decisiones nunca es fácil, y menos cuando se trata de decidir sobre nuestro futuro. Más aun cuando se es joven y se puede ser influenciado por los amigos o padres. No es el caso de Jeanethe, porque si por algo se ha caracterizado es por ser una joven audaz, decidida y luchadora. Actualmente, estudia Tecnología médica, carrera que la hace ser más humana pues está en constante relación con el bienestar de muchos pacientes. 
Jeanethe solicita el financiamiento para invertir en sus estudios con la compra de una computadora y para poderse matricular. Ella es consiente que todo los esfuerzos valen la pena porque al final los resultados de hacer algo que le gusta y apasiona la hará llegar muy lejos. Además, sus aspiraciones y sueños son altos pues una de sus metas es tener su laboratorio.
texts.en:
Making decisions is never easy, especially when it comes to making decisions about our future.  It is even more difficult when one is young and can be influenced by friends of parents. 

This is not the case with Jeanethe, because if anything, she has been characterized as a young woman who is courageous, resolute, and a fighter. Currently, she is studying Medical Technology, a career that makes her even more human, as she is constantly connected to the wellbeing of many patients.

Jeanethe is requesting the loan to invest in her studies with the purchase of a computer, and to be able to enroll. She knows that all of her efforts are worthwhile because at the end, doing something that she likes and is passionate about will take her very far.  Additionally, her dreams and aspirations are high, as one of her goals is to have a laboratory.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and be able to enroll.

loans.name: Makala Group

texts.en:
Egrey, age 46, sells cows to her local market to earn a living. She started this business in order to sufficiently support her family by providing them with food and other basic necessities. She is the mother of eight children, all of whom depend on her for their daily survival. 

Egrey has successfully repaid a number of loans from the microloan foundation, and she is requesting for another loan in order to expand her business by purchasing more cows. She believes expanding her business will help her increase her returns. 

She hopes to send her children back to school, since most of them had to drop out due to her inability to pay their school fees and meet other school requirements.

loans.use: to buy cows to offer for sale

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a distant village of Stoeung Treng province, Sokhurm is a 29-year-old married woman with seven children. Having a big family to support, Sokhurm and her husband have been planting sweet potatoes for four years, in order to make a living. The plantation provides them 5 USD profit every day.

Sokhurm’s group consists of two members and she has successfully been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner twice. She, as the leader, is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR for her plantation. It will be used to hire workers for her sweet potato plantation. She hopes that she can use the profit from the business to build a better house.

loans.use: to hire workers

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Thala Barivat District

loans.name: G.s La Hermandad Group

texts.es:
G.S. LA HERMANDAD ESTA CONFORMADA POR  TRES INTEGRANTES DOS MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE,  PADRES RESPONSABLE DE FAMILIAS, CON HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES ESTÁN ESTUDIANDO,  ESTAS PERSONAS SON ORIGINARIAS DE LA PAZ CENTRO, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE OCCIDENTE DEL PAÍS, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SACAR SUS NEGOCIO Y SUS FAMILIAS Y BRINDARLES MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES A SUS HIJOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN LA COORDINADOR ES LESTER Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA UNA PULPERIA  ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO: FRIJOLES ACEITE, AZÚCAR, PAN, HUEVOS, FÓSFOROS, DETERGENTES, FRUTAS, VERDURAS, QUESO, CUAJADA. EL DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS.EL G.S. LA HERMANDAD AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LO INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
There are three members, two women and one man, in the La Hermandad community bank. They are all responsible parents with school-age children to raise. They are from the central La Paz area which is located in the western part of the country. The local people are known for being hardworking and responsible, with a great desire to get ahead. Currently they are busy with their businesses and families and hope to provide better opportunities for their children.

Because of his hard work, the coordinator of the group is Lester. He runs a small grocery store selling food items such as beans, oil, sugar, bread, eggs, matches, detergent, fruit, vegetables, cheese, and cottage cheese. Lester spends about twelve hours a day working at the store. He plans to use the loan to buy more stock so that in the not-too-distant future he will increase his income. 

The Hermandad group is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support of poor people and countries such as Nicaragua that are seeking dignified work.

loans.use: buy stock such as beans, oil, sugar, bread, eggs, matches, detergent, fruit, vegetables, cheese, and cottage cheese

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Thelma wants to make improvement in her business and she desires to save more for the future of her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 14 Décembre 2010, lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son neuvième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Awa  (assise à l’extrême droite),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 58ans, mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons et 03 filles. Elle est restauratrice et prépare les 03 repas à savoir : petit déjeuné, déjeuné et le diner.

Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter 03 sacs de riz 13500f le sac, 20 litre d’huile à 15000 du café estimé à une valeur de 26000f le sac de 50 kg pour les revendre à 600f chaque plat de riz et une tasse de café à 50f. 

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle compte aider son mari  dans la dépense quotidienne et renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The group was created on December 14th, 2010, at the inauguration of the village finance association. It just started its ninth loan cycle. The women who belong to it all live in the same village. They like one another and enjoy a good team spirit. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Awa, sitting all the way to the right, is the group’s highlighted borrower. She is 58 years old, married, and a mother of seven—four boys and three girls. She sells prepared food for all three meals: breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

With this new loan, she intends to purchase three bags of rice (13,500 XOF per bag), twenty liters of oil (15,000 XOF per liter), and a fifty-kilo bag of coffee (at an estimated price of 26,000 XOF) to resell at 600 XOF per plate of rice and 50 XOF per cup of coffee.

With the profits, she wants to help her husband pay for the family’s expenses and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice, twenty liters of oil, and a 50-kilo bag of coffee

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 63 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, diapers, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 63 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Segundina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Segundina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura, es una persona que le gusta trabajar en el campo cultivando granos básicos, criando ganado y cerdos, el oficio lo aprendió trabajando con sus padres, tiene 40 años de experiencia, su familia trabaja junto a él en un horario de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, Buenaventura tiene 70 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos, los cuales son dependientes.
El crédito que solicita lo utilizara para pagar mozos que le ayuden a recolectar la cosecha de granos básicos y a preparar la tierra para cultivar yuca, esperar ampliar el área de cultivo de yuca y tener los recursos para procesar la cosecha de maicillo, su riesgo es que está expuesto a un asalto.
Sus aspiraciones son mantener funcionando su negocio, ofrecer a su familia mejor alimentación., educación y salud.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is a man who enjoys his work in the countryside growing grains, and raising cattle and pigs, a job he learned while working with his parents. He has 40 years’ experience in this type of work. His family works alongside him; they start work at 7 am and finish at 3 pm.

Buenaventura is 70 years old and lives with his wife and children, all of whom are his dependents. He is seeking a loan to pay for workers to help with the grain harvest and prepare the ground for yucca plants. He hopes to increase the amount of land where he grows yucca and to have sufficient resources to process the sorghum he produces. He is concerned about robberies.

Buenaventura hopes to keep running his business and to provide his family with better food, education, and healthcare.

loans.use: pay for workers to help with the grain harvest and prepare the ground for yucca plants

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives and works in Bazum village, in the Lori region. He lives with his elderly retired father, wife and two kids (7 and 5 years old). 

For  five years already, Artur has been involved in selling spare parts of cars. He purchases damaged cars, and sell their spare parts to local people or stores in nearby villages. Artur has applied for this loan to ask lenders to support him to purchase two damaged cars. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase two damaged cars and resell  spare parts

loans.name: Sok Korm's Group

texts.en:
So Korm was selected to be the group leader for a loan requested from Maxima.  In the group there are two members and they live in a village in Phnom Penh.

1- So Korm (pictured) is 55 years old and a widow, She lives at Chroy Changva district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has two sons and one daughter. One is married, two are attending school.

So Korm has been selling Cambodian noodles and raising chickens for 10 years.  

She is applying for a $150 (USD) loan to buy feeds for her chickens. She comments that “she will save some money and repay Maxima.

2- Kemsroun (shown in photo) is 38 years old.  She lives at Chroy Changva district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has two sons and two daughters. They are attending school.

Kemsroun has been a weaver for ten years and her husband also does the same type of work. 

She is applying for $400 (USD) loan to buy pigs .  She will repay Maxima every month.

Photo: So Korm on the left and Kemsroun on the right.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens and buy pigs to raise

location.town: Chroy Changva district Phnom Penh city

loans.name: Lilia Group

texts.en:
Emerenciana is the featured borrower of Lilia group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon to earn a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines. 

Emerenciana is a 43-year-old widowed mother of three children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions, thus she is acquiring a Loan to support her family's increasing needs in the Philippines.

Emerenciana is the first lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Elizabeth is the lady standing in the middle, and Marylyn is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to support her family's increasing needs in the Philippines

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en: Sulton is a businessman. He was born in 1972. He is living in a remote district. He is married. He has five children. He has done business for more than eighteen years. He is a repairman of serving people’s houses. He is a well experienced person. He is responsible for feeding and covering all needed everyday life expenditures of his family. He likes his activity. His wife is sick now. He is needed to treat her. Sulton is requesting financial support to treat his wife.

loans.use: To treat his wife

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su vehículo (moto carguera), realiza esta actividad desde hace 03 años contando con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Nicolas espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
53-year old Nicolas is married and lives in his own house with his two children in a rural area of Oyotun district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru’s northern coast. The local people are farmers, raise livestock, or run businesses. 

Nicolas earns his living providing transport for merchandise. It’s a job he’s had for three years and has very good personal and work references. He plans to use the loan to repair and service his vehicle as it is now in a poor state of repair. Then he will be able to offer a better service to his clients, earn more money, and improve his own and his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to repair and service his vehicle

loans.name: Ma. Ronalie

texts.en:
Ma. Ronalie is 27 years old, married, and has one child. Ma. Ronalie works very hard to provide for her family. 

Ma. Ronalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF, in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Ronalie has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Ronalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Thelma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Yessica Yanira

texts.es:
Yessica, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo porque desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para tener mejores ganancias, invertirá en los gastos que implica la recolección de la cosecha de maíz y fortalecerá la tienda comprando aceite, pan, huevos, bebidas, etc., mantendrá sus clientes satisfechos.
Hoy en día el negocio de Yessica es mucho más rentable por los beneficios que tiene como resultado de la inversión anterior, ya que la granja de pollos se ha mantenido funcionando, su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida y ha logrado disminuir sus deudas.
texts.en:
Yessica decided on a new loan because she wants to keep investing in her business to have better profits. She will invest in paying for expenses for the corn harvest and to fortify her store by buying oil, bread, eggs, beverages, etc., to keep her customers satisfied.  

Today Yessica's business is a lot more profitable because of the benefits from the previous loan. The chicken farm is still in operation, her family has a better standard of living, and she has been able to reduce her debts.

loans.use: to invest in paying expenses for the corn harvest and fortify her store by buying oil, bread, eggs, beverages, etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
From the countryside near the Kaplamai, Kitale area of Kenya, James is a jobless man-turned farmer.   He is a hardworking man and aggressive with the principle of truth on his lips; he is honest and faithful to what he does and what he says. James is also the father of two lovely children.  

“Kaplamai” in the local dialect means “valley”. In this valley are a people who, in their totality, constitute wrenching statistics. Hardcore poverty pervades every homestead yet every day when you look beyond the numbers, you will see a sea of people: a sea of about two thousand bright, vibrant, open faces, searching and yearning for the opportunity to live a life of dignity and respect. 

They have the conviction that it’s possible. Armed with this conviction, James has kept hope and has been toiling on his farm for the past 7 years. His primary sources of income have been milk, poultry, and some “side hustles”(Motorcycle business) he does to supplement the meager income he earns from farming. 

The Kaplamai area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a sea of people, but the mill keeps breaking down; hence farmers are not able to grind their maize. James intends to change this and is requesting a loan to buy an electric posho mill, which will grind corn or maize into flour. Maize meal is very common in Kenya and is a staple food for many communities. Many Kenyan families consume the maize product “ugali“ (hard porridge) regularly. 

The market usually provides sifted flour, but the cost is higher because of the sifting and packaging. Cheaper flour can be obtained by milling the maize directly using a posho mill. 

Through this loan, James will be able to grind maize faster because he will use an electric posho mill. Cases of breakdown will be history, because electric posho mills are more reliable. 

This loan will assist James to permanently change his life and achieve his life's mission of bringing economic development and poverty alleviation to communities in arid and semi-arid areas. Profits from the posho mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan, which James promises to fully repay on time. 

In the next two years, James sees himself as an established businessman who will be running more than one posho mill in his remote village. 

James patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an electric posho mill

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas and his wife have worked on their current farm situated in the outskirts of Siongiroi town, Kenya, since 2000. Since then, their farm and family have grown in more ways than one. In 2010, the couple started working on a run-down farm. Today, they are making money off the poultry and dairy animals they raise and also the maize and vegetables they grow. Nicholas has further invested in transportation services to reduce their transportation costs and make money offering the service to other farmers.

Nicholas loves to dairy farm, especially since it was always a life goal of his to be a farmer. His wife understands this and together they joined hearts and hands to make the farm's success to date happen. Nicholas is seeking a loan to purchase a pedigree dairy cow. There are more than 100 cattle breeds in Kenya. However, not all are good producers of milk. In fact, very few are. Cattle aside, the tastes and preferences of milk in the market is really growing in diversity in Kenya. Drinking milk is no longer a matter of pouring it into our cereal bowl, adding it to our coffee, or drinking it straight from the glass, we now have preferences in the type of milk we drink.

Today, milk consumers are spoiled for choice. In the market, we have old-fashioned cow’s milk and lactose-free milk, not to mention non-dairy options such as soy, almond, rice and coconut milk. It takes dairy masters like Nicholas to pick up these shifts in the market and adopt ingenious techniques in farming to ensure that their product qualities adapt to the changes in consumer preference. Purchasing a pedigree cow goes to show how Nicholas is keen on controlling lameness levels in his dairy cattle. He considers breeding to be the core of his overall strategy of ensuring that milk quantity is way above average and the milk quality is second to none in the market. He anticipates that feeding will be his highest cost of milk production. This, to him, is accepted because to get cows that milk well and remain healthy, they have to be fed properly.

Your loan will make a significant difference to Nicholas's farm profitability. The couple will make use of the returns from this investment to pay for the loan, pay for their children’s education and the rest will be reinvested in the business. It has always been their ambition to share their passion about farming with their children. They hope the kids will be thrilled to join the business of running the family farm. By helping Nicholas you will be helping a farmer who takes litres of milk daily to large businesses where it is distributed and then consumed by thousands of Kenyans.

loans.use: To buy a high pedigree cow

loans.name: Tot

texts.en:
Tot would like to take a loan to repair her food stall and buy some new bowls, chopsticks, and spoons for her stall. 

Tot's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her food stall and buy bowls, chopsticks, and spoons

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita and her mother live in Vanadzor town. Margarita is a psychologist by profession. She works at a local secondary school as a teacher, and also after her work, provides individual training from her house. Her mother is involved in renovation of sofas and soft furniture.

To be able to purchase a laptop and materials for providing individual training from her house, Maragarita asks for lenders' support. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop and materials for providing individual training from her house.

loans.name: Sofio

texts.en:
Sofio, who is 30-year-old woman, lives in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. She has a school-aged daughter and lives with her brother, who generates the only income for family. He works at the petrol station and gets 300 GEL monthly. 

The family finds it hard to be financially stable with only one income and require financial support to start a new type of business. 

Sofio couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows poor people like Sofio to get a chance for starting or re-starting a business. 

She will open a small general store at a good location of the local central market and needs money for purchasing all the equipment and merchandise, such as refrigerators and stands.   She thinks that business will be profitable, as it has a great location and will attract many clients. 

Sofio relies on the good will of Kiva lenders and will be really grateful for the help.

loans.use: to purchase food products to open a small general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, iron and cement to finish her house.

loans.name: Upendo Msikitini Group

texts.en:
Paulina is in her late 30s, married, and has four children. She has a beauty salon which she has been running for two years. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and earns a minimal monthly profit. 

This is Paulina's first loan from Tujijenge. She plans to use it to help improve her beauty salon so she can increase her profits. 

Paulina will share this loan with her loan group, Upendo Msikitini, which consists of ten people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to help improve her beauty salon

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is a businesswoman from Ormoc, Leyte. She has been operating a small motorcycle repair shop with her husband for almost a year now. This is the source of their income.

Mary Cris is asking to take a loan to buy materials for the shop, such as spare parts like wheel tires, nuts and bolts, chains, screw drivers, gear oil, batteries, and other materials needed to repair motorcycles.

A loan will help Mary Cris and her husband to improve their business, thus giving them the chance to cater to more customers in their repair shop.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shop, such as spare parts like wheel tires, nuts and bolts, chains, screw drivers, gear oil, and batteries.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is still single but she dreams big for her future.  She is a resident of Leyte, in the Philippines.  She runs a sari-sari (general) store business and sells different items to the people in her locality.  She is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell in her store, such as snack food, coffee and other beverages, toiletries, detergent, and canned food.  

In the future, Marilou dreams of making her business a success and to save money so she can venture into other business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy snack food, coffee and other beverages, toiletries, detergent, and canned food to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She is from Ormoc, Leyte. She has been making furniture with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income.Judith is standing next to her husband Dominador who is working on his furniture product. 

Judith is asking for a loan to buy more materials like wood, bamboo, nails and other materials. With this loan, Judith and her husband will be able to make more furniture, thus allowing them to sell more to the market. In the future, Judith hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more materials like wood, bamboo, nails and others

loans.name: Asila

texts.en:
Asila is a hardworking woman. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband doesn’t work. So, they live very poorly. 

Three months ago, Asila began her own business in animal husbandry. She buys cattle, feeds it for some months, and sells it in a local market. 

Asila wants to expand her new business. With this aim she took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization, and received a certificate. 

Asila is asking for a loan of 500 TJS to buy cattle to increase her working capital. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase working capital

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan enriched her business. She was able to buy additional gallons and supplies needed in her water distribution business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures of her family.

She is very positive that she could improve her business if you will help her borrow an amount of 15,000 PHP.  This new loan will go to additional supplies of gallons for mineral water to increase her profits. An increase in profits will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from water distribution, Gina also offers rooms for rent for additional income.  She knows that all her hard work in business will pay off someday. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for mineral water to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a 47-year-old widow and the mother of six children; one of her sons is also shown in the photo. Chan has been working at hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community and her designs are in high demand. Chan has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue operations, Chan has taken a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will enable her to cater to more customers consistently. Chan hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her children's bright future and desires to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita tiene 55 años de edad, vive en casa propia de un piso de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en el Distrito de Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería y su vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

Ella se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimore, tiene terreno agrícola propio donde esta ubicada su parcela de café. Esta actividad la realiza hace 04 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y cría de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, esto lo realiza en su mismo domicilio. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, con esto Felicita espera obtener una mayor y mejor producción y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Felicita is 55 years old. She lives in her one rustic one story home with her husband and their three children in the Santo Tomás district, located in Cutervo province, in the Cajamarca region of Peru’s northern sierra. She lives in a small community that is mostly devoted to agriculture and raising livestock. Her home has running water and electricity.

She grows the Catimor variety of coffee. She owns the land where her coffee plot is located. She has been doing this for four years, and has experience in the area of growing coffee, and she has very good work and character references in her region. 

She also raises cattle and smaller animals such as hens, ducks, and turkeys among others. She does this from her own home.

The loan is intended for the purchase of compost and fertilizer to continue growing her coffee. With it, Felicita hopes to have greater and better production and as a result increased income that will help improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer to care for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Mong

texts.en:
Mong, 31, is married. She lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a grocery store for seven years. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying different products to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy different products to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh is 59 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a worshipping shop to earn a living. 

She started her business seven years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different religious articles to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different religious articles to sell

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is 56 years old and has 7 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 7 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Grace has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Grace also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Grace's Group will be able to receive a total of 5 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds, and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is 27 years old and married with one son. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income through running a food stall that sells pork bologna.

She started her business three years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying good quality pork-bologna products to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and helps her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy good quality pork-bologna products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a 54-year-old married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has had a  clothing business for 2 years. She requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

 In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a 50-year-old married woman with 5 children.she is conservative woman and asked her son to take her place in the photo.  Aisha did not complete her education, but she want to be productive woman and provide a comfortable life for her children. She wishes to meet their daily and educational needs. She helped her married son in his shop to sell the products and learn about accounting. She later opened her household items shop, started her business, and opened her small market.  She applied for a loan to develop and expand her business also buy  products to sell.  She wants to  increase her income and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to develop and expand her business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 44 years old and has three children. When she gave birth to the youngest kid about thirteen years ago, she suffered from Poliatrit rheumatism and since then she has not been feeling very well. According to her, she has aches all the times and the body transformed completely after giving birth, making her to feel very low in self-esteem as well.

Valentina receives a disability income of about $99/month in addition to some social assistance of $52/month. Her oldest child, the 19-year-old son, has started working as a waiter for a pay of $150/month and her husband works for a pay of $200/month. Recently, Valentina started a new activity, buying and reselling used clothes in a little town in northern Albania and this loan will help her stock up on inventory of such items.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items of used clothes. This is a new activity for Valentina.

loans.name: Suomo Group

texts.en:
Philomina. is the featured borrower of the Suomo group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, ID-Ghana, because they have always been neighbors and friends. The members' various businesses include electrical appliance, jeans, phone credits, and milk. 

Philomina is a 27-year-old married woman and has two children. 

Six years ago, Philomina started selling phone credit cards and ice cream to increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

Philomina is working hard to develop this business as much as she can to increase her capital and attract new customers. 

She is now well-known in her region and she is working hard to serve many customers.  

Philomina is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, ID-Ghana, to increase her business merchandise with phone card credits and ice cream. 

Philomina is the woman standing second from the right in the picture.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with phone card credits and ice cream

loans.name: Okiljon

texts.ru:
Окилджон мужчина в возрасте 38 лет. Он живёт в джамоате  Хурми. Он женат и имеет четырех детей.  Его жену зовут Хадиса. Она домохозяйка.  Он работает  таксистом. Кроме этого он занимается земледелием и животноводством. Этого дохода хватает Окилджону  на проживание. 
Но у него есть мечта, Окилджон хочет построить большой дом для своей семьи. Но для этого ему необходимы денежные средства. То, что он зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе построение нового дома. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Окилджон надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Okiljon is a 38-year-old man who lives in the municipality of Khurmi. He is married and has four children. His wife's name is Khadisa and she is a homemaker. Okiljon drives a taxi, plants crops and raises livestock to earn a living. 

Okiljon has a dream, however. He wants to build a big house for his family, but does not have enough money. What he earns is not enough to afford building a new house. This is why he applied for a loan with Arvand to buy building materials and construct a new house. Okiljon hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Savoern's Group

texts.en:
Savoern is a rural farmer from Phnom Srouch district of Kampong Spue province.  Savoern is a 44-year-old widowed mother of two children. She has earned a living through rice farming. The current business earns her about 13,000 KHR. 
This is her first loan from VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for this loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to build a decent latrine for  her family.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan enriched her business. She was able to buy additional raw ingredients needed in her food production business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow an amount of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies she needs in making peanut butter. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Jessa wants to give her family a better life someday. She hopes that her profit from business will continue to boost. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional ingredients and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 7 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is blurred in the photo is 27 years old and lives in an very dangerous region. She is married and the mother of two children, ages five and two. 

She owns a bakery that she's run in her home for the past seven years. The quality with which she bakes bread has attracted a large customer base over the years, and income from the bakery allows her to meet her household expenses. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of flour, sugar, flavored gelatin, molds, and other supplies. These investments will allow her to continue operating the bakery, boost her income, and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, flavored gelatin, molds, and other supplies.

loans.name: Zhirayr

texts.en: Zhirayr is from Vanadzor town. He is a sportsman. Besides working at Vanadzor's sports complex as a trainer, he also provides individual training in freestyle wrestling. Zhirayr faces sports equipment problems. The equipment is very important for organizing effective trainings. He asks lenders to support him in purchasing sports equipment. Zhirayr has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for sports equipment for training.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Isaac, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 52-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of his family, with a wife and three children, he farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nyamira, in the Nyanza region of Kenya. For the past 21 years, he has been practicing mixed farming and his primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs and maize. He also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income he earns through farming. Isaac passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge he faces is feeding his cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. He is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy shed and buy another quality breed of dairy cow. Through the loan, he will have a humble time milking his cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and it also protects them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Isaac also intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 15-25 litres of milk a day. The selling price for milk is 40 Kenya shillings per liter and through this loan; he will be making a cool US $11 per day. Before Isaac joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance that supports smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, he considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have a future promise for income generation. After training, Isaac now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want a rather less rough way into the “millionaires club”. With the loan, Isaac will increase his income from milk selling and his cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows and through this loan, Isaac will achieve this. An increase in income will allow Isaac to improve his living conditions and secure the future of his children. His dream is to continue improving his dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Isaac fears that his dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide its reliable market channel, credit facility and services that he requires to grow his dairy enterprise.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit and buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 39, is married and has two children: a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living by repairing motorcycles for his customers. Thuy earns an income selling fish in the market. 

She started this business seven years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of fish to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of fish to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is requesting a new loan to buy a larger quantity and variety of new products such as household items and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in expanding the size of her store and increasing sales, and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity and variety of new products such as household items and beverages

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam is requesting a new loan to buy sewing materials and clothing. Tam's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support herself. She hopes that another loan will assist her in expanding the size of her business and attracting new customers. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and clothing

loans.name: Tionge Group

texts.en:
Lucy thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to buy more fish. Lucy's main aim is to buy a fishing boat for her husband, so that they may start fishing themselves, as buying fish from fishermen is expensive. But since a boat is expensive, she is still waiting until she gets enough capital.

She is requesting another loan in order to buy different kinds of fish, hoping this will help her to increase her capital. She plans to send her children to private schools.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fish

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives with two sons and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a driver. For 6 years, she has been running a business of sewing bags for selling.

Huong would like a loan to purchase a better quality sewing machine to increase her production. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality sewing machine

loans.name: Them's Group

texts.en: Them’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Them makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sav's Group

texts.en: Sav’s group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Sav makes a living cultivating rice and planting lotus to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help the group to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hawachicken Group

texts.en:
Emy is the featured borrower of Hawachicken group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines. Emy is a 48-year-old married mother of two children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. Thus, she is acquiring a loan to support her family's increasing needs in the Philippines.

Emy is the first lady on the right. With respect to the other group members, Matessie is the second lady on the left, Pulminar is the second lady on the right, and Gloria is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to support her family's increasing needs in the Philippines

loans.name: Jeremie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jeremie works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Jeremie is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Jeremie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 52 years old and a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lanie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lanie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy a larger quantity of rice products to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and that it will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of rice products to restock her general store

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu, 42, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one son and her husband is a builder. She started the business making backpacks to sell to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more cloth, materials and sewing tools. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest into her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cloth, materials and sewing tools

loans.name: Evaline's Group

texts.en:
Evaline's Group is formed by 9 farmers in the Webuye District and is being represented by Evaline, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 56 years old, married, and has 4 children. Evaline has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Evaline isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. 

This year, Evaline will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Evaline's Group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds, and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is 34 years old and has seven children. She has been a farmer for 15 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Eunice is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group of 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Eunice started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Eunice’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of five acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Iroda

texts.en: Iroda is divorced. She lives in a village with her four children. Iroda is the only breadwinner for her four children. Her former husband doesn’t help her with providing the children with all necessary things. Iroda began her own business five months ago because she needed money. She has been busy with animal husbandry for five months. She plans to develop her business and in this way to get ahead in life. She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and got a certificate. She got useful information for herself. She needs financial support so Iroda is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni to buy cattle to increase the working capital of her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase the  working capital of her new business.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1969. She lives in a small town. She is married and has three children. Her husband helps her to do a business. 

Mavjuda is a hardworking, responsible and kind person. She is a vendor. She sells dry fruit in a domestic market. She has a great number of satisfied clients every day. She is well known among sellers. 

Mavjuda was a participant of a training session, "Woman Entrepreneur - achieve success." She gained a lot of information to start thinking like an entrepreneur. She had an idea to open a new business of keeping livestock at home and then selling them in the domestic market. She is requesting financial support from Kiva lenders to buy cattle in order to start her new business.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to start her new business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 35,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional grocery items, beverages and toiletries she needs to expand her store. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Francisca wants to improve and expand her business. She also desires that her family always be healthy and free from any form of sickness. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is 37 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for fifteen years and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though Eunice is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by fourteen farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Eunice started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has learnt a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Eunice’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of ten solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Christie

texts.en:
Christie is 37 years old, married and has one child in school.

Christie is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Christie requested a PHP 37,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Christie has been farming sugarcane for seven years now and has borrowed 28 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Christie would like to save enough in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 56 year old married woman, and she has seven children, three of which are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lolita has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Lolita requested a 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lolita has been in this business for thirty years. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess is 41 years old. married, and has four children, one of which is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maritess has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Maritess requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Maritess has been in this business for 16 years. 

In the future, Maritess would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Geoffrey's Group

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 53-year-old proud father of 6 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Geoffrey has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Geoffrey described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Geoffrey’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Ma. Nelly

texts.en:
Ma. Nelly is 57 years old, and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Nelly has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ma. Nelly has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Peace-Shalom Group

texts.en:
Victoria is the featured borrower of this group that hails from Teshie-Accra, Ghana. She is 40 years old and is married with two children. She has a small family comprising four members, including two children who are in school.

With the help of her husband, she has been in the business of selling silver products and pastries for the last 21 years. Presently, her monthly family income is good, but it is not sufficient to lead a better life.

This is her sixth loan from ID-Ghana. With this loan, she will purchase silver products and pastries in bulk to sell to customers.

Her future plan is to construct a house and to provide higher education for her children. She is very happy and thankful to Kiva's lenders for this support.

The other members of this group are involved in different business activities: the sale of vegetables, firewood and soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase silver products and pastries in bulk to sell to customers.

loans.name: Moses's Group

texts.en:
Moses is 50 years old and has nine children. He is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by ten farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Moses has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Moses also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Moses's Group will be able to receive a total of nine solar lights, as well as farming supplies to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. 

Justine sells second-hand clothes on a door-to-door basis. She has been in this business for the past four years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes for resale. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goal and aspiration is to build permanent business premises. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en: Parvina is a generous woman. She was born in 1995. She is living in a small town. She is single. She is a second-year student. She wants to help her parents with their finances. She was a participant in a three-day training where she learned a lot about how to start a business. She is planning to be a sewer. She is seeking financial support to buy a sewing machine and start her business. She is hoping that Kiva will help her with her finances.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Sulaina

texts.en:
Sulaina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child. She takes care of one additional family member. 

Sulaina operates a boutique, selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for the past five years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes. 

Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build a permanent business premises. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anne's Group

texts.en:
Anne's Group consists of eight farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Anne, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 30 years old, is married and has four children. Anne has been a farmer for eight years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Anne isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2014, and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. 

This year, Anne will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Anne's Group will purchase a total of seven solar lights and use the farming supplies received to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
Ma. Socorro is 40 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Ma. Socorro works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell at her store. 

Ma. Socorro has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns income from raising livestock.

Ma. Socorro aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun lives in Vanadzor town. He is a teacher with 10 years of experience working in that field. Besides the work in the school, Harutyun provides individual training for his students from his house.

To be able to purchase a laptop which will help him to make the classes more effective, Harutyun has applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop to provide individual classes for students.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli lives in Hovuni village, Shirak region with her husband and two children. 

Her daughter (on the left in the photo) is a student at Pedagogical University, where she is studying in her third year. Nelli's husband is a migrant worker trying to support his family financially. 

Nelli, to be able to pay for her daughter Valya's university tuition, is asking for this loan. She hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Moses's Group

texts.en:
Moses, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group, formed by seven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. He is 39 years old and a married father of five children, and is often described as a very friendly person. 

Although Moses has been a farmer for eight years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though he is new to the program, Moses wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Moses hopes to be able to send his children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming supplies to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of three solar lights as, even though Moses decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Arcadie

texts.en:
Mr. Arcadie, 42 years old and is married with two daughters. They are a hardworking and energetic family. He is a farmer and owns 7.9 hectares of land, of which 2.9 is an apple orchard and the other 5 being arable land cultivated with corn, sunflower and alfalfa. In the spring of 2015, he would like to plant 1.3 hectares of apple seedlings grafted personally by him. 

His dream is to purchase a second-hand tractor which costs about $4300. He has saved and set aside $1300 for personal contribution with the remaining $3000 the amount being requested. With the tractor, he will be able to sow the crops faster, with better timing for the growing season and will also be able to cultivate the new apple orchard. With the ability to sow and cultivate more crops faster and in the right time period. He will be able to bring in a larger and higher quality harvest, which means that his potential for bring in more profit is much higher. 

If Mr. Arcadie is able to purchase this tractor and increase his output he will need to hire more workers to keep up with the demand of his business. Through the purchase of a single tractor it will impact the lives of many families through increased productivity and job creation.

loans.use: To pay for a tractor to cultivate new crops.

loans.name: Wartanosh

texts.en: Wartanosh is a 55-year-old married mother of one child. She opened her grocery shop four years ago to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. Wartanosh is an ambitious lady and a hard worker who is trying hard to develop her business. Thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new special products to satisfy her customers' needs in this cold winter season. Wartanosh hopes to expand her business more in the future to stay capable of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new special products to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Rodayna

texts.en: Rodayna is a 48-year-old widow woman from Nablus city. She lives with her four sons and one daughter. Rodayna sells candy in a stall next to her house. Rodayna took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more products for her candy stall to resell. By taking this loan, Rodayna will be able to increase her sales and also her income. Rodayna appeared in the photo while she was working.

loans.use: to buy more products for her candy stall to resell.

loans.name: Melsa's Group

texts.en:
Melsa is 52 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.
