Melsa has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Melsa also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Melsa's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Maria Felipa

texts.es:
Maria tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil separada, vive con sus 02 menores hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad rural y pequeña donde los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como pollos, gallinas, patos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender con mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le va a generar mayores ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 46 years old and separated. She lives with her two young children in her own house in the district of Cayaltí located in the province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, on the Northern coast of Peru. She lives in a rural and small community where the inhabitants work mainly in farming, livestock and commerce. She works raising and selling animals, such as chickens, hens, ducks, among others. She has more than 10 years of experience in the business, and has very good personal and work references. Her business is located in her own house. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals, and also to buy balanced feed to fatten these animals. This loan will be useful to offer her customers more variety of animals, which will generate more income and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals, and also to buy balanced feed to fatten these animals.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 44 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Margaret has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Margaret also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Margaret's Group will be able to receive a total of 17 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: pay labor for weeding, and for guarding field against predators

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Thôn Trầu Xã Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Mrs Đông operates a food stall/restaurant selling breakfast. She is requesting a loan to purchase food to make breakfast for sale. 

Đông is 42 years old and she is married with 2 children. Đông is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 Thôn Trầu Xã Công Liêm solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. In 2014, Đông joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Đông has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Đông has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

The main hardship that Đông faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Đông hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase food to make breakfast for sale

loans.name: Muyassara

texts.en: Muyassara was born in 1984. She is married and has five non-adult children. She is a very hardworking woman and works hard from early morning until late evening to earn her living. She has had her own business deal for six months. She buys cattle, feeds them for some months and then sells them in a local market. Muyassara is going to develop a new business and maximize her profit. From the profit, she is going to improve her living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy cattle to increase the working capital of the new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase the working capital for her new business

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Mary, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 28 years old, married and has four children. Mary has been a farmer for six years and is often referred to as a very resourceful person.

Mary isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Mary will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Mary's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize  harvests

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Susan, who, as a group leader, is representing her group of six farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to three children. She is known in her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Susan joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the upcoming harvesting season, Susan plans to send her children to school.

Between the six farmers in Susan's Group, a total of 3.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvests

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 7 to 17 years. She describes herself to be patient and honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and other items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase wholesale second hand clothing in order to increase her sales and pay for her little children's expenses.

loans.name: Maxuell

texts.en: Maxuell is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a repair business where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy repair equipment. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy equipment to repair motor vehicles

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Eva works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her charcoal retailing and farming rice businesses. Eva is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items like blouses, curtains, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, curtains, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Rose has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rose also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Rose's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: 11-04-01 Hòa Bình 1 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Hoan has operated a manufacturing business sewing clothing for 7 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase machines for tailor-made clothing and repair service.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Hoan is 65 years old and married with 3 children.  She is the group leader of the 11-04-01 Hòa Bình 1 Trường Thi solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.  This is her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Hoan hopes her business will do well and remain successful, and that her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase machines for a tailor-made clothing and repair service.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is in school.

Nenita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Nenita requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for six years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: G.s Fe Y Espernza La Paz Centro Group

texts.es:
G.S. FE Y ESPERANZA LA PAZ CENTRO ESTA CONFORMADO POR  MUJERES, MADRES SOLTERA RESPONSABLES DE OCHO HIJOS, MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES ESTÁN ESTUDIANDO, SE  CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE ACTIVIDADES EN FAMILIAS Y PASAR TIEMPO DE CALIDAD CON SUS HIJOS. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SALIR ADELANTE CON SUS NEGOCIOS, TODAS TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONÓMICAS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES  MARÍA DEL CARMEN Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA  LA VENTA DE ROPA NUEVA. COMO PANTALONES, FALDAS JENS, SHORT, ROPA INTERIOR, TOALLAS, ROPA DE CAMA. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO CON NUEVA MERCADERÍA, ELLA DEDICA A UNAS OCHO HORAS DIARIAS AL NEGOCIO, PARA OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO. G.S. FE Y ESPERANZA LA PAZ CENTRO AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
G.S. FE Y ESPERANZA LA PAZ CENTRO is made up of women. The members are single mothers responsible for eight children, all of which are minors and in school. The group is characterized as being hard-working, responsible, and eager for success. In their free time, they like to enjoy family activities and to spend quality time with their children. 

Now they struggle to move forward with their businesses. All the members have different businesses. Thanks to her desire to succeed, the coordinator is Maria Del Carmen, and her business is in new clothing sales. She sells pants, jean skirts, underwear, shorts, towels and bed linens.

This loan will be used as working capital to supply her business with new merchandise. She works 8 hours, every day, in order to be profitable in the near future.

G.S. FE Y ESPERANZA LA PAZ CENTRO appreciates the assistance that Kiva investors provide, which enables people of scarce resources, in poor countries like Nicaragua, to have a decent working environment.

loans.use: to invest in new clothes; such as pants, jean skirts, shorts, underwear, towels, bed linens, etc.

loans.name: Nhóm 09 Hòa Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân operates a food stall/restaurant selling seafood. Xuân is 54 years old and she is married with 4 children. 

In 2014, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Xuân has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 09 Hòa Hải solidarity group. 

Xuân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more seafood to resell.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood to sell.

loans.name: 020102030003 Hồng Kỳ - Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Kim works in agriculture raising marine aquaculture and is requesting a loan to purchase more baby shrimp to raise and sell.  She has been involved in this business for 5 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Kim is 28 years old and married with no children.  She is the group leader of the 020102030003 Hồng kỳ - Hoằng phụ solidarity group, which consists of 7 members.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Kim joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Kim hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby shrimp to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mamarasul

texts.en: Mamarasul was born in 1967. He lives with his family in the north part of Tajikistan. Mamarasul is married and has two children. He is a businessman. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 15 years. He has great experience in this field and little by little with the passing of the time, perfected his knowledge. Mamarasul is going to increase his working capital and that’s why he is asking for a loan of 8,000 Somoni to buy cattle. He awaits your mercy. This loan will help him to develop his business and improve his living condition.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Karima

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Карима. Ей 48 лет. Она уроженка маленького городка Исфара. Карима мать двоих прекрасных детей. Сыну 17 лет, дочке 23 года. Карима всю свою жизнь посвятила своим детям и старалась, чтобы они не в чем не нуждались. У нее нет высшего образования и тем более найти работу в тех краях нелегко, поэтому она научилась шить и принимает заказы на шитье женской одежды. В работе в основном ее поддерживает дочка. 
   Причина обращения Каримы за кредитом является нехватка денежных средств на покупку новой швейной машинки. В течение долгого времени она шила на одной старой швейной машинки и Кариме давно хотелось купить современную  машинку с большим количеством функций. Она собрала деньги, но ей все равно не хватает. Карима считает, что приняла верное решение и обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется на Вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en:
Karima is 48 years old. She was born in the small town of Isfara. Karima is the mother of two wonderful children: her son is 17 years old and her daughter is 23 years old. Karima has dedicated her life to her children and has always done what she could so that her children would be well taken care of. Karima has no college degree, and finding work in her region is hard in any case, so she learned how to saw and takes orders for women's clothing. She is mostly assisted by her daughter in this work.

The reason Karima is applying for a loan is the lack of funds for a new sewing machine. For a long time she has been using a single old sewing machine, wishing for a modern one with many stitch functions. Karima has been saving money, but still does not have enough. She thinks she has taken the right decision to apply for a loan. She trusts in your goodwill.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Nhóm 05, Thôn 1, Trường Giang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyên works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Nguyên is 51 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 05, Thôn 1, Trường Giang solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. In 2010, Nguyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nguyên has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Nguyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nguyên faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Nguyên hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 54 years old, married and has four children.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fe has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Safeena

texts.en: Safeena is a 57-year-old single woman. She is shown with her nephew in the photo.  She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them. Then she sells them in her locality.  Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. Now she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to buy more baby goats and calves for resale purposes to bear her daily expenses efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats and calves for resale purposes to bear her daily expenses efficiently.

loans.name: 020306020004 Đại Long - Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Xang has worked in agriculture farming rice for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more seed to farm rice.

Xang is 61 years old and married with 4 children.  She is the group leader of the 020306020004 Đại long - Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of 6 members.  She lives in the Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Xang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  She has successfully repaid 4 loans.

With her business profit, Xang hopes her family will be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more seed to farm rice.

loans.name: 020404210002 Hải Sơn _ Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Duyến operates a food stall to sell seafood. Duyến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  She requests a loan to purchase more seafood to resell.

Duyến is 57 years old and  married with 3 children.
She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 020404210002 Hải Sơn _ Hoằng Trường solidarity group. 
Vinh lives  in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Duyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Duyến has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Duyến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

 Duyến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood.

loans.name: 020404220002 Hải Sơn _ Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Lài operates a food stall to sell fish. Lài has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.   She requests a loan to purchase more tools to catch fish.

Lài is 45 years old and married with 3 children.
She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 020404220002 Hải sơn _ Hoằng Trường solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Lài joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lài has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

 Lài hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain  a successful business, and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to catch fish.

loans.name: 020306060003 Đại Long-Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương works in agriculture raising poultry. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Hương is 49 years old and she is married with one child.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hương is the group leader of the 020306060003 Đại long-Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. In 2009, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy a cell phone.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 020403180003 Thanh Xuan _ Hoang Truong Group

texts.en:
Tươi operates a food stall to sell fish. Tươi has been involved in this business for 8 years.  She requests a loan to purchase  tools to catch fish.

Tươi is 28 years old and  married with 2 children.
She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 020403180003 Thanh Xuan _ Hoang Truong solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Tươi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tươi has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tươi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy,  her children to do well in school, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Sulaina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single woman with 1 child. She takes care of one additional family member. 

She has sold second hand clothes door-to-door  for 5 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested 200,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major challenges includes changing seasons and transportation. 

Her goal and aspiration is to expand her business into a boutique. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity and but not running water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Segunda Celia

texts.es:
Segunda tiene 70 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo en casa propia en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural del distrito de Zaña que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de patos y cuyes, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 15 años contando con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como patos, cuyes, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. De esta manera Segunda espera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segunda is 70 years old and married. She lives with her spouse in her home in a small community in the rural area of the Zaña district that is located in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. Life in this district is quiet. Most of the villagers make their living through agriculture and raising animals.

She makes a living by raising and selling ducks and guinea pigs. She has worked in this business for over 15 years ago. She has business experience and very good personal and work references in the area.

She requests this loan to buy a larger quantity of animals; such as ducks, guinea pigs, chickens, among others, as well as to buy balanced feed to fatten them. In this manner, Segunda hopes to expand her business, to obtain more income, and to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals such as ducks, guinea pigs, chickens, among others, as well as to buy balanced feed for these.

loans.name: Mơ

texts.en:
Mơ works in agriculture.  Mơ has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Mơ is 30 years old and she is married with 3 children.
She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Mơ first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Mơ faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She  requests a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

Mơ hopes for her business to do well, her family to be healthy and happy, and her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: 020306080003 Đại Long - Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lý works in agriculture raising livestock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Lý is 51 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Lý is the group leader of the 020306080003 Đại long - Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. In 2014, Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lý has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Lý has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lý faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Lý hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Thuấn

texts.en:
Thuấn raises poultry and cattle.  Thuấn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  Thuấn is 44 years old and he is married with 2 children.
Thuấn lives  in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thuấn first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thuấn faces is not having a hygienic latrine. He requests a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

Thuấn hopes for his family to be healthy and happy,  his business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for his children.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as honest. She has operated a restaurant for 2 years. Her primary customers are local people. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use 20,000 KES to buy material to renovate the restaurant. Her business goal is to have a hotel within 5 years. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate the restaurant.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is a 24-yeaer-old married woman. Her father-in-law (shown in the photo) has manufactured shoes for years. He is an energetic person who makes enough money to provide the basic necessities to his family members. 

Romana requests 30,000 PKR to buy leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles for him to make shoes. In this way he can handle the growing demand for his shoes in the market.

loans.use: to buy  material to make shoes, including leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles.

loans.name: Glady's Group

texts.en:
Gladys's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Gladys, who is the group leader pictured above. She is a 41-year- old married woman with 4 children. Gladys has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Gladys isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she  joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family. This year, Gladys will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Gladys's Group will purchase a total of 8 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds, and fertilizer to improve the maize harvest.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Five years ago, Raphael started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Labotiet, a remote village in the Singiroi area of Kenya. Today, this humble father of four children sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. He is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge he has about farming, he commands a lot of respect from other farmers in his village. Dairy farming is close to his heart and every day he wakes up to milk his cows and that makes him very proud. 

Although he makes profits through milk selling, he lacks a proper dairy unit and he is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit.  A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions and rain. Raphael believes that this loan will change his living conditions  because he is going to  increase milk production. He will save money that he used to spend on treating his cows because he lacked a good dairy unit. 

Raphael waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy and sell household products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell peanuts by the hundredweight.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fertilisers, manure, anti-pest treatments, weed-killers and other items.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 30 años al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo, cuando la cosecha ya esta alista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: controles de plagas, semillas, herbicidas, abonos, fertilizantes, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: José is 46 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with his wife. For 30 years José has made a living growing corn, beans and sorghum. Once the harvest is ready, he stores his goods in granaries (shown in the photo) to sell it at a later date. José is able to cover some household costs with his profits from sales. José is applying for another loan in order to buy necessary farming supplies, such as anti-pest treatments, seeds, week-killers, manure, fertilisers and more, and thus earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy necessary farming supplies, such as anti-pest treatments, seeds, week-killers, manure, fertilisers and more.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la pesca artesanal, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas redes, trasmallos y darle mantenimiento a la lancha que es el que muestra en la fotografía para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young woman is 28 years old (her face has been pixelated because she lives in a high-risk area) and for ten years has made a living as a fisherwoman. She sells her products in the markets near to her home. This borrower lives in a privately-owned house with her husband and daughter. She is applying for another loan in order to buy more nets and trammel nets, and to maintain her fishing boat (shown in the photo) and thus earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more nets and trammel nets, and to maintain her fishing boat.

loans.name: Ahorrar Es Exito Group

texts.es: Zolema tiene 47 años de edad es soltera con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda hace 20 años y hace 1 años amplio su bodega con la venta de ropa para niños y adultos. Años atrás se dedicaba a su hogar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes bebidas aceites y ropas. El grupo “AHORRAR ES ÉXITO”  agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Zolema es la que tiene a su hijo en brazos.
texts.en:
Zolema is 47 years old, single and has three dependent children. She has had a grocery shop in her house for 20 years. She expanded the shop a year ago in order to begin selling clothing for both children and adults. Years ago, Zolema only looked after the household. Zolema will use this loan to buy more groceries, drinks, oils and clothing. 

The “Ahorrar es éxito” loan group thanks Kiva investors for this loan.

In the photo, Zolema is sitting with her son.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sweet breads in bulk.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es un joven trabajador responsable que vela por la seguridad de su familia y su comunidad, él tiene 28 años de edad, soltero vive junto a sus padres, en una comunidad de Sololá.
Alberto es un muchacho muy trabajador y colaborador con su familia y con la sociedad, a pesar de ser joven le gusta apoyar a sus padres por tal motivo él trabaja desde hace 5 años como policía municipal de tránsito colaborando también en el orden de su comunidad,  a través de este trabajo el genera  sus ingresos para poder ayudar a sus padres, Alberto viendo la  necesidad que tienen de como trasportarse, pues Alberto vive en un lugar muy lejano del lugar donde trabaja, es por ello que él considera realizar un prestamo para poder comprarse una motocicleta y así poder  movilizarse mejorar a su lugar de trabajo.
Alberto sueña con poder optar a este prestamo, para poder mejorar sus servicios como policía municipal de tránsito y así mejorar sus ingresos para poder comprarse un terreno y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Alberto is a hard-working and responsible young man who takes care of his family’s safety, and looks after the community. Alberto is 28 years old, single and lives with his parents in a community in Sololá.

Alberto is very hard-working and supportive young man. He helps both his family and society. Although still young, Alberto likes to support his parents. For five years, he has done this by working as a traffic police offer, also helping to maintain order in his town. Through this work, Alberto earns an income to help his parents. Alberto lives quite far from where he works and sees a need for personal transportation. He is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy a motorcycle to be able to travel to work.

Alberto dreams of taking out this loan and being better at his job as a local traffic police officer. This would allow him to increase his income in order to buy a plot of land and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: 020402170004 Liên Minh _ Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Nhung is 28 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 020402170004 Liên Minh _ Hoằng Trường solidarity group. 

Nhung lives with 2 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Nhung operates a food stall selling fish, and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to catch fish to sell.  

In 2013, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has already successfully repaid 3 loans from them.

In the future, Nhung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and to buy a cell phone.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to catch fish to sell

loans.name: 020401410003 Thôn Giang Sơn Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Ngọc is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 020401410003 Thôn Giang Sơn Hoằng Trường solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Ngọc is a fisherwoman, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to catch fish to sell. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

Ngọc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2010 to improve her business, and she has already successfully repaid 4 loans from them.

With her business profit, Ngọc hopes for her children to do well in school, and to maintain a successful business which does well in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to catch fish to sell

loans.name: 020402160004 Liên Minh _ Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Bình is 41 years old and she is married with 4 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 020402160004 Liên Minh _ Hoằng Trường solidarity group. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Bình operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to catch fish to sell. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

Bình joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2012 to improve her business, and she has already successfully repaid 4 loans from them.

In the future, Bình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and to buy a cell phone.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to catch fish to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 01_Thôn 1_Minh Châu Group

texts.en:
Hạnh is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01_Thôn 1_Minh Châu solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

Hạnh has a retail business selling bricks. She is requesting a loan to purchase another machine to make bricks to sell. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase another machine to make bricks to sell

loans.name: Báu

texts.en:
Báu is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Báu operates a food stall selling fish, and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2012, Báu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has already successfully repaid 3 loans from them.

The main hardship that Báu faces in her life is not having a latrine. Therefore she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Báu hopes for her children to do well in school and to find good jobs, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Salamat

texts.ru: Саламат 46 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Саламат среднее образование, она с 1993 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. Ее ежемесячная совокупная прибыль от бизнеса составляет от 20,000 сом (KGS). Саламат решила развить ее бизнес, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и воспитание внуков.
texts.en: Salamat is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a secondary education and she has been involved in agriculture since 1993, thus bringing home a secondary source of income.  She currently owns two cows on her farm and makes a total monthly income of 20,000 som from her business.  Salamat has decided to grow her business, and for this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy additional cattle.  She will use the earnings from her loan to further develop her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase the size her herd.

loans.name: Guzalkhon

texts.ru: Гузалхон была успешно профинансирована в первый раз, и она верит, что ей удастся получить финансирования во второй раз. Гузалхон использовала денежные средства по назначению. Гузал в жизни ищет все новое и хочет попробовать себя в сфере кройки и шитья женской одежды, также хочет научиться вышивке. У нее имеется ручная швейная машинка, но она хочет купить новую современную и вышивальную машинку, для реализации покупки она нуждается в помощи. Она будет принимать заказы на дому. Она будет шить и делать вышивки, что уверена это увлекательная и интересная работа. Гузалхон заранее благодарит Вас за поддержку.
texts.en:
As her previous loan was successfully funded, Guzalkhon believes that she will again receive financing for this loan. She used her previous loan for its intended purpose.  

Guzalkhon likes to try new things in life, so she wants to start designing and sewing women's clothes as well as doing some embroidery.  She has a manual sewing machine, but she would like to buy a more modern one as well as an embroidery machine.  However, to make this purchase, she needs help.  Guzalkhon will be taking orders at home and she will be sewing and embroidering, two activities which she will surely find fascinating and interesting.  She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery and sewing machine in order to start a new business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando  ventanas nuevas y repellando las paredes, pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, balcones y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su esposo puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: This young woman's face is blurred because she is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area.  She has a small store set up in her home and uses her income from sales to cover household expenses.  She lives in her own home with her husband and she wants to renovate the home by installing new windows and putting up drywall.  Since she does not have enough money to do this she is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand and railings and to pay labor costs so she and her husband can live more safely.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and railings, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in her business so she can support her children.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 43 años de edad desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra, por lo que se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, con lo que logra obtener mejores ingresos económicos y dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. El vive con su grupo familiar y quiere invertir en insumos para su cultivo por eso solicita un crédito para invertir en: fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas y abono asi como muestras en la fotografía para seguir con su cultivo con el que espera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Miguel, 43, learned about agriculture when he was very young, so he has been growing corn and beans for several years.  This way he is able to earn a good income and give his family better living conditions.  He lives with his family and wants to invest in crop supplies.  The loan he is requesting is to buy fertilizers, pest control agents, herbicides and manure, as shown in the photograph.  This is so he can continue with his crop activity and improve the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pest control agents, herbicides and manure.

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es: Raul de 42 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra granos básicos, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa en casa propia, Raul está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Raul, 42, has worked in agriculture for several years growing basic grains.  He sells his produce at different markets near his house.  He and his wife live in their own home.

Raul is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest control agents, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photograph.  This is so he can continue his work and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest control agents, etc. and improve his land.

loans.name: Santos Gilberto

texts.es: Santos de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 17 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, cuando ya está su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos, 62, lives in his own house with his wife and three children.  For 17 years he has worked in agriculture growing corn.  At harvest time he stores the grain in graineries as shown in the photograph and then sells it in neighboring villages to many steady customers.

The loan he is requesting is to buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest control agents, herbicides, etc. to continue his crop activity, since this is his only source of income and in order to earn more.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest control agents, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 50 years old and married. She has three children.

Nimfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice and running a food-vending business. 

Nimfa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Nimfa has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan.

Nimfa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Melba works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store.  

Melba is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Krowor Ladies Group

texts.en:
The Krowor Ladies Group is made up of two women who live in the same neighborhood in Ghana. They sell underwear and charcoal. 

Adiza is the group representative. She is 41 years old, single and has one daughter. Adiza and her child live together and provide for the expenses of the household. Adiza left school at the secondary level and has been selling charcoal for 10 years now. She is very successful with her business, which allows her to provide for her child's needs. She buys charcoal from the distributors and sells to customers. 

She would like to be able to respond better to the demands of her customers, so she has requested this forth loan, with the other member of Krowor Ladies, from the field partner. This loan will enable them to fulfill their customers' needs and make more profit. The previous loans were fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: To buys charcoal from the distributors to sell to customers.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a farmer who lives in the village of Mitungu near the town of Nkubu in Kenya. Andrew has seven children. He has supported his family in the last two decades through mixed farming. His primary income sources are selling milk and maize. He also makes significant money selling eggs. 

Andrew would love to expand his poultry business to make more profit. He does have limited funds and needs 30,000 KES to purchase more poultry. This loan will totally transform his business. He will be able to sell crates of eggs each blessed day. Andrew will use the income from this investment to repay his loan, support his family, and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 35-year-old married woman. She has four children. 

She has been running a business of animal sales and purchasing for many years with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Her business is providing her with enough income to support her family. 

She needs to earn much more to meet her children's expenditures, however. For this reason, she has availed herself a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to buy more baby goats and calves for resale purposes to bear her children’s expenses efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats and calves for resale purposes to bear her children’s expenses efficiently.

loans.name: Naeed

texts.en:
Naeed is a 44-year-old, married woman. With her husband (also shown in the photo), she has been running a business selling milk for many years. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of profit.  Naeed has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

For the improvement of her business, she has obtained a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR. She will use it to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Viviana Margarita

texts.es:
Viviana es una señorita muy amable y responsable, que trabaja muy duro todos los días, tiene 18 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Sololá.
Viviana se dedica con mucha alegría y firmeza a su trabajo ella es empleada doméstica en una de las viviendas de su comunidad, ella realiza esta actividad des de hace 2 años, cuando dejo de estudiar porque su familia era de escasos recursos, Viviana con lo que gana del trabajo que realiza, ayuda a sus padres para el sustento de la familia.
Viviana a pesar de ser muy joven se preocupa por las necesidades de su  familia y una de ellas es priorizar un mura detrás de su casa por el área donde la casa corre peligro en la época de lluvia, Viviana tomando en cuenta esta necesidad a considerado optar a un prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construcción que el muro requiera tales como: piedras, cemento, arena y hierro.
El sueño de Viviana es poder optar a este prestamo para construir el muro, para brindarle a su familia mayor seguridad  para que así ella pueda seguir estudiando el  próximo año.
texts.en:
Viviana is a very kind and responsible young woman. Sh works very hard every day. She is 18 years old and lives with her parents and siblings in a community of Sololá.

Viviana works with much cheerfulness and firmness at her job. She is a domestic employee in one of the homes in her community. She started doing this activity 2 years ago, when she left school because her family had very low income. With what Viviana earns from her job, she helps her parents support the family.  

Despite being very young, Viviana is concerned with her family needs, and one of them is to prioritize building a wall behind the house where the home is in danger during the rainy season. Seeing this necessity, Viviana has decided to opt for a loan which she will use to buy construction materials needed for the wall, such as: stones, cement, sand and iron. 

Viviana's dream is to be abel to get this loan to build the wall to offer her family more security so that she can continue going to school next year.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a Kiva borrower. He has two children. He describes himself as industrious. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his vehicle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are the general public. 

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to service his vehicle. His business goal is to increase the number of vehicles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be independent. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Evelyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Faredon

texts.en:
Faredon is a 23-year-old, separated woman shown in the photo with her brother.  

Instead of becoming a burden on her family, she is helping them by running a business of animal sale and purchase. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them. Her business is providing her with enough income to support her family. 

Currently, she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to buy more baby goats and calves for resale purposes to earn good amount of income.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats and calves for resale purposes to earn good amount of income.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 31-year-old, married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo), has been running a business of purchasing and selling animals for many years. He buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

Currently, she has availed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband, who purchased more baby goats to grow his business. Safia dreams of providing good-quality education to her three children.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 20 señoras que apuntan a una mejor calidad de vida, todas son amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Carapeguá, ponen lo mejor de sí, y el mayor de los entusiasmos para poder mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cynthia, ella es la tesorera del comité; mamá de 1 hijo, ella es comerciante de celulares, tiene su puesto de venta en el Mercado Municipal de la ciudad de Carapeguá y con su esmero sigue estudiando.  Cabe resaltar que la señora es muy activa. Agradece por formar parte del comité que mediante eso  puede seguir estudiando y  prepararse para el futuro, y así ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de accesorios para celulares, carcasas, estuches y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y con ello dar a su hijo un futuro mejor.
texts.en: The committee is formed by 20 women who are aimed at a better quality of life. They are all friends and neighbors in the city of Carapegua, they do their best, and have great enthusiasm to improve their lives. One of their members is Mrs. Cynthia who is the comittee's treasurer. She has one child and is a cell phone merchant. She has a sales stand at the Municipal Market in the city of Carapegua, and with great effort continues to study. We should point out that she is a very active woman. She is grateful to be part of this committee which allows her to continue studying and prepare for the future, and be able to help her family. She is asking for this loan to buy cell phone accessories, covers, shell casings and other items, to continue with her business as she does, and provide a better future for her son.

loans.use: To buy cell phone accessories, covers, shell casings and others

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Carmen está en su ciclo número 3° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de ellas se encuentran en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María quien se dedica a la venta de comidas variadas que ella misma hace, y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Es una persona muy buena en lo que hace, y se ha hecho ya de muy buena clientela, con lo cual ayuda a su familia.
La Sra. María solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo y demás, y lo cual le será de mucha ayuda. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ir mejorando.
texts.en: The group named Virgen del Carmen is in its third cycle of the women's committee program, where they work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing the survey for ending poverty, where two of them live in extreme poverty. One of them is Mrs. Maria, who sells diverse meals prepared by her and sells them on the street. She is very good at what she does, and has a good clientele, which generates income to help her family. Mrs. Maria is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make her meals such as vegetables, spices, beef, chicken and other items, which will be of great help. She is grateful for this opportunity to improve herself.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, spices, beef, chicken and others

loans.name: Margarita Dolores

texts.es:
En el sector Limón afuera, parroquia del cantón Portoviejo en Ecuador,  existe una extensa área dedicada a cultivos de choclo acompañado de pequeños sembríos como maní, cilantro, habas, tomate. Un lugar lleno de riqueza natural, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Madres Alegres.
En este lugar vive la señora, Margarita, tiene 48  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos, tres mayores de edad y uno de 12 años de edad estudia en colegio. Su esposo es Agricultor, viven en casa propia.
Doña Margarita para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden y están desocupados, pero por lo general es ella la que más pasa en su negocio ya que es ahí donde le gusta estar ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a sus alrededor. Tiene 19años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 9 años y le gusta porque sus compañeras del Grupo son cumplidas. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Limón parish in Portoviejo canton in Ecuador, there is an extensive area dedicated to growing corn, along with small plots of peanuts, cilantro, broad beans, and tomatoes. It is a place full of natural riches and here the members of the communal bank group Madres Alegres meet every two weeks.  

Margarita lives in this place. She is 48 years old, married, and in this relationship they have four children, three adults and one who is 12 years old and is a secondary school student. Her husband is a farmer and they live in their own house.

Margarita, to get ahead with her family, has a grocery store in her house. There, she sells all sorts of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, legumes, vegetables, and fruit. She works every day from 6:00am to 8:00pm and sometimes later. Her son and her husband help her in her work when they can and are not busy, but generally it is she who spends the most time in the business since it is there where she likes to be since in addition to earning a living, she entertains herself and learns about the news that goes on around her. She has been working at this for 19 years and it is going very well. 

This loan will be used to stock her store, she will purchase rice, sugar, oil, and other basic pantry items. She has been in the communal bank group for 9 years and she likes it because her group partners are very generous. Her goals are to continue onward with her business and for her store to grow more each day.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil and other basic pantry items.

loans.name: Nora Yamilee

texts.es:
Doña Nora es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que siempre ha buscado formas de salir adelante. Ella desde muy joven se dedicó a la compra y venta de ropa y cosméticos, sin embargo, no pudo continuar con este comercio porque varias de su clientela  migraron a otros países, ahora ella, desde hace 5 años, tiene una pequeña pulpería en la cual ofrece gran variedad de productos para el hogar.
Doña Nora solicita el crédito ya que desea invertir en la compra de nuevos productos para su pulpería, entre ellos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, jugos, gaseosas, esto con el fin de crecer y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y así obtener una mejor ganancia. Sus metas y planes son ampliar su pulpería y llegar a convertirla en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Nora is an enterprising and hard-working woman who always has looked for ways to get ahead. Since she was very young, she had worked buying and selling clothing and cosmetics. However, she couldn't continue with this business since a number of her customers migrated to other countries. Now, for the past 5 years, she has had a small grocery store in which she offers a great variety of products for the home.

Nora asks for the loan since she wants to invest in the purchase of new products for her grocery store, among them rice, sugar, oil, juices, and soft drinks, with the end of growing and offering her customers more variety and, in this way, getting better earnings. Her goals and plans are to expand her grocery store and to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase new products for her grocery store, among them rice, sugar, oil, juices, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a Kiva borrower. He has 1 child and describes himself as being committed.

Henry operates a farm where he grows crops. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. Henry describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.).

He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to extend the farm within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
María es una mujer que tiene como principal característica ser muy trabajadora, desde muy temprano ella está atendiendo en su pulpería a los clientes de su vecindario, siempre con una sonrisa en su boca y un trato maternal. Desde hace seis años ella descubrió que podría tener un ingreso económico trabajando sin salir de su casa, en la actualidad ella tiene una pequeña tienda estable, en la cual oferta productos necesarios para el hogar. 
Con el apoyo de su nieta, María crece cada día como comerciante, poco a poco y con esfuerzo ha ido surtiendo su tienda. Ahora que su negocio está en una etapa en la cual los clientes le demandan más, ella necesita capital para invertir. Es por eso que ella solicita un crédito a Kiva mediante MiCrédito, para comprar nuevos productos como jabón, shampoo, arroz, frijoles, verduras, comida enlatada, detergente, limpia pisos, entre muchos otros. De manera que podrá estar a la vanguardia y abrirse paso en el negocio de las pulperías.
texts.en:
María is principally a very hard working lady. From early in the morning she is at her grocery store tending to the customers from the neighborhood, always with a smile on her face and a maternal quality. Six years ago she discovered that she could earn an income by working without leaving her home, and she now owns a stable store offering staple goods for the home.

With the support of her granddaughter, María grows as a businesswoman every day. Little by little, with hard work she has been stocking her store. Now that her business at the stage where her customers are requesting more products, she needs funds to invest. This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan through MiCrédito to buy products like soap, shampoo, rice, beans, vegetables, tinned food, detergents, floor cleaner, and many others. This way she can be at the cutting edge, and establish herself in the grocery store business.

loans.use: to buy products like soap, shampoo, rice, beans, vegetables, tinned food, detergents, floor cleaner, and many others.

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es:
En el sector Limón afuera, parroquia del cantón Portoviejo en Ecuador,  existe una extensa área dedicada a cultivos de choclo acompañado de pequeños sembríos como maní, cilantro, habas, tomate. Un lugar lleno de riqueza natural, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Madres Alegres.
En este lugar vive la señora Cruz,  tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Ella vive en casa propia. 
Doña Cruz  es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como: tortillas (maíz, yuca) al horno y carne asada, trabaja de Jueves a Domingos desde las 9h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces más tiempo, su negocio tiene tres meses y aunque es poco el tiempo su clientela aumenta cada vez mas ya que lo que ella prepara es delicioso.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar un horno  grande, cilindro de gas, colas y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva  9 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por  el apoyo que les dan con los créditos  para seguir creciendo en su negocio. Sus sueños es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Limón parish in Portoviejo canton in Ecuador, there is an extensive area dedicated to growing corn, along with small plots of peanuts, cilantro, broad beans, and tomatoes. It is a place full of natural riches and here the members of the communal bank group Madres Alegres meet every two weeks.  

Cruz lives in this place. She is 54 years old, a single mother of 3 adult and independent children. She lives in her own house.

Cruz is a good housewife who works preparing and selling snacks and fast food such as baked tortillas (corn and yucca) and barbecued meat. She works from Thursday to Sunday from 9:00am to 8:00pm and sometimes longer. She has had her business for three months, and although it is a short time, her customer base is increasing since what she prepares is delicious.

This loan will be used to purchase a large oven, a gas tank, soft drinks, and groceries to prepare her foods. She has been in the communal bank group for 9 years and likes it for the support that the loans give them to continue growing in their businesses. Her dreams are to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase an oven, a gas tank, soft drinks, and groceries.

loans.name: Digna Dioselina

texts.es:
En el sector Limón afuera, parroquia del cantón Portoviejo en Ecuador,  existe una extensa área dedicada a cultivos de choclo acompañado de pequeños sembríos como maní, cilantro, habas, tomate. Un lugar lleno de riqueza natural, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Madres Alegres.
En este lugar vive la señora, Digna tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 18 y 15  años los mismos que estudian en la Universidad y en  el Colegio. El cónyuge es policía activo, viven en casa propia.
Doña Digna con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de ropa, trabaja los sábados todo el día, más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y cobra semanalmente, esto lo viene realizando desde hace 8  años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas. Lleva  4 años en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta la unidad del grupo. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Limón parish in Portoviejo canton in Ecuador, there is an extensive area dedicated to growing corn, along with small plots of peanuts, cilantro, broad beans, and tomatoes. It is a place full of natural riches and here the members of the communal bank group Madres Alegres meet every two weeks.  

Digna lives in this place. She is 38 years old and is a common-law marriage in which she has two children, ages 18 and 14 who are students at the university and secondary school. Her husband is an active policeman and they live in their own house. 

Digna, with the end of having her own income, works selling catalog products from Avon, Esika, and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories) in addition to clothing. She works every Saturday, all day long, and primarily in the morning since at that time it is easier for her to make her rounds. She sells door-to-door and charges weekly. She has been doing this for 8 years during which it has gone very well for her since she has many customers. What she sells the most are cosmetics and perfume.

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams. She has been in the communal bank group for 4 years and she likes the closeness of the group. Her dreams are to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
El Sr. Saturnino es casado, tiene cuatro hijos, él se dedica al macate, es decir a las ventas ambulante, hace varios años, desde muy joven empezó con dicha actividad dándole muy buenos frutos ya que hoy en día cuenta con casa propia, vehículos y animales. 
El señor es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando por poder salir e ir mejorando por medio de su esfuerzo. Pide este préstamo para la compra de sabanas, hamacas, jeans debido a que tiene varios pedidos con los cuales cumplir.
texts.en: Saturnino is married and has 4 children. He has worked in itinerant sales for a number of years. He started this activity when he was very young with good results. Today he has his own house, vehicles and animals. This man is a hard-working person who is fighting to get ahead and improve through his efforts. He is requesting a loan to buy sheets, hammocks and jeans due to the different requests he has to fill.

loans.use: to buy sheets, hammocks, jeans, etc.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a Kiva borrower. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells milk and other foodstuffs. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. 

Vincent describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to renovate his business premises. His business goal is to own a bigger business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Soigul

texts.en:
Soigul is a 57-year-old widow woman from village Sartichala village. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and 3 grandchildren. Her son is a private worker and generates 200 GEL per month.

Soigul has a small agribusiness taking care of chickens. She has a great desire to start her trading business and generate additional income. She needs financial support to purchase a stock of dishes at the worldwide market and sell at increased prices in her village.

Soigul has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

It is obvious that the job is hard for Soigul, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family as their income will be significantly increased because of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start a trading business with dishes

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Monica works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Monica is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Monica has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been doing hand embroidery work. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.  This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia  is 32 years old, a married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. 

Some years ago she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings and she wishes to spend them on providing a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings

loans.name: Rubi Asuncion Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el sector Limón afuera, parroquia del cantón Portoviejo en Ecuador,  existe una extensa área dedicada a cultivos de choclo acompañado de pequeños sembríos como maní, cilantro, habas, tomate.
