Un lugar lleno de riqueza natural, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Madres Alegres.
En este lugar vive la señora Rubí, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3  hijos mayores de edad, profesionales y casados.  Su esposo es profesor. Ella hace varios años atrás aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la localidad.
Doña Rubí con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso un pequeño taller de costura en la casa de su mamá, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños,  trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, ella también en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y gallinas criollas las mismas que vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa o vende por libras a vecinos y conocidos del lugar, de esta forma ella logra ganar algo que les sirven para mejorar su hogar.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar alimento para pollos, telas y otros materiales para la costura. Esta desde el inicio en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
In the Limon area outside the parish of the Portoviejo province in Ecuador, there exists an extensive area devoted to corn crops accompanied by small crops such as peanuts, cilantro, lima beans, and tomatoes. A place full of natural richness, every 15 days the members of the credit group, Madres Alegres, gather here for their meetings.

Here lives Rubi of 48 years old.  She is married and has three older children that are professionals and married.  Her husband is a teacher. Several years ago she learned tailoring at an academy in town.

In order to earn her own income and leverage her expertise in tailoring, Rubi put a small sewing shop in her mother's home.  There she is dedicated to making all kinds of clothes for men, women and children.  She works on the basis of orders from individuals.  She also dedicates herself to raising chickens and native hens, which she sells to traders who come to her home or by the pound to neighbors and acquaintances.  From this she manages to earn something that helps to improve her home.

This new loan she will use to buy chicken feed, cloth and other materials for sewing.  She has been in the credit group from the beginning and she likes it because of the help the loans give. Her dreams are to have a bigger workshop.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed, cloth and other materials for sewing

loans.name: Jovenes Luchadores Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo de jóvenes formado en la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 10 integrantes, todo ellos jóvenes que quiere poder ayudar a su familia con los pequeños emprendimientos que hacen.
La Señorita Cecilia es una de las integrantes, proviene de una familia muy emprendedora y mediante la oportunidad  que se le dió de formar parte del comité ella emprendió una actividad para obtener su propio ingreso, el cual es la venta de lencería.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de lencerías varias, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: This is a group of young people formed in the city of Carapeguá. It has 10 members all of them youth who want to help their families with the small enterprises they have. Cecilia is one of the members. She comes from a very enterprising family and through the opportunity given to her to form part of the committee she started her own business to make her own income. It is the sales of lingerie. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in buying a variety of lingerie and in this way continue with her sales, struggling to help her family.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to resell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children, and she describes herself to be committed.

Catherine operates a dairy farm and has been involved in this business for 4 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of animal feed.

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy animal feed. Her business goal is to increase the number of cows within 5 years. Catherine hopes that in the future she will be independent. This is her 8th loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and beauty products.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a welding shop. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are individuals. 

Benard describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a welding machine. His business goal is to own a company within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jocelyn has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is 32 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school, and she is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Madeline has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

Madeline has been in this business for four years. In the future, Madeline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elya

texts.en:
Elya is a student from Hovhtashat village in the Ararat region. 

She took a loan last year for her university tuition which she has been successfully paying back.
 
Elya, to be able to pay for her university tuition for the second semester, asks for the support of lenders again. She hopes to receive their trust this time again.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for the second semester.

loans.name: Zhana

texts.en:
Zhana is 31 years old. She lives in Kutaisi district with her parents and an infant daughter. Zhana works one day out of every three at a local bakery as a saleslady. Her parents are unemployed and Zhana decided to work harder and increase the family income. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1500 USD. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of linens and clothes and will resell them among her neighbors and co-workers. This will increase her income and with increased income she will improve the living conditions of her daughter.

loans.use: to begin to buy and sell clothes and linens

loans.name: Carolyne's Group

texts.en:
Carolyne is 37 years old and is often described as a very experienced farmer. She has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Carolyne is representing her group of 4 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Carolyne's desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Carolyne and her group will receive a total of 3 solar lights as well as input loans for maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 2 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mildred's Group

texts.en:
Mildred is a 46-year-old proud mother of 10 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Mildred has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Mildred described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mildred’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Featured in the above picture is Beatrice, who has been a farmer for eight years. Although she is pictured alone, she is actually representing her group of 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. Beatrice has always been described as a very resourceful person, which is largely why she was selected to be the group leader.

Beatrice started working with One Acre Fund for the first time in 2013, and this year she decided to not only get farming inputs but also a solar light as part of her loan. She is very excited about this new addition, as now she will be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. 

She can’t wait to buy a cow using the profits she earns from this coming season. 

Beatrice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres using the farming inputs obtained with this loan, and will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Murbat

texts.en:
Murbat is a 27-year-old, married woman. She has been doing a business of livestock sales and purchase with her husband who is also shown in the photo. Murbat fully supports and assists her husband in bearing their household expenditures. They currently have a few goats. 

Now, Murbat has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase more goats to sell in the market, to earn good profits and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell in the market

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 40-year-old married lady. She has three children. Her brother-in-law (also shown in the photo) has been running a small general store for many years. He offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at his store. He is able to make enough to provide for his family. 

However, for the improvement of her brother-in-law's business, Maryam has applied for a Murabaha-type loan of 30,000 PKR to buy larger quantities of rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to earn a good amount of income.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to earn a good amount of income.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 32-year-old married lady. She has been running a small general store for many years with her husband (also shown in the photo). They offer a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and have retained many customers who regularly shop at their store. In this way, they are able to make a good amount of income. However, for the improvement of their business, Nazia has applied for a Murabaha-type loan of 20,000 PKR to buy larger quantities of rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates for better earnings.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates for better earnings.

loans.name: Blema Tesa Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of 'Bleman Tesa' and they are beginning their fourth loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group is made up of three members and they are into the sale of maize, oranges, sugar cane and groceries. 

The loan that they take out will benefit the small businesswomen, including Mercy B. She says that she joined ID Ghana four years ago, at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Mercy B. has had a business selling sugar cane for 10 years now. The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying more sugar cane from the market and selling it to customers, retail. This work allows her to generate resources for her family since she has children to take care of. 

When asked what she likes about ID Ghana, Mercy B. said she likes the training, the savings, and the health programs offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy more sugar cane from the market and sell it retail to customers.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a 30-year-old married lady from Nablus city. She lives with her husband and one small son. Her husband works as a seller in a home appliances store.

Hana has a talent, which is making artistic pieces for homes. She makes them from wood and plaster, and she sells her work to the local traders.

Hana took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more raw materials for her handmade work. By taking this loan, Hana will be able to increase her productivity and also her income. Hana appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her handmade work

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Don Oscar tiene 61 años, está casado con la Sra. Edith. Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de chipas, una comida típica paraguaya, que ya hace más de 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad, realiza sus ventas en zonas de la capital, cuenta con clientela formada a quienes en forma diaria los visita para realizar sus ventas. Gracias al esfuerzo en conjunto con su esposa se ayudan para poder salir adelante.
Con el préstamo que pide quiere comprar queso y almidón en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir haciendo sus chipas, y deleitar de esa forma a sus clientes.
texts.en: Oscar is 61 years old and is married to Edith. He works making and selling chipas a traditional Paraguayan food. He has been working in this business for over 30 years selling in the areas of the capital. He has a group of regular clients who he visits every day to make his sales. Thanks to the joint effort with his wife they help each other to get ahead. With the loan he is requesting he wants to buy cheese and flour in quantity. In this way he can continue to make his chipas and please his clients doing this.

loans.use: to buy cheese and flour to make chipa (small cheese flavored rolls).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fishery products to sell on in the market

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is 54 years old and married with eight children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Phanice's Group

texts.en:
Phanice is 29 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Phanice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Phanice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Phanice's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 9 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Juana Del Rosario

texts.es:
JUANA DE  63 AÑOS DE EDAD, MADRES SOLTERA CON DOS HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, ES ORIGINARIA DE LA ZONA CENTRAL DE LA REGIÓN,  SE CARACTERIZA POR SER UNA MEJER EMPRENDEDORA, LUCHADORA, CON GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE ACTIVIDADES CON SU FAMILIA. LAMENTABLEMENTE DESDE JOVEN SE VIO EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR Y AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. PARA AYUDAR A SU FAMILIA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMCIA  LA VENTA DE REPUESTOS  DE VEHÍCULOS Y MOTO TAXI, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN,  Y TIENE DOS AÑOS DE DEDICAR AL MISMO. SU MAYOR PRIORIDAD ES HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO, DÁNDOLE  BUENA ATENCIÓN AL CLIENTES Y SATISFACIENDO LA DEMANDA DEL MISMO. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DIEZ HORAS DIARIAS, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA CON MUCHO GUSTO, PORQUE ES SU FORMA DE OBTENER INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS PARA SUS SUBSISTENCIA. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO CON PRODUCTOS COMO: frenos, rayos, pedales, aceites, manubrios, asientos etc . PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. JUANA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN  A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Juana is 63 years old and a single mom of two young children.  She is originally from the central zone of the region.  She is known as an enterprising woman, a fighter, with a desire to get ahead.  In her spare time she likes to enjoy activities with her family.  Unfortunately, from a young age she has had to work and help with the costs of living in order to help her family.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead she has a business of selling vehicle and moto taxi parts.  She has her business located inside her home and she has dedicated herself to this for two years. Her biggest priority is to grow her business, giving good attention to her clients and to satisfy their demands.  She dedicates herself to her business ten hours a day, an activity that she gladly does because it's a way of obtaining earnings for sustenance.  

The goal of this loan is to invert as capital for her work and stock her store with products such as brakes, spokes, pedals, oils, handlebars, seats, etc. so that she can obtain better earnings in the near future.  Juana thanks the Kiva investors that provide help to people of little resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that the people may have decent work.

loans.use: to invert in the purchase of motorcycle parts such as brakes, spokes, pedals, oils, handlebars, seats, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build his house for habitable use

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Portoviejo,  la capital de la provincia de Manabí, en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive el  señor Roberto,  tiene24  años de edad y es soltero. Estudia en la Universidad el 5to semestre de Administración, vive con sus padres quienes alquilan una casa.
Don Roberto es un hombre muy luchador que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar tiene una  carretilla en la ciudad de Jipijapa en la cual vende comida rápida como: jugos, alitas, papitas fritas, entre otros. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes, desde las 15h00 hasta las 23H00 o hasta que se termine lo que preparó. También vende ropa en sus tiempos libres, entre sus conocidos, deja a crédito y le pagan cada 8 días. Tiene 10 años que les ayuda a los papás, le gusta esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa y asientos para que se sienten sus clientes que llegan a comer a diario. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 5 años  y le gustan los beneficios que recibe de la Fundación, como seguro salud, charlas educativas.  Sus sueños son que crezca su negocio  y terminar su carrera Universitaria.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the Manabí province in Ecuador. This area is known for being the first, and therefore oldest, Ecuadorian city to be established in the coastal region. This area is gaining ground in the area of tourism since it has a beach, a city, and countryside.

Señor Roberto lives in this area. He is 24 years old and single. He is in his 5th semester at college studying Administration, and he lives with his parents who rent a house.

Don Roberto is a very determined man, and helps with the household expenses. He has a wheelbarrow in the city of Jipijapa from which he sells fast food such as juice, chicken wings, and french fries among other things. He works everyday from 3:00 pm until 11:00 pm, or until he sells everything that he has prepared for the day. Roberto also sells clothes in his free time. With his acquaintances, he sells to them on credit, and they pay Roberto every 8 days. He has been helping his parents for 10 years, and Roberto likes this occupation, and it has gone very well for him.

Roberto is going to use this loan to buy clothes and chairs so that his customers can sit down when they eat everyday. He has been in the Grupo De Crédito for 5 years, and he enjoys the benefits that he receives from the foundation. These benefits include health insurance and educational talks. His dreams are to grow his business and graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy clothes and chairs.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a restaurant where he cooks food for sale. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products. 

He will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients and restaurant equipment. His business goal is to expand and open another business within five years. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients and restaurant equipment

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Carina works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Carina is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Carina has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Imboneza Group

texts.fr:
Evelyne  fait partie du groupe Imboneza  et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 23 ans et est mariée à Emmanuel, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants s d’âgés de 2 à 4 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de  riz, haricot,…cuits dans son restaurant depuis 2 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz, haricot,… à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Evelyne is part of the group Imboneza and lives in Gitega.  She is 23 and married to Emmanuel, a trader.  Together they have 3 children aged from 2 to 4. 

She has been in business for two years selling rice and beans which are cooked in her restaurant.  

She is on her second loan with Turame.  With the KIVA loan, she will increase her capital and buy a large amount of rice, beans . . . to sell on in order to earn more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large amount of rice, beans . . . to resell in order to earn more

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells milk as his main business, and at the same time sells green leaf, which has boosted his income. He is faced with a challenge of an inadequate means of transport that hinder the growth of his business. 

Besides that, he has hopes of having a fully furnished house. Stephen has asked for a loan to buy timber to use in constructing his house.

loans.use: to buy timber to use in constructing his house.

loans.name: Recuperando Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras: Juana Patora, Yolanda que venden ropa usada y Leoncia, vende bastimentos de la etnia miskita, viven en Bilwi. Son mujeres trabajadoras que luchan cada día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios y poder llevar el sustento a su hogar; se organizaron hace 10 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. 

Leoncia: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora dinámica, alegre y amable, originaria de Waspam Rio Coco, llegó a vivir a Bilwi en el período que evacuaron a toda la población del Río Coco en los años 80. Tiene 65 años de edad, viuda,  tiene 10 hijos: 9 son mayores de edad e independientes y un adolescente que estudia su secundaria. Con el propósito de apoyar a que su hijo sea un profesional, desde hace 2 años vende en su vivienda de tambo de madera: bastimentos, frijoles cosidos y pescado.  Solicita financiamiento para comprar yuca, malanga, coco, carbón, frijoles y mariscos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three enterprising ladies: Juana Patora and Yolanda, who sell second-hand clothing, and Leoncia who sells traditional Miskito products. They live in Bilwi and are hardworking women who fight every day to make their businesses grow and to support their homes. The group was organised 10 months ago, so that they can access finance with a joint guarantee through Pana Pana.

Leoncia is an integral member of the solidarity group. She is dynamic, happy and friendly, and is originally from Waspam Rio Coco, She came to live in Bilwi in the 80s when the whole of Rio Coco was evacuated. She is 65 years old, a widow, and has 10 children, 9 of which are independent adults, and one adolescent who is in secondary education. With the intention of supporting her child in becoming a working professional, for two years she has been selling from her wooden stilt house: staple goods, cooked beans, and fish. She is requesting a loan to buy cassava, malanga, coconut, coal, beans and seafood. Her dream is to have a successful business and to set up a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy cassava, malanga, coconut, coal, beans and seafood

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet is 55 years old and has 10 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Violet has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2008. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Violet also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Violet's Group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Petrona Isabel

texts.es:
Petrona es una joven comprometida con la labor humana, por eso decidió estudiar Tecnología Médica, pues es una área que le permite ayudar a la prevención y recuperación de la salud. Además, es importante para diagnosticar enfermedades. Ella se siente realizada en su trabajo, porque en cada diagnóstico que hace, aporta para salvar vidas y eso la hace ser una mejor persona. 

Este es su último año y únicamente le falta tomar los módulos de culminación, para ser egresada. Por esto, solicita el crédito para cancelar dichos módulos y graduarse cuanto antes. Petrona espera comenzar a laborar en algún hospital de su ciudad y desarrollarse no solo como profesional sino como mujer.
texts.en:
Petrona is a young woman who's committed to working with people, so she decided to study medical technology, a field that allows her to help with health prevention and recovery.  It's also important for diagnosing illnesses.  She feels fulfilled in her job because every diagnosis she makes contributes to saving lives, which makes her a better person.

This is her last year, and she only needs to take her courses to finish her degree, so she's requesting the loan to take them and graduate as soon as possible.

Petrona hopes to start working in some hospital in her city and grow both as a professional and as a woman.

loans.use: to take her final coursework and graduate as soon as possible

loans.name: Blesing Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por dos mujeres: Indiana del Carmen que vende ropa usada, Eveling vende de manera ambulante productos de oro laminado, plata y acero, también forman parte del grupo solidario dos hombres trabajadores Marvin Alonso que vende de manera ambulantes accesorios para damas y caballeros de acero y Erick Javier que vende ropa nueva en un tramo en el mercado. Se organizaron hace 9 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento con garantía solidaria,  para mejorar sus pequeños negocios y las condiciones de vida de su familia. Razón por la cual, decidieron nombrar al grupo Blesing, porque para ellos es una bendición trabajar en la modalidad de grupo solidario.

Indiana del Carmen: Es una mujer jovial, coordinadora del grupo solidario, originaria de Puerto Cabezas. Tiene 27 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos: El mayor de ocho años estudia su tercer grado de primaria y un pequeño de tres años de edad. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en su tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de Bilwi. Solicita financiamiento para comprar una paca mixta en Managua. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero, una tienda donde pueda ofrecer ropa nueva.
texts.en:
Blesing Group is formed of two women: Indiana del Carmen who sells used clothing and Eveling, a street vendor who sells gold plated products as well as silver and steel.  Also forming part of this solidarity group are two hardworking men: Marvin Alonso, a street vendor who sells accessories for men and women, and Erick Javier who sells new clothing in a section in the market.  About 9 months ago they organized themselves with the goal to access funding with a solid guarantee, to improve their small businesses and the quality of life conditions of their families.  For this reason they decided to name their group, Blesing, because for them it is a blessing to work in the form of a solidarity group.

Indian del Carmen: She is a jovial woman, coordinator of the solidarity group, from Puerto Cabezas.  She is 27 years old and a single mom of two kids.  Her oldest is 8 years and in the third grade and her youngest is 3.  In order to have her own source of income and get ahead with her children, for 5 years she has dedicated herself to selling used clothing in a part of one of the markets in Bilwi.  She requests financing to purchase a bale of mixed clothing in Managua.  Her dream is to have her own prospering business, a store where she can offer new clothing.

loans.use: to purchase a mixed bale of clothing in Managua.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Aty está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas hacen la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y con ello ir mejorando.
Cristina es una de las que integra este grupo, ella es una persona que se está esforzando para poder salir adelante por medio de la venta de helados. Comenta que poco a poco está creciendo y con los ingresos que obtiene invierte nuevamente y también ayuda a su familia.
La Sra. Cristina  solicita este préstamo para poder comprar helados, barquillos, vasitos etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Aty is in its fourth cycle of the women's committee program. In this program, the participants complete the poverty elimination questionnaire, in order to understand each member's situation better and from there make improvements. 

Cristina is one of the group members, she is working hard to get ahead in life, her business is selling ice-creams. Cristina comments that little by little her business is growing. She uses the money she makes to reinvest in the business and also to help her family. 

Cristina seeks this loan in order to buy to buy ice creams, wafers, cups, etc., which will help her to solidify her business plan and thus improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy ice creams, wafers, cups, to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and poultry. She has been involved in this business for 25 years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are regulars. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather. 

She will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy animal feed and other farm inputs. 

Her business goal is to have a fully commercialized farm within five years. 

This is her seventh loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hawa's Group

texts.fr:
Crée le 06 D écembre 2010, le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles habitent toutes le même village, et partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. 

Madame Hawa (assise à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 61 ans, mariée, mère de 08 enfants dont 05 filles et 03 garçons. Elle est vendeuse de produits alimentaire et de lait de vache frais qu’elle achète au marché central régional de KOLDA    pour les revendre à Mbadelle .

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 02 sacs de riz à 26000, 1 sac d’oignon à 15000f et du sucre à 25000 pour le revendre en détail.

 Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer activement à la gestion des charges familiales et surtout à la scolarité de ses enfants mais aussi d’augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
Established on the 6 December 2010, the group has women who, for the most part, have acquired solid experience in small business, which is their principal activity.  They all live in the same village and share values of solidarity and mutual support.

Hawa (sitting on the far right) is the leading borrower of the group.  She is 61 years old, married, mother of 8 children, of whom 5 are girls and 3 are boys.  She sells food products and fresh cow's milk which she buys at the central regional market of KOLDA to sell on in Mbadelle.

This new loan will allow her to buy 2 sacks of rice at 26000F, 1 sack of onions for 15000F and sugar for 2500F to sell on as retail.

The income will allow her to actively participate in meeting the family expenses, above all the education of her children, but also to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of rice for 26000F, 1 sack of onions for 15000F and sugar for 2500F to sell on as retail

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es:
AUXILIADORA DE 59 AÑOS DE EDAD, MADRES SOLTERA CON TRES HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD ES ORIGINARIA DE MANAGUA, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA CENTRAL DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE  SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDO ESTUDIAR Y SE VIO EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. EN LA ACTUALIDAD SU MAYOR RETO ES MANTENER Y HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE  TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE CALZADO VARIADO DE  NIÑOS Y ADULTOS COMO: DEPORTIVOS, ZAPATILLAS, TENIS, SANDALIAS,  CHINELAS ETC.  ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIOS UNAS DIES HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS,  EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO  EN UNOS DE LOS MERCADO DE LA LOCALIDAD, Y TIENE 36 ANOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL MISMO.EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO CON CALZADO NUEVO Y SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES FIJOS Y EVENTUALES, Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. AUXILIADORA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora is 59 years old and a single mom of three older children.  She is from Managua, a place located in the central zone of the region.  She is a hardworking, responsible woman, with a desire for success.  Unfortunately, for lack of resources, she was unable to study and saw the need to work in order to help with the costs of the home. Today her greatest challenge is to maintain and grow her business.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, her work is the purchase and sale of various footwear for children and adults, such as: sports, shoes, tennis, sandals, slippers, etc.  She dedicates herself to this work ten hours a day.  Her business is located in one of the local markets and she has 36 years of experience in this.  

The goal for this loan is to invert as capital in her work and stock her store with new footwear to satisfy the demands of her current and future clients.  In the near future she hopes to be able to earn more income.  Auxiliadora is grateful for the help of the Kiva investors that assist people of little resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that people may have decent work.

loans.use: to invert in the purchase and sale of footwear, such as: sports, shoes, tennis, sandals, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Flor Esilda

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí, está ubicado en el  valle del Río Portoviejo la ciudad es rica en producción de hortalizas, legumbres y frutas tropicales para el consumo interno, y  está  ganando terreno en el turismo, ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo
En este lugar vive la señorita Flor, tiene 47 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa propia. 
Doña Flor con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en decoración y su buen gusto puso en su casa un pequeño taller de alquiler y decoraciones para todo tipo de eventos, ahí ella se dedica a decorar y también alquila sillas, mesas, mantelería e inclusive confeccionar todo tipo de vestimenta de fiesta  para damas, caballeros y niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares. Trabaja todos los días en especial los fines de semana donde hay más eventos, el negocio lo tiene por más de cuatro años.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, mesas, sillas y otros materiales para la decoración. Ella tiene en el grupo comunal 10 años, le gusta el apoyo que le brinda la fundación y la facilidad para adquirir los créditos. Su sueño es tener un centro de eventos propio
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the Manabí province. Located in the valley of the Río Portoviejo [Portoviejo River], the city is rich in the production of vegetables, legumes, and tropical fruit for consumption. This area is gaining ground in the tourism industry, since there is a beach, a city, and countryside in this district.

Señorita Flor lives here, and she is 47 years old. Flor is single, and she lives in her own home. Doña Flor, with the purpose of earning her own income while taking advantage of her decorating knowledge and good taste, started a small rental and decorating shop in her home for all types of events. There she makes a living decorating, and she also rents chairs, tables, and table linens. In addition, she makes all types of clothing for celebrations for women, men, and children. Flor's work is based off of individual requests. She works everyday, and especially on weekends when there are more events. She has had this business for more than four years.

Flor is going to use this new loan to buy fabrics, tables, chairs, and other supplies for decorating. She has been in the community group for 10 years, and she enjoys the support that the foundation provides for her. She also enjoys the ease of obtaining loans through the foundation, and her dream is to have her own center of events.

loans.use: to buy fabric, tables, chairs, and other supplies for decoration.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 26 years old, married, and has one kid in school. 

Mary Joy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Joy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Joy has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Joy would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 55-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells bananas, and rears cattle for dairy purposes. He is faced with challenges of pests and diseases attacking his cattle, and the banana bacterial wilt that hinders the growth of his business. 

Besides that, he hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. 

George has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 63 years old, and married with three children; one of whom attends school. He deals in produce, mainly the buying and selling of maize, rice and beans. He supplements his income by farming. His dream is to expand and develop his business to a level of supplying the whole district at all times throughout the year, but he is affected by bad roads that hinder his service delivery. 

Stephen will use the loan facility to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize

loans.name: Evenisa

texts.en:
Evenisa is 28 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evenisa is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evenisa has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yehowa Dzi Mekwelo Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of Yehowa Dzi Mikwelo Group, and they are beginning their fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of three members who are into the sale of tea and bread, fish, sauce pans and African fabric. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small businesswomen, including Tekor. Tekor says that she joined ID-Ghana three years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling fish, African fabric and sauce pans, which she has done for the past 14 years. 

The loan Tekor will take out now is to increase capital by buying more fish, African fabric and sauce pans at wholesale and sell to customers at retail. This work allows her to generate resources for her family, since she is married and has one dependent child. 

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Tekora says she likes the training, the savings, and the health programs offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy more fish, African fabric and sauce pans at wholesale

loans.name: Samuel's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Samuel, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 47 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.  He is married and has three children.

Samuel is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Samuel says that he is happy to have made that decision, because, since he first joined in 2012, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Samuel will use the profits from this season to buy more land to cultivate.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of six acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Dismas's Group

texts.en:
Dismas is 32 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has three children and is married. As a group leader, Dismas is representing his group of 11 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Dismas's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

Dismas and his group will receive a total of 5 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victoriano es un buen hombre que vive en una comunidad de Sololá, él tiene 40 años y vive muy feliz mente con su familia.
Victoriano es un hombre muy perseverante, que lucha todos los días, por sacar adelante a su familia, a él le encanta  convivir con la naturaleza es por ello que se dedica a la agricultura, el cultiva diversidad de verduras, según cuenta Victoriano, que con el prestamo anterior, no le fue bien porque en el lugar donde el sembró no contaba con riego para regar la siembra, pues él esperaba que la lluvia ayudaría a que el cultivo pudiera germinar, pero por la época de la sequilla, el no logro buena cosecha, por tal motivo Victoriano solicita un nuevo prestamo, para poder comprar tubería, espesores para poder economizar y ahorrar tiempo de regar la siembra, también para comprar sus  semillas, abono orgánico y otros insumos que su cultivo requiera, para sembrar nueva mente.
Victoriano sueña que con este nuevo prestamo él logre recuperar lo que en el anterior crédito perdió, y así poder obtener buenas ganancias para luego poder comprar un terreno y empezar a construir su casa.
texts.en:
Victoriano is a good man who lives in a community in Sololá.  He's 40 years old and lives happily with his family.  He's a very determined man who strives every day to get his family ahead.

Victoriano loves to coexist with nature, which is why he works in agriculture.  He grows a variety of vegetables.  He said the previous loan didn't go well for him because he didn't have irrigation for his crop on the land he planted.  He was hoping for rain to help the crop germinate, but he didn't get a good harvest because of the drought.

For that reason Victoriano's requesting another loan, so he can buy pipes and gauges to economize and save time irrigating his plants.  He's also going to buy seeds, organic soil amendments, and other inputs he needs for his crop so he can plant again.

Victoriano dreams that with this new loan he'll be able to recover what he lost with the previous loan.  That way he'll be able to earn good profits so he can buy another plot of land and start building his house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic soil amendments

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena es una mujer muy optimista con todo lo que realiza, ella es originaria de una comunidad de  Sololá, tiene un hijo de 4 años que este año empezó a estudiar, Magdalena tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera.
Ella durante toda su vida siempre le ha gustado vender, es por ello que cuenta con negocio de compra y venta de maíz por quintal, ella se dedica a esta actividad económica desde hace 5 años, Magdalena es una mujer muy comprometida con su familia, ella con los ingresos que obtiene de su negocio sustenta las necesidades de  su familia.
Magdalena quiere mejorar sus servicios a la clientela surtiendo maíz de diferentes lugares y precios,  pero una de las limitaciones de magdalena para hacer este mejoramiento, es de que ella no cuenta con el capital suficiente para hacerlo, ahora magdalena se ve a la necesidad de realizar un prestamo, el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar más maíz para luego venderlos aun  un buen precio.
Magdalena sueña con poder incrementar sus ganancias con esta inversión para luego poder comprar su terreno para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a woman that is optimistic about everything.  She is from a community known as Solola.  She has a 4 year old son that began to study this year.  She is 22 years old and single.

She has always liked to sell.  For this reason she has a business of buying and selling corn by the quintal.  She has been doing this work for 5 years.  Magdalena is a women that is very committed to her family.  With the earnings she makes from her business she supports the needs of her family.

Magdalena wants to improve the services to her clients, supplying corn from different places and prices, but one of the limitations of making this improvement is that she does not have sufficient capital to do it.  Magdalena now sees the need for a loan.  She will use the loan to buy more corn to later sell it at a good price.

Magdalena dreams to increase profits with this investment so that she can later buy land to build her own home.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and iron.

loans.name: Loice's Group

texts.en:
Loice is 51 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader, and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Loice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2008. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Loice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Loice's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 27 years old and married with two children who are both in school.

Monaliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Monaliza has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Monaliza aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Centrine's Group

texts.en:
Centrine is 40 years old and has nine children. She has been a farmer for 13 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Centrine is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by eight farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Centrine started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Centrine’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of one solar light.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Elmorod

texts.ru: Элмурод молодой начинающий предприниматель. Ему 23 года. Он в жизни хочет стать успешным человеком, но уезжать из Родины в Российскую Федерацию на заработки как его братья и многие мужчины не хочет, потому что понимается, что он не смог получить хорошее образование и ему будет тяжело в чужой стране найти хорошую работу. К тому же нему надо присматривать за своими родными. Элмурод решил начать собственный бизнес, в сфере купли продажи скотов на родном районе, под названием Носири Хусрав. Он обратился за кредитом, чтобы на эти деньги купить скотин, корм и достроить коровник. Благодаря кредиту, он может найти источник заработка, кормить семью и в будущем создать свою и привести в дом невесту. Элмурод надеется на Вас.
texts.en: Elmorod is a young aspiring entrepreneur. He is 23 years old. He wants to be a successful person, but, like many other men, he does not want to leave his homeland to work in Russia like his brothers do, because that would mean he could not get a good education. It would also be difficult for him to find good work in a foreign country and he needs to take care of his loved ones. Elmurod decided to start his own business buying and selling cattle in his native district of Nosiri Khusrav. He applied for a loan to buy livestock, feed, and finish building a barn. Thanks to the loan he is able to find a source of income to feed his family and bring home a wife. Elmurod is relying on you.

loans.use: to start a new business, buy livestock, and finish building a barn

loans.name: Arus

texts.ru: Это женщина Арус. Ей 74 лет. Арус вместе семьей проживает в городе Куляб. У нее не большая семья, ее муж, двое сыновей и невестка. Старший сын женат и он работает в каменоломном заводе. Младший сын занимается животноводством.  Арус не смотря на свой возраст, решила заняться выращиванием скота.  Арус хорошо справляется работой. Ей нравится выращивать скота. Она уверена, что сможет справиться этой деятельностью и стать хорошим предпринимателем в своем городке. Арус хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить деятельность. Она по этой причине берет кредит. Поддержите Арус, достичь своих целей.
texts.en:
This is Arus. She is 74 years old. Arus lives in the city of Kulob with her family. She has a small family consisting of her husband and two sons and a daughter-in-law. Her eldest son is married and he works in an open-pit mine. Her youngest son works with livestock breeding. 

Despite her age, Arus decided to start breeding livestock. Arus manages her work well. She likes breeding livestock and is confident that she can handle this business and become one of the best entrepreneurs in her town. 

Arus would like to increase the number of livestock and expand her business. She takes a loan for this reason. Please help Arus reach her goal.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and increase her herd

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ailyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Ailyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Ailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario Rosario is 67 years old and a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosario has a fertilizer-retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of fertilizers to offer for sale.

Rosario has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Rosario would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fertilizers to offer for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling root-crops in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Cecilia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more root-crops to sell to customers.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more root-crops to sell.

loans.name: Henarita

texts.en:
Henarita is 49 years old and a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Henarita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Henarita has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Frediswenda

texts.en:
Frediswenda is 56 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Frediswenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Frediswenda has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future Frediswenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 53 years old and a married woman with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Anselma has a business selling root-crops in the Philippines. Anselma requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of root-crops to sell.

Anselma has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Anselma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of root-crops to sell.

loans.name: Aleyda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Un ser emprendedor es el que deja volar su imaginación y crea de lo más mínimo, lo más grande para hacer cumplir sus metas. Así fue el caso de Aleyda, una mujer luchadora de 32 años, quien miró la oportunidad de mejorar la vida de ella y de su familia estableciendo una pequeña librería, sin necesariamente tener un local con la estructura adecuada. Hace tres años, aprovechando la cercanía de un colegio, esta sonriente mujer construyó solo con el capital que ahorró vendiendo productos de belleza y unas cuantas cajas de cartón, su negocio de materiales escolares.
Aleyda es madre de tres hijos de doce, seis y dos años de edad, quienes sirven de motivación para salir adelante.  Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y de un hermano que le envía remesas. Su sueño es llegar a tener una mejor presentación para su negocio, por lo que desea seguir invirtiendo en él. De manera que solicita un crédito para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lápices, borradores, folders, entre otros productos para aprovechar el regreso a clases. Esto le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio, obtener grandes ganancias y asegurarle a sus hijos un futuro próspero.
texts.en:
Entrepreneurs are people who let their imagination take flight and create something big from the smallest thing so they can achieve their goals.  That was the case with Aleyda, 32, a persevering woman who saw the opportunity to improve life for herself and her family.  She opened a small bookstore without necessarily having a retail space with an appropriate structure.  Three years ago, this smiling woman made the most of her proximity to a school and built her school-supplies business with only the capital she saved selling beauty products and a few cardboard boxes.

Aleyda's the mother of three children, ages 12, 6, and 2, who are her motivation for getting ahead.  She has support from her husband as well as from a brother who sends her remittances.

Her dream is for her business to look better, so she wants to keep investing in it.  That's why she's requesting a loan to buy school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, folders, and other products to take advantage of the return to classes.

This will allow her to provide better service, earn more profits, and ensure a prosperous future for her children.

loans.use: to buy school supplies like notebooks, pencils, erasers, folders, and other products

loans.name: Bety's Group

texts.en:
Bety, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by eleven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has two children.

With a portion of this loan, Bety will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Bety plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy more land to cultivate.

In total, Bety’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Dorcus's Group

texts.en:
Dorcus is 60 years old and has 11 children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though Dorcus is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Dorcus started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2008, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Dorcus’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence, pictured above, has been a farmer for 18 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 14 farmers in Webuye District. She is 39 years old, is married, and has seven children.

Florence likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012, and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Florence plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Florence’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Gustavo is a single man who takes care of his parents. Gustavo is a mason and he works very hard. He also is in a music band to make extra money. 

Gustavo needs a loan to buy construction supplies and tools. He would like to have his own costruction company in the future. 

Gustavo is very responsible, and he will work hard to improve his life.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and tools

loans.name: Asturia Audelith

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabi en Ecuador, se está ampliando en la agroindustria con plantas procesadoras de aguardiente refinado, salsa de tomate y plátano en rodajas, popularmente conocido como chifles.
En este lugar vive la señora Asturia, tiene 44  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 19 años  independiente. El cónyuge es comerciante y viven en casa alquilada.
Doña Asturia es una muy  buena esposa que trata de ayudarle a su esposo con la dura carga del hogar,  ella realiza los créditos para que él  lo utilice en su trabajo, él tiene un puesto de venta de mariscos y pescado, vende de martes a domingos todo el día y es ella quien le ayuda a vender,  también algunas veces ellos entregan al mayoreo y al menudeo por la zona.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pescado, conchas y otros mariscos. Lleva seis años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque le dan los créditos inmediatos y sin tantos documentos. De la Fundación le gusta que es organizada. Sus sueños son tener casa propia ya que donde vive es alquilada.
texts.en: Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabi in Ecuador. It has been growing in agro-industry with processing plants of refined moonshine, tomato sauce and sliced bananas, commonly known as "chifles". Asturia lives here. She is 44 years old and lives with her domestic partner and their 19 year old daughter. He is a merchant and they live in a rented house. Asturia is a good wife who tries to help her husband with the hard burden of the household. She applied for a loan to help him in his job. He has a stand from where he sells seafood and fish. He sells from Tuesdays to Sundays during the whole day and she is the one who helps him sell. Sometimes they also sell wholesale and in small quantities around their area. She will use this loan to buy fish, seashell and other seafood. She has been six years in the Credit Group, and she likes it because she gets immediate loans without needing many documents. She likes the Foundation because it is very organized. Her dream is to have an own house because they live in a rented one right now.

loans.use: to buy fish, seashell and other seafood.

loans.name: Angela's Group

texts.en:
Angela is 40 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Angela has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Angela also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Angela's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a café business

loans.name: Teofrida

texts.en:
Teofrida is a 25-year-old entrepreneur and Camfed volunteer, working as a Learner Guide. In this capacity, she teaches life skills to students in her ward’s secondary school, including lessons on effective communication and on personal confidence. 

Teofrida is unmarried and currently depends on her brothers in order to get basic needs. She requests a Kiva loan in order to start a business selling vegetables, such as tomatoes and onions. With the profits from this, Teofrida hopes to renovate her house and expand her business with more varieties of nutrient-rich vegetables. 

The interest on Teofrida’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two-and-a-half hours of volunteering for Camfed.

loans.use: to start a business selling vegetables like tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is an ambitious 22-year-old entrepreneur and volunteer for Camfed. She teaches life skills to local secondary students (in the district where she lives with her mother) in her role as a Learner Guide. Through her lessons, Zuhura encourages students to find their own strengths, and to think about how to create a better world. 

Zuhura is requesting a Kiva loan in order to start a women’s clothing business. She plans on using the profits to expand her business with the purchase of cheaper, wholesale clothes, as well as helping her mother by covering household expenses for her family.  

The interest on Zuhura’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two-and-a-half hours of volunteering for Camfed.

loans.use: to start a business selling women's clothes

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 13 farmers in Webuye District. She is 54 years old, is married and has seven children.

Florence likes to think of herself as a very resourceful person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to save more money. Florence plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Florence’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs

loans.name: Nene Galle's Group

texts.fr:
Crée depuis le 14 Décembre 2012, ce groupe est composé de  femmes qui ont un idéal de cheminer ensemble. Elles partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide fruit d’un long voisinage, car vivant toutes dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale la vente d’arachide.

Madame Néné Gallé  (assise à l’extrême droite), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants (03 garçons et 03 filles). Elle  s’active dans la vente d’arachides, de thé et de sucre. Elle achète sa marchandise aux villages pour les revendre au marché hebdomadaire de Diaobé. 

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 05 sacs d’arachides à 13500f l’un, et 02 cartons de thé  un sac de sucre de 50 kg.

 Les bénéfices, elle compte renforcer ses épargnes et participer à la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 14, 2012, and it consists of women who stand together on their journey. They all live in the same village and as long-time neighbors they have developed bonds of solidarity and support. Their main business activity is the sale of groundnuts. 

Mrs. Néné Gallé (sitting at the far right) is the group’s featured borrower. She is a 45-year-old married mother of 6 children (3 boys and 3 girls). She sells groundnuts, tea and sugar. She buys her stock in the villages and conducts her sales at the weekly market of Diaobé. 

She will use this loan to buy 5 sacks of groundnuts at 13,500f apiece, 2 cartons of tea, and one 50-kg sack of sugar.

Her profits will help her to bolster her savings and to help with her family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of groundnuts at 13,500f apiece, 2 cartons of tea, and one 50-kg sack of sugar.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a retail business where she sells eggs. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of eggs.

Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs.

loans.name: Jessenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Portoviejo conocida como la ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, Portoviejo se ha convertido en el más importante centro de actividad agrícola y comercial de la provincia de Manabí y base fundamental de su economía.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessenia, tiene 38  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 12, 10 y 4 años los mismos que estudian en escuela, su hijo de 10 años es discapacitado. El cónyuge es electricista, viven en casa propia.
Doña Jessenia es una mujer muy luchadora y que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar puso en su casa una pequeña distribuidora de cervezas y colas, también vende cigarrillos, este negocio lo tiene por más de 15 años. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 20H00. Trabaja sola  para dar una buena atención a los clientes y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar cervezas, colas y cigarrillos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 4 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y agiles.  Su sueño es incrementar su negocio y ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is known as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees.  It has become one of the most important farming and commercial centers in the Manabi province and is an important part of its economy.

Jessenia lives in Portoviejo.  She is 38 years old, married, and has three children who are 12, 10, and 4 years old who attend school.  Her 10 year old son is disabled.  Her husband is an electrician and they live in a house they own.

Jessenia is a hardworking woman.  In order to help with the household expenses, she opened a small store in her home selling beer, sodas, and cigarettes.  She has had this business for more than 15 years.  She works every day from 9:00 am until 8:00 pm.  She works alone so that she can give her customers attention and her business is going very well.

She will use this loan to purchase beer, soda, and cigarettes.  She has been a member of the credit group for four years and she likes that the loans are fast and agile.  Her dream is to grow her business and expand her home.

loans.use: to purchase beer, sodas, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 36-year-old farmer, mother, and Camfed volunteer. She is married and has two children. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Asha teaches life skills to students in her nearby secondary school. Through her lessons, she encourages students to find their own strengths, and to think about how to create a better world. 

Asha is also inspiring for her hard work on her farm: she cultivates her crops with a hand-hoe, and occasionally hires a tractor for farm preparation. Asha depends on the rainy season to plant her crops over the ten 10 hectares of farmland which she owns. Both her parents and the CAMA (Camfed’s alumni network) Agricultural Training taught Asha her farming skills. 

Asha is now requesting a Kiva loan to buy pesticides in order to protect and nourish her plants. She expects to use her profits to cover her family’s household expenses, to help her parents, and to support some vulnerable children struggling in her community. The interest on Asha’s  loan will be repaid through her weekly two-and-a-half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s work with younger students.

loans.use: to buy pesticides in order to protect and nourish her plants

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen is 42 years old and has nine children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by fourteen farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Hellen has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Hellen also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Hellen's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of seven acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet is 66 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by thirteen farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Violet has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2008. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.
